There is only one way to win this war
intelligence is needed  in a format that is globally available, easily
accessible and can be reported in a manner that  unlocks and supports
collaboration for relevant global actions.
The most pressing issue we face is not
Climate Change
column2: rather, it is our inability to work together to demonstrate the

column1: full extent of the environmental problems we are faced with and develop
comprehensive solutions. ECIN2EDIN will concentrate current, fragmented
environmental crime reporting into a visual, cohesive format leading to

informed strategies and battle-plans.

ECIN2EDIN is a progressive platform with multiple applications and will be supported by a multimedia campaign and collaboration platform that empowers those seeking rapid, global environmental solutions
column2: a collaboration network for the gathering of intel, the free-sharing of solutions and the initiation of global actions targeted at rapid change.

column1: ECIN2EDIN has, at its heart, a free Mobile
App (already developed) that allows anyone and everyone to quickly report
environmental crimes and degradation into a database supported by a
back-end/console that is already set up to extract targeted, credible intelligence
reports enabling communities to take appropriate action and authorities and
organisations to better manage the impact their activities are having on the

environment.


This quick-to-use Free Mobile App has
multiple applications.
<ul>
• Geo-referencing
and time/date stamping for legal and managerial processing
• Categorisation
for effective filtering
• 140 character
descriptions for further categorisation and multimedia dissemination
• Photographic
uploads to support evidence management
• Unique ID for
case tracking and anonymity
• Confirmation that
the report has been forwarded to a relevant authority where listed in the global
address book.
Reported crimes will feed into a back-end/console
that will provide 3 levels of access. Access to these levels will support a
number of different participants
<ul>
• The conscious
eco-change-agent who is actively engaged in protecting the planet and realises it is
a global issue
• The NGO that
seeks support in tackling its problems and requires professional intel
gathering and reporting systems
• The municipality
or state entity that wants to ensure environmental crimes are reported into a
central database and not fragmented – an excellent tool for municipal employees to use in
their daily activities
• Nature conservation
entities that need to identify broader trends affecting their protected areas
• Companies whose
operations have an impact on the environment and who seek to manage their impact
and respond to allegations once actioned and resolved or where falsely reported
• Financial Institutions
looking to perform compliance monitoring on clients
<li>
Media outlets,
local and international, that want to keep a watching brief on trends and live
crime reporting.

Costs will be incurred in order to extract intelligence reports but ECIN2EDIN seeks to minimise these  costs to ensure the broadest access. Viewing rights and interactions will be via log-in codes and access levels will allow for a participant to click two fields
column2: a geographic area and an issue topic. For example :

column1: Global                   Company X
South Africa       Rhino poaching
Indonesia             Illegal fishing vessels
Level
1 – $ 10 (US) per month (with a minimum purchase order of 12):
<ul>
• All reported
offences on a heat map related to the issue in that geographic area
• View of the
report (reporter remains anonymous) - photograph, geo-location, time/date
stamp, description and category breakdowns
• View any feedback
from relevant authorities or offenders
• Extract standard
report similar to that demonstrated above. These reports will be modified from
time-to-time based on feedback
• Submit contact
details of relevant authorities to assist in building the global address book
and
• Submit requests
for new categories, geographic focus and notifications to be sent to the
ECIN2EDIN Mobile App network for specific intelligence gathering.
Level
2 – $445 per month (Once-off set up charge of $1500):
<ul>
• All of Level 1
access rights
• A case management
and tracking function
• Communication
with reporters who can elect to  engage or remain anonymous which is their
default position
• Access to the
Console where groups can be uploaded and tracked
• Managed
communication with groups
• Data management,
storage and security
• The ability to
personalise reports for their specific activities.
Level
3 – To be negotiated with interested parties:
<ul>
• An individualised
Mobile App that continues to feed data to ECIN2EDIN but is specific to the
contracting party
• All Level 2
functions and access rights
• Access to the
Console where projects, regions and issues can be grouped
• The ability to
communicate with the entire group or individual projects
• An internal
messaging function.
The
Mobile App and Back-end/Console have been developed and are being trialed. In order to ensure complete
independence, ECIN2EDIN seeks to pre-sell Level 1 monthly reports to cover operational costs for year-one.
Position
Statement:
ECIN2EDIN will gather  people of
environmental conscience who acknowledge that “I am the problem, I am the
solution” and who wish for a world where, to live, they do not destroy the
planet. We are the problem yet, despite yearning and striving for meaningful
change, we continue to be bound to a system that inexplicably believes the
solution will appear from increased consumption of finite resources - compound growth. This
desperate logic and continued, deliberate fragmentation of efforts to achieve
sustainability demands that a new strategy must be implemented globally in the
most efficient manner: ECIN2EDIN places intelligence gathering and
collaboration at the cutting edge of technology to ensure we have the best
chance to achieve sustainability and, if the most dire predictions are correct,
save the planet.
Millions
of concerned individuals and environmental groups try in vain to make a
fundamental, relevant difference
column2: especially as the extent of environmental

column1: degradation increases exponentially. ECIN2EDIN
is the entity that will be greater than the sum of its parts and provide a home
for environmentalists that
the system has disenfranchised.
As vital as a non-fragmented approach to
environmental crime reporting and collaboration is, so too is a level of
integrity that remains beyond reproach. ECIN2EDIN will adhere to the following
principles:
<ul>
• No corporate,
governmental or individual sponsorships or donations
• No limitations on
who can purchase reports
• No ring-fencing
reports for individuals, corporations, NGOs or authorities – no exclusivity
• No consumerism
through branded clothing, etc.
• No limited
liability protection
AND
<ul>
• All reporters
will retain anonymity unless they choose not
• All alleged
offenders will have the right to respond and post ECIN2EDIN Mobile App
responses
• All case
information and responses will be visible and included in any Level 2 report
pertaining to that issue.
Roll-out and
Sustainability:

ECIN2EDIN seeks to raise its annual operational costs through the pre-sale of Level 1 reports in order to ensure independence. It is anticipated that  within one year the sale of Level 1 reports and Level 2 engagements will be sufficient to cover operational costs. Any surpluses generated in the Crowdfunding process will be allocated to growing the platform, increasing collaboration and securing year-two operational costs.
Notes:
It
is hoped that contributors will understand that initial reporting might be slow
and they should select their start date carefully. That said, it
is also hoped that contributors will be ECIN2EDIN eco-change-agents
links to the Mobile App amongst their areas-of-influence, using it as a tool to
trigger actions towards sustainability in their communities, building the
global address book and providing valuable feedback – tackling their issues
while feeding credible and essential data into the sum-of-the-whole.

My Background

My name is Bernd Christian Geels. I was born in Irving, Texas in 1973. My father is an American citizen who grew up in rural Arkansas. My mother is a native citizen of Germany. I developed a deep curiosity in the world around me at an early age. My curiosity made it rather natural for me to later become a scientist. I have studied a variety of disciplines in my formal education. The subjects I have primarily studied include atmospheric science, environmental policy, philosophy, theology and psychology.
My Motivation

I wish to attend the Climate Reality Leadership Corps training offered in Atlanta, Georgia in March, 2019. My education and professional history long ago convinced me that climate change is an urgent policy issue that necessitates an innovative, intensive and creative response at the local, national and international level. Upon completion of the training I wish to contribute my knowledge and passion to inspire meaningful action on this issue in my local community in New England. Given data suggesting we could reach a ""tipping point"" on climate change as soon as 2030 I believe it's vital we move in the direction of creating a more sustainable national and international economy as soon as possible.

A good friend in Atlanta has offered me lodging during the training. I simply need help creating the funds for my travel. In making a contribution towards my travel fund you will ultimately help me work to address our climate challenge in New England and, in effect, throughout the world. What we do every day in ways large and small matters to the future we are creating. I ask that you please help me in this important effort.

I seek to raise $600 to cover the costs of my travel and food expenses for my trip to Atlanta. I have browsed airline tickets and found reasonable offers. Naturally ticket prices will rise as we near the date of the training in mid March. If I am unable to secure sufficient funds to meet my goal I will plan to return the money to those who contribute.
The Impact

Upon completion of the training I will create a presentation that can be customized to address the challenges of climate change particular to the area of Cape Cod and New England. Participants of the Climate Reality Leadership Corps agree to perform ten acts of leadership in the year after their training. Please consult the FAQ section to learn about what constitutes an act of leadership.

I believe this training is very valuable to the world because a fundamental piece of addressing the challenge of climate change is educating the populace to develop a clear understanding of the issue. A number of factors may lead to inaction on pressing policy issues. Awareness of the scope and scale of a problem is critical to cultivating sufficient public will to shift our individual and collective choices.

For those of you unfamiliar with who I am I invite you to visit my blog. During the period of 2013 to 2016 I regularly wrote a trauma recovery blog designed to be a source of both inspiration and education. The blog serves as a good writing sample and example of my commitment to creating a better world.
The Challenge

The main challenge I have in attending this training is raising funds within a limited window of time. I therefore ask you to review my campaign and pose whatever questions you may have. I also invite you to share my campaign with any professional colleagues or personal friends who also deeply care about the issue of climate change.
How You Can Help

If you cannot help me with a contribution to my travel fund that doesn't mean you cannot help at all! If you care deeply about climate change there are many ways you can respond. Here are just a few ideas:
Reduce your use of your car by taking public transportation or carpooling whenever possible. Combine trips as a way of reducing wasteful fuel consumption.
Go to your local library and explore what your city and county are doing right now to address the issue of climate change.
Eat a less carbon intensive diet.

Manage your personal property with sustainability in mind. The flora and fauna of your region will be impacted by climate change. Consider learning about existing research into anticipated impacts and then collaborate with neighbors in an effort to maintain wild and green spaces.

The Wilds of California
Jim Karnik, photographer/filmmaker

Over the last 25 years I have been fortunate to film and photograph much of California's natural landscapes and wildlife while working with conservancies to produce films for broadcast, web and theater presentation. Many of these programs often focus on one small area or habitat of California. However, the habitats and species I am filming do not stand alone they interconnect with others throughout a larger areas called bioregions.

column3:
>California has over 280 threatened
and endangered plant and animal species!

column1: My goal with The Wilds of California is to film and photograph California's varied landscapes based on these bioregions and create an inspirational film and photo presentation that will open eyes, touch hearts and ultimately increase appreciation for California's spectacular and complex natural diversity.

This is a project I have been working on for some time and now and with your support and that of the indiegogo community, I hope to see it completed. Your reward for supporting The Wilds of California goes beyond beautiful DVDs and photographic prints, since I will be working closely with conservation organizations within these bioregions, it is knowing that you are also helping to increase awareness of conservation efforts throughout California.
THE PROJECT
The Wilds of California is a photography &
column2: high definition film project that will increase public awareness and appreciation for the unique beauty of wild habitats and species found in California. The ultimate goal of this project is to reach as large an audience as possible through traveling exhibits, web video, DVD and BluRay distribution.

column1:
THE FILM
The final 60 minute film will include a series visually powerful vignettes on California's 10 Bioregions. What is a bioregion? ""A bioregion is a place that has commonalities of soil, surface water source, landforms, wildlife, climate and culture."" (USGS/BIOREGIONS)

I will be working with nature conservation organizations throughout the state to help determine the best locations to represent California's bioregions. Each segment in the film visually tells the story of a particular habitat unique to that bioregion, highlighting its key species and characteristics. Segments are designed to use cinematic images, natural sounds and limited music to communicate a sense of place. Emphasis will be placed on capturing the natural beauty and complexity of California's wild places through the use of large sensor cameras, a variety of special lenses, camera tracks and jibs. Based on production field notes, an optional narration track on the DVD will provide information about location, trails, geography, plants, animals, and how they are all interconnected. The film can be viewed as either an inspirational visual art piece or an informative nature documentary.
EXHIBIT / PRESENTATION
column4: photography exhibit will premier in San Diego, California in August 2013 and will be made available throughout the state as a traveling exhibit/presentation there after.

column1: In addition, during field production, live presentations on Filming The Wilds of California will be scheduled with local nature conservancies and other community organizations.
ADDITIONAL DISTRIBUTION
<ul>
<li>The film will be available on DVD &amp
• Photographic prints and note card sets will also be available at that time.
• Short clips from the film will be distributed on-line at Vimeo, YouTube and www.fieldnotes.com throughout production.
• Project field notes and discussion topics will be posted on www.fieldnotes.com and The Wilds of California blog.

WHERE DOES THE FUNDING GO?
Working closely with conservation organizations in each bioregion I plan to film California's beautiful landscapes, habitats and species during the winter, spring and summer of 2013.  I will be on location at least a week in each bioregion. The $12,000 funding goal will mainly be used to cover travel and location costs during several multi-week treks in California. It will also be used for DVD replication and some exhibit costs.

column3: />Filming nature and wildlife has many challenges. I will be scheduling production around weather, seasons and migration patterns in an effort to get the best footage possible. Although I do not anticipate any issues, there can always be complications that could delay delivery of the final product. If this should happen contributors will be the first to know and I will do everything possible to get back on track.

column1:
PERKS
Here are some of the great perks contributors may receive:
All sponsors receive a thank you card. If you contribute as a Gift to friends and family, I will send a special gift card to them with your name on it.
<ul>
• DVDs and BluRay disks packaged in eco-friendly cases
• Note card sets printed on 100% recycled paper
• Signed limited edition photographic prints
• Invitations to exhibit presentations
• Full sponsorship credit on film and website
• Major sponsors can have a mini-documentary produced on a California based conservation organization that will be published on-line and included on the DVD.
<div>

column3: />I invite you to share my passion for preserving and protecting California's natural heritage by contributing to this indiegogo project. Again, your reward for supporting The Wilds of California goes beyond DVDs &
column4: prints, it is knowing that you are also promoting the conservation wild places in California.

column1: Please help me reach my goal by contributing to this project today!

I encourage you to explore my website at www.fieldnotes.com to learn more about my background and view the many natural history films currently on-line. If you have any question about the details of this project please contact me at jim@fieldnotes.com
Thank you.
Jim Karnik, photographer/filmmaker

Short clips from the film will be distributed on-line at Vimeo, YouTube and www.fieldnotes.com throughout production.
Project field notes and discussion topics will be posted on www.fieldnotes.com and The Wilds of California blog.

WHERE DOES THE FUNDING GO?Working closely with conservation organizations in each bioregion I plan to film California's beautiful landscapes, habitats and species during the winter, spring and summer of 2013.  I will be on location at least a week in each bioregion. The $12,000 funding goal will mainly be used to cover travel and location costs during several multi-week treks in California. It will also be used for DVD replication and some exhibit costs.

Filming nature and wildlife has many challenges. I will be scheduling production around weather, seasons and migration patterns in an effort to get the best footage possible. Although I do not anticipate any issues, there can always be complications that could delay delivery of the final product. If this should happen contributors will be the first to know and I will do everything possible to get back on track.
PERKS Here are some of the great perks contributors may receive:
All sponsors receive a thank you card. If you contribute as a  Gift to friends and family, I will send a special gift card to them with your name on it.
DVDs and BluRay disks packaged in eco-friendly cases
Note card sets printed on 100% recycled paper
Signed limited edition photographic prints
Invitations to exhibit presentations
Full sponsorship credit on film and website
Major sponsors can have a mini-documentary produced on a California based conservation organization that will be published on-line and included on the DVD.

I invite you to share my passion for preserving and protecting California's natural heritage by contributing to this indiegogo project. Again, your reward for supporting The Wilds of California goes beyond DVDs & prints, it is knowing that you are also promoting the conservation wild places in California.
Please help me reach my goal by contributing to this project today!

I encourage you to explore my website at www.fieldnotes.com to learn more about my background and view the many natural history films currently on-line. If you have any question about the details of this project please contact me at jim@fieldnotes.com
Thank you.
Jim Karnik, photographer/filmmaker",10.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Encinitas, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-wilds-of-california/pica

MESH - Modular Ecologically Sustainable Habitat
We are Max Living &
column3: construction company. We have taken on a misson at attempting to create a meeting ground for 'green building' and affordability.  After a year of research, sketching, design and re-design we came up with MESH, a habitat that conserves and recycles water, produces its own gas for cooking and uses solar panels for energy.   MESH is designed for 'off-grid' living. Essentially it needs no infrastructure.

column1: We are using a 20-foot shipping container and are recycling it into a comfortable 672 square foot dwelling, complete with kitchen, bathroom, storage and even a small pool.  When finished, it is designed to fold back up into itself with all its materials and furniture making it highly mobile.  We are combining new and old technologies to make this concept affordable.  We have purchased all the materials, retrofitted the container with a steel company, built the shell and we are now set up on some farmland in Lake Geneva in the final building stages.
Why is this Important?
MESH deals with issues that are becoming essential to our continued way of life
column2: efficient usage and preservation of water, energy conservation and creation through solar power and biogas, and making sustainable housing affordable.

column1: MESH is intended to start a dialogue and challenge others to work on making ‘green’ affordable and accessible.  This home in a box represents possibilities.  If a husband and wife team can create an affordable alternative with their savings, then so can major companies with unlimited funds.
What We Need

We need an additional $5000 to finish, fine tune and open MESH up to the public.  At this time MESH is an art installation, but future possibilities are vast including FEMA homes, lake cabins, modular homes even an off grid sustainable hotel.

Help launch neighbour-to-neighbour car-sharing in Coogee!
We need to raise $5,000 to turn 5 regular cars into share cars.

We launched our neighbour-to-neighbour car-sharing platform in Bondi, Bronte and Paddington in December 2012. Our in-car technology and online booking platform let anyone turn their car into a share car, and rent it by the hour or day to their neighbours.

This means that people can live car-free most of the time, knowing they can use a car when they really need one. People who car-share end up driving around 40% less, so it's great for the environment and for people's health. Sharing things with neighbours also helps build a sense of community. Plus, everyone saves money.

As you can hear from some of our members in the video below, Car Next Door has really changed the way people use cars. We are really keen to spread the neighbour-to-neighbour car-sharing revolution to Coogee, but it costs money to get each new car up and sharing.
We need your support to bring 5 new cars into the Car Next Door fleet. In return you will save a packet on the cost of borrowing a car (or joining as an owner) when we get to Coogee.
What is Car Next Door?
We created Car Next Door to:
<ul>
• Build community
• Help the environment, and
• Save people money.

It's Australia's first Neighbour-to-Neighbour car-sharing platform, and lets you rent cars from your neighbours from $5 an hour or $25 a day.  As a Car Owner, you can make $2-10,000 per year by sharing your car when you’re not using it.
Car Next Door is also a certified carbon-neutral service. We offset all of the emissions from borrowers' driving.
Our vision: less cars, better cities

Car Next Door's aim is to reduce Australians' dependency on personal vehicle ownership. By enabling Australians to share their cars with neighbours, we want to fundamentally change the way people make their transport decisions.

We want to get away from 'driving by default' and encourage people to make a conscious decision about how best to get from A to B each time they want to travel. Pay-per-use car access gives people the economic incentives they need to make better choices. 

Neighbour-to-neighbour car-sharing cuts personal transportation costs, permanently removes cars from the Australian vehicle fleet, reduces emissions of greenhouse gases and local air pollutants and fosters greater community engagement.
Where are we at now?

Since our launch in December 2012 we have added 40+ share cars to the streets of Bondi, Tamarama, Bronte, Waverly, Bondi Junction, Queens Park, Woollahra and Paddington and have over 400 borrowers using these share cars as means to get around, move house, pick up family at the airport or to take a road trip.
Watch the video below to see what our current members think about Car Next Door:
Want to get involved?
What we need

To launch in Coogee we need at least 5 cars. All of the money raised will go towards installing the in-car device in 5 Coogee residents' cars and creating community awareness so that people will join up and borrow them.  If we dont reach our target, you will be refunded your money, and we will delay our Coogee launch.
What impact will this have?

We envision neighbourhoods in five to ten years’ time where most people don’t have to own a car. They can share the cars of the ten to fifteen car owners who live within a 100-metre walk from their home.  Once our network hits this type of critical mass, there will be a massive ‘de car-ing’ of metropolitan Australia. This will bring huge environmental and community benefits (e.g. less congestion and pollution, less need to allocate land for parking spots, and higher public transport adoption).
It will also reduce personal transport costs.
What You Get

Apart from our undying gratitute, each pledge value gets you bonus Car Next Door Credit. There are different values and perks for existing and new members. Everyone who pledges will be included on a 'Legends Wall' on our website, so we can say a public thank you for contribution.

Credit can be used to pay for hourly or daily car hire, as well as the per-km charge to cover the petrol. If you are interested in sharing your car, this credit will go towards your monthly membership.
PLEASE NOTE: Indiegogo does not operate in Australian Dollars. The value you pledge will be charged in USD.
Current Member's Perks
Current members will receive the value they have pledged plus 10% bonus credit.
For a clearer idea of what each value equates to see the table below:
New Member's Perks
New members will receive the value they have pledged in Car Next Door credits (with
column2: >substantial interest). The more you pledge the greater the reward.

column1: For a clearer idea of what each value equates to see the table below:
<h3><span style=""font-size: 1.17em
These requirements apply to both Owners and Borrowers.
To be eligible, you must:
<ul>
<li>be at least 21 years old
<li>have no licence suspensions or disqualifications, major violations or alcohol/drug related incidents in the past 5 years
<li>hold a full unrestricted licence and have been licensed for at least two years
<li>have an appropriate credit or debit card that has the capacity to hold a pre-authorisation that is the equivalent to your Accident Damage Excess
• have a satisfactory credit history.

Note: If you are not a permanent resident or citizen of Australia we may require a $500 deposit that will be refunded to you within 5 days of you cancelling your membership with us, or providing proof of permanent residency or citizenship.
Car Owners Vehicle Requirements
For your vehicle to be eligible, it must:
<ul>
<li>be registered in New South Wales with a Business Use classification. The CTP Greenslip must also be classified Business Use
<li>be well maintained:
<ul>

• Upon applying to join Car Next Door, Owners may be required to submit documented
    proof of the last major service performed.

• Owners are expected to properly schedule and record maintenance of the vehicles using
    the applicable manufacturer’s maintenance schedule as a guide.
<li>be manufactured on or after the year 2000
<li>have fewer than 200,000 kms
• have a value of less than $50,000 being the midpoint of the “Private Price Guide” as provided by RedBook
<li>have not been altered in a way that materially changes the performance, appearance or purpose of the Vehicle where Car Next Door determines there may be a liability concern
<li>have a power rating of less than 225 kilowatts (300 kilowatts for 4WDs)
<li>have seating for a maximum of 8 passengers
<li>be a private passenger vehicle with four wheels
• not be recorded as “written-off”.
Other ways you can help

Not flush right now? No worries, you can still get involved by spreading the word to your family, friends and colleagues by using the social media sharing buttons at the top of the page. Don't live in Coogee, but want to get involved? You can also register interest on our website www.carnextdoor.com.au
FAQ's
Q: I am keen to support you and this campaign, can I pledge and never use the value?
A: Oui, sì, ja, Dui, Hai. Yes absolutely, pledge away you legend!
Q: I am not a member and I don't live in or anywhere near the suburbs you have currently have cars in. Can I pledge now and save the value for when you open in my suburb?
A: Yes you can pledge now and we will just hold your value against your name until we launch in your suburb.
Have more questions?
Get in touch with us at the below:
E: merryn@carnextdoor.com.au

The Premise:

Keeping the ELA an active research facility will continue its program of ongoing research, maintaining the integrity of its longitudinal data collection, and permitting researchers to plan for future research projects.
This is a non-partisan attempt to keep the ELA research facility open by raising sufficient funds, public interest and authenticity to assume responsiblity for its management and operation.

I anticipate that in the future this research facility will have to function on a cost-recovery basis, although non-federal governmental and/or institutional support may be feasible. I am a private citizen with no political affiliation, nor any professional affiliation with the EAL. As an archaeologist, I appreciate the importance of scientific research and data, and fear the loss that the closure of this facility will result in.
<div>
The Money

The Canadian government will save approximately $600K from the closure of this research facility, hence the proposed target. If we reach it, we can proceed: if not, you get your money back (that is the strucutre of this crowdsource funding through IndieGogo.com).
<div>
That's it

You can help with money, and you can help with spreading the word. If this works, that's great: if not, we gave it a go, and life goes on. I would prefer if we can keep up the research, one year at a time.
For more information:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Experimental_Lakes_Area
and,
http://www.experimentallakesarea.ca/ELA_Website.html

Images are reproductions of an official work that is published by the Government of Canada: these reproductions have not been produced in affiliation with, or with the endorsement of the Government of Canada.

UPDATE:
City Bin in the news!
http://www.chinesedailyusa.com/article/article-c167308.aspx
http://la.worldjournal.com/view/full_la/21394382/article-%E5%AE%B6%E5%BA%AD%E5%BB%9A%E9%A4%98%E8%A3%BD%E5%A0%86%E8%82%A5-%E6%9C%80%E7%92%B0%E4%BF%9D?instance=lafas
<h3>Watch the new City Bin infomercial! <a href=""http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xgtmIWti-dU&amp

We are so thankful for all our supporters! While there are set perks, please don't feel that you have contribute a certain amount to help.  If you like what we are about, please contribute a dollar or whatever you can now before you forget. We are genuinely, sincerely grateful for your generosity!
Who We Are
Thank you for joining us in the composting revolution!

My name is Vivian Liao, and I am a Los Angeles-based environmental engineer. I am also a molecular biologist by training.  As the founder of City Earthworm, LLC, I (with the help of T2 Design in Santa Monica, CA) have designed the City Bin, an indoor composter that will not only elevate the relatively marginal status of composting but convince the average person that they CAN and WANT to compost.  Julia Barnett is a musician, avid enviromentalist, and a recent composting convert.  With your help, we hope to make household composting as much a part of the average American's life as brushing one's teeth.

Trash is a growing national and global problem.  According to the Clear Air Council and Garbology Challenge, America accounts for over one-third of the world's waste. Most of that trash ends up in landfills. In the United States, one ton of waste per person ends up in landfills each year. Also, about seventy percent of U.S. municipal waste is buried in landfills. Aside from the Great Wall of China, the Fresh Kills landfill in New York City is the only man made structure visible from space!

However, the growing trash situation is a problem we can all help solve by composting.  Composting is quite possibly the most wonderful thing a single individual can do for the environment.  It is even more beneficial than the recycling of household materials that so many of us already practice.  If you are a gardener, composting also produces the BEST FOOD YOUR PLANTS HAVE EVER MET.  Just by feeding our food waste to the City Bin, we will extend the life of our landfills and vastly reduce the release of greenhouse gases into our atmosphere (and this is just the tip of the iceberg of benefits!).  Composting is also the perfect educational activity for teaching kids about biology, ecology, and global warming (NOTE: 5% of our profits will be donated to local schools).

Unfortunately, the common perception of indoor household composting remains a combination of ""Eww, gross!"", ""I'd love to, but I just don't have the space"", ""So much work!"", and ""Those composters sure are large, ugly, and expensive!"".

The City Bin changes all of that.  It will be made of recycled plastic and responsibly manufactured in Los Angeles.  It utilizes a space-saving design that will also minimize the materials used in shipping (another environmental benefit!).  It is the size of an average bathroom waste basket and, importantly, something you would be happy to leave on display in your home (instead of hidden under the sink).
Join us in making composting possible for everyone!
<h3><strong>What We Need &amp
<div>
Your contributions will help us pay for:
<ul>
• injection molds (4 pieces) =$60,000
• 1000 units produced at UPM (Baldwin Park, CA) = $12,000 (made locally here in LA out of recycled materials
• Indiegogo fees
No matter what amount you donate, we'd like to help you start composting!
Premiums include
<ul>
• Shout-out on the website
• ""Just Add Water"" Complete City Bin kit which includes the City Bin, bedding, earthworms, and instructions on how to begin composting in your very own home
• ""Compost"" by Douglas Green Kindle Edition e-book
• Donation of ""Just Add Water"" Complete City Bin Kit to classroom(s) of your choice
• Personal Composting Tutorial and Tech Support - we will teach you everything you need to know to compost at home!
<div>
The Impact
NOTE: 5% of profits will be donated to local schools to jumpstart their own sustainability practices.

By contributing to the City Bin by City Earthworm campaign, you will become part of a movement to revolutionize how the average citizen interacts with the environment.  According to the EPA, more than 34 million tons of food waste was generated in 2010, and they account for 14% of all municipal solid waste. Food waste is also the single largest contributor to landfills and incinerators.  The following things happen when we dump food waste into landfills:
<ul>

• As food rots, greenhouse gases like methane are produced and enter the atmosphere, intensifying the global climate changes we are already experiencing (methane, by the way, has a Global Warming Potential that is 21 times worse than carbon dioxide).

• Food waste takes up LOTS of room in landfills.  Our existing landfills have an average of 28 years left, according to Waste Management in its 2006 Annual Report.  More waste = shorter landfill lifespan. It’s simple math.
• We use more synthetic fertilizers and pesticides, which pollute our waters.
In contrast, when we compost, all of the potential within food is realized.  By composting:
<ul>
• Food waste becomes food for bacteria and fungi.  Decomposition by bacteria and fungi turns food waste into highly nutritious fertilizer for plants, with natural pesticides!
• The amount of waste going into landfills and garbage disposals is dramatically reduced.
• The amount of greenhouse gases coming from landfills will also be reduced.
• The amount of food waste sent down garbage disposals is reduced, lessening the load on our wastewater treatment plants.
• Your trash will be less stinky!
• You can even sell your compost!
• You can teach your children valuable lessons about biology, ecology, and sustainability.
Many composters already exist on the market.  However, most of them have failed to turn composting into a common household practice because they are:
<ul>
• Large and bulky
• Require strength to turn and dispose of compost
• Require the user to have a yard/chickens (for example, Bokashi alone/grub composting)
• Do not turn the waste into fully useable compost (Bokashi alone)
• Require lots of effort
• Unattractive!

In spite of all this, more and more people are starting to compost (awesome!).  The most popular method of indoor composting for average households is vermicomposting, which uses particular species of earthworms to break down kitchen waste.  The City Bin will utilize vermicomposting and has the following advantages over current models:
<ul>
• It has a sleek, modern design that will fit in with any style of household décor.
• It is the size of a bathroom wastebasket and can easily fit in the kitchen, bathroom, under the sink, or on a balcony.
• It produces fully useable compost.
• It does not require super strength to turn.
• It is so easy to use, one could train a child to compost using the City Bin.
• For those who already compost, it eliminates the need for a separate kitchen waste collector.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Show our video to your friends and use the Indiegogo share tools!
Spread the word about the City Bin and composting in general.
Check us out on Facebook.

COMPOST!
","UPDATE:
City Bin in the news!
http://www.chinesedailyusa.com/article/article-c167308.aspx
http://la.worldjournal.com/view/full_la/21394382/article-%E5%AE%B6%E5%BA%AD%E5%BB%9A%E9%A4%98%E8%A3%BD%E5%A0%86%E8%82%A5-%E6%9C%80%E7%92%B0%E4%BF%9D?instance=lafas
Watch the new City Bin infomercial! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xgtmIWti-dU&feature=youtu.be

We are so thankful for all our supporters! While there are set perks, please don't feel that you have contribute a certain amount to help.  If you like what we are about, please contribute a dollar or whatever you can now before you forget. We are genuinely, sincerely grateful for your generosity!
Who We Are
Thank you for joining us in the composting revolution!

My name is Vivian Liao, and I am a Los Angeles-based environmental engineer. I am also a molecular biologist by training.  As the founder of City Earthworm, LLC, I (with the help of T2 Design in Santa Monica, CA) have designed the City Bin, an indoor composter that will not only elevate the relatively marginal status of composting but convince the average person that they CAN and WANT to compost.  Julia Barnett is a musician, avid enviromentalist, and a recent composting convert.  With your help, we hope to make household composting as much a part of the average American's life as brushing one's teeth.

Trash is a growing national and global problem.  According to the Clear Air Council and Garbology Challenge, America accounts for over one-third of the world's waste. Most of that trash ends up in landfills. In the United States, one ton of waste per person ends up in landfills each year. Also, about seventy percent of U.S. municipal waste is buried in landfills. Aside from the Great Wall of China, the Fresh Kills landfill in New York City is the only man made structure visible from space!

However, the growing trash situation is a problem we can all help solve by composting.  Composting is quite possibly the most wonderful thing a single individual can do for the environment.  It is even more beneficial than the recycling of household materials that so many of us already practice.  If you are a gardener, composting also produces the BEST FOOD YOUR PLANTS HAVE EVER MET.  Just by feeding our food waste to the City Bin, we will extend the life of our landfills and vastly reduce the release of greenhouse gases into our atmosphere (and this is just the tip of the iceberg of benefits!).  Composting is also the perfect educational activity for teaching kids about biology, ecology, and global warming (NOTE: 5% of our profits will be donated to local schools).

Unfortunately, the common perception of indoor household composting remains a combination of ""Eww, gross!"", ""I'd love to, but I just don't have the space"", ""So much work!"", and ""Those composters sure are large, ugly, and expensive!"".

The City Bin changes all of that.  It will be made of recycled plastic and responsibly manufactured in Los Angeles.  It utilizes a space-saving design that will also minimize the materials used in shipping (another environmental benefit!).  It is the size of an average bathroom waste basket and, importantly, something you would be happy to leave on display in your home (instead of hidden under the sink).
Join us in making composting possible for everyone!
What We Need & What You Get
Your contributions will help us pay for:
injection molds (4 pieces) =$60,000
1000 units produced at UPM (Baldwin Park, CA) = $12,000 (made locally here in LA out of recycled materials
Indiegogo fees
No matter what amount you donate, we'd like to help you start composting!
Premiums include
Shout-out on the website
Just Add Water"" Complete City Bin kit which includes the City Bin, bedding, earthworms, and instructions on how to begin composting in your very own home
Compost"" by Douglas Green Kindle Edition e-book
Donation of ""Just Add Water"" Complete City Bin Kit to classroom(s) of your choice
Personal Composting Tutorial and Tech Support - we will teach you everything you need to know to compost at home!
The Impact
NOTE: 5% of profits will be donated to local schools to jumpstart their own sustainability practices.

By contributing to the City Bin by City Earthworm campaign, you will become part of a movement to revolutionize how the average citizen interacts with the environment.  According to the EPA, more than 34 million tons of food waste was generated in 2010, and they account for 14% of all municipal solid waste. Food waste is also the single largest contributor to landfills and incinerators.  The following things happen when we dump food waste into landfills:

As food rots, greenhouse gases like methane are produced and enter the atmosphere, intensifying the global climate changes we are already experiencing (methane, by the way, has a Global Warming Potential that is 21 times worse than carbon dioxide).

Food waste takes up LOTS of room in landfills.  Our existing landfills have an average of 28 years left, according to Waste Management in its 2006 Annual Report.  More waste = shorter landfill lifespan. It’s simple math.
We use more synthetic fertilizers and pesticides, which pollute our waters.
In contrast, when we compost, all of the potential within food is realized.  By composting:
Food waste becomes food for bacteria and fungi.  Decomposition by bacteria and fungi turns food waste into highly nutritious fertilizer for plants, with natural pesticides!
The amount of waste going into landfills and garbage disposals is dramatically reduced.
The amount of greenhouse gases coming from landfills will also be reduced.
The amount of food waste sent down garbage disposals is reduced, lessening the load on our wastewater treatment plants.
Your trash will be less stinky!
You can even sell your compost!
You can teach your children valuable lessons about biology, ecology, and sustainability.
Many composters already exist on the market.  However, most of them have failed to turn composting into a common household practice because they are:
Large and bulky
Require strength to turn and dispose of compost
Require the user to have a yard/chickens (for example, Bokashi alone/grub composting)
Do not turn the waste into fully useable compost (Bokashi alone)
Require lots of effort
Unattractive!

In spite of all this, more and more people are starting to compost (awesome!).  The most popular method of indoor composting for average households is vermicomposting, which uses particular species of earthworms to break down kitchen waste.  The City Bin will utilize vermicomposting and has the following advantages over current models:
It has a sleek, modern design that will fit in with any style of household décor.
It is the size of a bathroom wastebasket and can easily fit in the kitchen, bathroom, under the sink, or on a balcony.
It produces fully useable compost.
It does not require super strength to turn.
It is so easy to use, one could train a child to compost using the City Bin.
For those who already compost, it eliminates the need for a separate kitchen waste collector.
Other Ways You Can Help
Show our video to your friends and use the Indiegogo share tools!
Spread the word about the City Bin and composting in general.
Check us out on Facebook.
Become more mindful about how much you consume and how much you throw into the trash.

Il Filosofo e autore Andrea N. Feltrin, il divulgatore e artigiano Pellegrino e l'attivista ambientalista Eleonora Vecchi (già autori del documentario ""Soluzione Finale: voci dall'Antropocene"", disponibile gratuitamente su YouTube)  sono da diversi impegnati in progetti ecologici, sociali e di sensibilizzazione. L' intento di questo progetto è replicare e ampliare i risultati ottenuti con la loro precedente opera.
Il precedente documentario, quasi interamente autoprodotto, è stato realizzato con attrezzature personali e di fortuna.
A seconda del budget raccolto si potranno rinnovare i mezzi tecnologici e coprire gli spostamenti necessari per le riprese.

Qualora il budget eccedesse la richiesta sarà possibile localizzare il documentario anche in altre lingue, implementare contenuti extra (backstage, colonna sonora originale, etc) e investire nella sua diffusione.

A little story about me:
How Fire, Fall And Flight relates to me.  Magnificent Fire
column2: We did a lot of camping when I was a kid and I always thought the fires we had were so mesmerizing.  Even the glowing tip of a stick was awesome unless you burned your best friends dad with it.  Cascading Waterfalls
column3: I have always loved the water, could be because my Astrological sign is a Pisces (The Fish).  We had a pool growing up and someone was always getting thrown in with all their clothes on.  Some of the best times in the neighborhood.  Butterflies have a deep meaning to me, a spirit of the soul. To me its a feeling of hope.  A butterfly has to go thru an amazing transformation just like we do at some point in our lives. I just want to make a difference and bring back the Monarchs and preserve the beauty of our planet.

column1: Why this is Important to me:  I really want to share the Beauty in the pictures that I have taken over the years and inform or teach people about the beauty, the changes of our planet and what everyone can do to help preserve it.  More people need to care and I hope they will.
<ul>

• This book is just a test to a much bigger plan and if all goes well I will be able to teach on a much bigger scale. My BIG idea If I make enough money from this I plan on purchasing a piece of property to build a teaching tree house and butterfly sanctuary.

• There are a lot of things we can do to help our pollinators. #1 Stop using pesticides. There are so many natural things we can use. People often don't take the time or think its a big deal to take small steps in helping our environment.
• I want to bring back a few campaigns that are simple yet powerful. I thing most people need to be reminded and do their part so we can all enjoy our beautiful planet for years to come.
Getting Started:  To get started I need to pay the publisher $1300 then after that each book will be printed one at a time. No waste.
• If I don't reach my goal the money will be returned but I am confident that I will surpass my goal and be able to get this beautiful book into a lot of peoples hands and on their coffee tables.
Risks &
My biggest challenge is technology. Trying to do videos, edit them, post them. I will figure a way to get the word out.
<ul>
• I am determined to spread the word about Monarchs and why their numbers have been declining. People still don't realize that they can help in little ways.
• I hope to have easy to follow steps in my book that people can take to do their share and help our pollinators and environment.
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: It's Okay if you can't contribute to Fund my project but you can contribute by sharing this information and getting the word out. Please share with at least 10 people you know. You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thank you for your time and attention and helping me create a dream.
Thanks for caring!!

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Short Summary

Climate change is one of the most crucial global environmental problems of mankind. Human activity increases the concentration of greenhouse gases (GHG) in the atmosphere. Searching for a way of reducing GHG emissions is a burning issue. Electricity generation is often the most prominent GHG emission category that is closely related to the economic activities of any country.

Nowadays renewable energy becomes popularity in different countries. States leaderships, electricity companies as private persons are interested in renewable energy, especially in solar energy. However, for the implementation of effective decisions on the development of this industry on a certain territory, it is necessary to have appropriate tools for analyzing the potential of solar energy, as well as for predicting the volumes of electricity production taking into account the main factors that have an impact on electricity generation. In addition, the availability of such software will allow assessing the level of potential reduction of GHG emissions in the practical application of solar energy.

The purpose of this project is to develop a universal approach, mathematical models, algorithms and software tools for spatial analysis of solar energy potential and prediction of electricity-producing amount taking into account the weather conditions
column2: to perform numerical experiments for creation georeferenced databases for spatial analysis of solar energy potential and evaluation of electricity production amount in the future.

column1: <h3>What We Need &amp

To implement the project I would like to get $50,000 (fifty thousand us dollars). This cost includes website and software development, its testing, approbation and supporting, paying for using cloud technologies (servers, virtual machines, software, and others), participation in scientific conferences, traveling to the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (Laxenburg, Austria), Systems Research Institute of the Polish Academy of Sciences (Warsaw, Poland), China University of Mining and Technology (Beijing, China) or NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (Maryland, USA) to get consultation from leading scientists, publication of results in scientific journals.
I'm awarded a 3,0-month scholarship from the Austrian Agency for International Cooperation in Education &
column3: Mobility (ICM) and will carry out the research in International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (Laxenburg, Austria) from the first of February 2019 to by the thirtieth of April 2019.

column1: Also, my project has been awarded a year grant (AI for Earth, Microsoft) that includes $ 10,000 in Azure credits (started on November 19, 2018).
This funding is a good start for my project, but it is not enough for its successful implementation.

In recent years, I have gained considerable practical experience in developing approaches, mathematical models and software tools for spatial analysis of greenhouse gas emissions in the energy sector (subcategory: electricity and heat production). The results of my past research are an important basis for making effective decisions on greenhouse gas emission reductions both at the state level and at the level of individual economic entities, in particular, in the power generating industry. The development of solar energy is the key to reducing emissions and improving the ecological situation on the planet. This project proposal is a logical prolongation of my previous scientific projects in terms of reducing the level of greenhouse gas emissions and allows us to solve a lot of problems that arise when developing an action plan for the development of the solar energy industry. The acquired theoretical and practical experience in previous scientific projects is the key to the successful implementation of the presented project proposal. Also, I have contacts with leading scientists of the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (Laxenburg, Austria), Systems Research Institute of the Polish Academy of Sciences (Warsaw, Poland), China University of Mining and Technology (Beijing, China) and NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (Maryland, USA), which carry out researches in the fields of greenhouse gases inventory and renewable energy. In addition to scientific institutions, I have contacts with the management of several solar and wind power plants who are interested in the future results and are ready to provide real data on a royalty-free basis for the validation of developed approaches, mathematical models and software tools. I am convinced that my practical experience of previous scientific projects, connections with leading international scientific institutions and electricity producing enterprises of the renewable energy sector will allow me to successfully fulfill all tasks of the project proposal. This project addresses the challenge of spatial analysis of solar energy potential on different levels (country, region or local level) including the main parameters that have an impact on electricity generation processes.
The Impact

In recent decades, the problem of negative climate changes has arisen. An increasing the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere of the planet tirelessly promotes the cause of an average annual temperature increasing, melting of glaciers, world ocean level rise as well as frequent and prolonged droughts. This is also evidenced by numerous studies by world-renowned scholars. As for today, humanity has put considerable effort into researching greenhouse gas emissions in the atmosphere of the planet and identifying sources of emissions. The energy sector, in particular, the power generation sector, produces the largest amount of greenhouse emissions. The best way to reduce them is to use renewable energy sources, in particular, solar energy, wind, water, and others. Today solar energy is dynamically developed but there are a lot of problems that must be solved for the sustainability of this branch. That's why the main focus of the proposal is on this type of renewable energy.

Scientists developed a lot of ways to transform solar energy into electricity, but there are parameters that affect the productivity of electricity generation. For instance, solar radiation, temperature, geographical location, cloudiness, and others. It is necessary to calculate and analyze these parameters before choosing the type of solar power station and its building. The best way to get reliable parameters is to do spatial analysis of the potential of solar energy using GIS and open source data.

Consequently, the development of an easy-to-use tool for spatial-distributed analysis of the potential of solar energy remains an open challenge. Such tool will provide new possibilities for solar energy potential analysis and help scientists and policymakers to find ways for the development of solar energy production and to evaluate possible financial benefits from the development of this branch in different regions.

The opportunity to use digital and geoinformation technologies as an important step toward helping to solve the tasks of spatial analysis of solar energy potential with automatic forming the georeferenced cadasters of solar energy potential with taking into account the main parameters that have an impact on electricity generation processes. The approach with using artificial intelligence can provide automatically building the input databases for geospatial analysis of solar energy potential and the results of computer simulation of solar energy potential distribution. The key advantages of such way to solve problems related to solar energy analysis, supporting and developing this branch are the reducing of usage manual work, low cost, take into account the main parameters of electricity generating processes (sunny, cloudy and windy days, wind speed, rain precipitations, air temperature, and others), quick results getting, an opportunity to adapt models to the new needs and features of producing circles, and others.

The practical value of the expected results is the ability to identify territories automatically with sufficient energy potential for the construction of power generating enterprises and forecasting potentially possible volumes of electricity production. The developed approaches based on modern digital and geoinformation technologies will serve as an effective tool for politicians and government bodies in making decisions about the allocation of limited funds for the development of solar energy power plants in the case it has the maximum effect in terms of emission reductions and will ensure the sustainable economic development of the region. In addition, the results of such research will be of interest to private investors in terms of making decisions on investing in renewable energy in the region.

The obtained practical experience is quite valuable and can be used in studies of the potential of another renewable energy sources at different levels and in processes of estimating and forecasting electricity production volumes using renewable sources and taking into account many factors of influence, including weather conditions and would also apply to other similar modeling challenges with using artificial intelligence, digital and geoinformation technologies.
<h3>Risks &amp

The main risk of the proposed solution is developing the correct mathematical model and its validation. The main challenge is to identify the dependencies between all the major parameters that affect the processes of generating electricity using solar energy. Today I have already developed a draft description of the model and its main parameters. But the mathematical description of solar energy potential needs improving and deep validation. The model validation will be based on comparing the gotten results of mathematical simulation and real statistical data of the amount of electricity production from existed solar power plants. Such approach to model validation based on my past experience in spatial analysis and mathematical modeling of GHG emission in electricity and heat generation sector. Last eight years I was a team member of the research group that managed and executed different scientific projects related to spatial analysis and mathematical modeling of GHG emissions in different sectors of human activities. All activities in these projects focused on the development of approaches, mathematical models and software tools for spatial analysis and creation of databases of GHG emission in all sectors of human activities. Considerable attention was paid to the uncertainty analysis of the results and this practical experience is very important in case of successful execution the tasks of spatial analysis of solar energy potential.

The next risk, I think, is the creation of detailed input datasets. In this case, the main accent will be focused on open source data. For instance, a lot of valuable information related to spatial analysis of solar energy potential is provided by NASA, Google, and other companies. The approach with using digital technologies and artificial intelligence has a big advantage because it allows the researcher to train the model by using real datasets and taking into account a lot of parameters that have an impact on electricity generation processes.
Other Ways You Can Help

I'll be very happy and very thankful for any help. Also, I'm ready to discuss any proposals and collaborations that can help me to fundraise and to implement my ideas in the framework of this project proposal. I hope that the results of my research and my project will use by all interested communities and will be very useful for everyone because we have the greatest task of all time: save the environment for the future generation.

column1: What We Need & What You Get

To implement the project I would like to get $50,000 (fifty thousand us dollars). This cost includes website and software development, its testing, approbation and supporting, paying for using cloud technologies (servers, virtual machines, software, and others), participation in scientific conferences, traveling to the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (Laxenburg, Austria), Systems Research Institute of the Polish Academy of Sciences (Warsaw, Poland), China University of Mining and Technology (Beijing, China) or NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (Maryland, USA) to get consultation from leading scientists, publication of results in scientific journals.

I'm awarded a 3,0-month scholarship from the Austrian Agency for International Cooperation in Education & Research (OeAD-GmbH), Centre for International Cooperation & Mobility (ICM) and will carry out the research in International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (Laxenburg, Austria) from the first of February 2019 to by the thirtieth of April 2019.
Also, my project has been awarded a year grant (AI for Earth, Microsoft) that includes $ 10,000 in Azure credits (started on November 19, 2018).
This funding is a good start for my project, but it is not enough for its successful implementation.

In recent years, I have gained considerable practical experience in developing approaches, mathematical models and software tools for spatial analysis of greenhouse gas emissions in the energy sector (subcategory: electricity and heat production). The results of my past research are an important basis for making effective decisions on greenhouse gas emission reductions both at the state level and at the level of individual economic entities, in particular, in the power generating industry. The development of solar energy is the key to reducing emissions and improving the ecological situation on the planet. This project proposal is a logical prolongation of my previous scientific projects in terms of reducing the level of greenhouse gas emissions and allows us to solve a lot of problems that arise when developing an action plan for the development of the solar energy industry. The acquired theoretical and practical experience in previous scientific projects is the key to the successful implementation of the presented project proposal. Also, I have contacts with leading scientists of the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (Laxenburg, Austria), Systems Research Institute of the Polish Academy of Sciences (Warsaw, Poland), China University of Mining and Technology (Beijing, China) and NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (Maryland, USA), which carry out researches in the fields of greenhouse gases inventory and renewable energy. In addition to scientific institutions, I have contacts with the management of several solar and wind power plants who are interested in the future results and are ready to provide real data on a royalty-free basis for the validation of developed approaches, mathematical models and software tools. I am convinced that my practical experience of previous scientific projects, connections with leading international scientific institutions and electricity producing enterprises of the renewable energy sector will allow me to successfully fulfill all tasks of the project proposal. This project addresses the challenge of spatial analysis of solar energy potential on different levels (country, region or local level) including the main parameters that have an impact on electricity generation processes.
The Impact

In recent decades, the problem of negative climate changes has arisen. An increasing the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere of the planet tirelessly promotes the cause of an average annual temperature increasing, melting of glaciers, world ocean level rise as well as frequent and prolonged droughts. This is also evidenced by numerous studies by world-renowned scholars. As for today, humanity has put considerable effort into researching greenhouse gas emissions in the atmosphere of the planet and identifying sources of emissions. The energy sector, in particular, the power generation sector, produces the largest amount of greenhouse emissions. The best way to reduce them is to use renewable energy sources, in particular, solar energy, wind, water, and others. Today solar energy is dynamically developed but there are a lot of problems that must be solved for the sustainability of this branch. That's why the main focus of the proposal is on this type of renewable energy.

Scientists developed a lot of ways to transform solar energy into electricity, but there are parameters that affect the productivity of electricity generation. For instance, solar radiation, temperature, geographical location, cloudiness, and others. It is necessary to calculate and analyze these parameters before choosing the type of solar power station and its building. The best way to get reliable parameters is to do spatial analysis of the potential of solar energy using GIS and open source data.

Consequently, the development of an easy-to-use tool for spatial-distributed analysis of the potential of solar energy remains an open challenge. Such tool will provide new possibilities for solar energy potential analysis and help scientists and policymakers to find ways for the development of solar energy production and to evaluate possible financial benefits from the development of this branch in different regions.

The opportunity to use digital and geoinformation technologies as an important step toward helping to solve the tasks of spatial analysis of solar energy potential with automatic forming the georeferenced cadasters of solar energy potential with taking into account the main parameters that have an impact on electricity generation processes. The approach with using artificial intelligence can provide automatically building the input databases for geospatial analysis of solar energy potential and the results of computer simulation of solar energy potential distribution. The key advantages of such way to solve problems related to solar energy analysis, supporting and developing this branch are the reducing of usage manual work, low cost, take into account the main parameters of electricity generating processes (sunny, cloudy and windy days, wind speed, rain precipitations, air temperature, and others), quick results getting, an opportunity to adapt models to the new needs and features of producing circles, and others.

The practical value of the expected results is the ability to identify territories automatically with sufficient energy potential for the construction of power generating enterprises and forecasting potentially possible volumes of electricity production. The developed approaches based on modern digital and geoinformation technologies will serve as an effective tool for politicians and government bodies in making decisions about the allocation of limited funds for the development of solar energy power plants in the case it has the maximum effect in terms of emission reductions and will ensure the sustainable economic development of the region. In addition, the results of such research will be of interest to private investors in terms of making decisions on investing in renewable energy in the region.

The obtained practical experience is quite valuable and can be used in studies of the potential of another renewable energy sources at different levels and in processes of estimating and forecasting electricity production volumes using renewable sources and taking into account many factors of influence, including weather conditions and would also apply to other similar modeling challenges with using artificial intelligence, digital and geoinformation technologies.
Risks & Challenges

The main risk of the proposed solution is developing the correct mathematical model and its validation. The main challenge is to identify the dependencies between all the major parameters that affect the processes of generating electricity using solar energy. Today I have already developed a draft description of the model and its main parameters. But the mathematical description of solar energy potential needs improving and deep validation. The model validation will be based on comparing the gotten results of mathematical simulation and real statistical data of the amount of electricity production from existed solar power plants. Such approach to model validation based on my past experience in spatial analysis and mathematical modeling of GHG emission in electricity and heat generation sector. Last eight years I was a team member of the research group that managed and executed different scientific projects related to spatial analysis and mathematical modeling of GHG emissions in different sectors of human activities. All activities in these projects focused on the development of approaches, mathematical models and software tools for spatial analysis and creation of databases of GHG emission in all sectors of human activities. Considerable attention was paid to the uncertainty analysis of the results and this practical experience is very important in case of successful execution the tasks of spatial analysis of solar energy potential.

The next risk, I think, is the creation of detailed input datasets. In this case, the main accent will be focused on open source data. For instance, a lot of valuable information related to spatial analysis of solar energy potential is provided by NASA, Google, and other companies. The approach with using digital technologies and artificial intelligence has a big advantage because it allows the researcher to train the model by using real datasets and taking into account a lot of parameters that have an impact on electricity generation processes.
Other Ways You Can Help

I'll be very happy and very thankful for any help. Also, I'm ready to discuss any proposals and collaborations that can help me to fundraise and to implement my ideas in the framework of this project proposal. I hope that the results of my research and my project will use by all interested communities and will be very useful for everyone because we have the greatest task of all time: save the environment for the future generation.",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns
|","Laxenburg, Austria",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-artificial-intelligence-for-renewable-energy/pica

I have been building and advising on Natural Swimming Pools for over a decade - and it has become a mission of mine to raise  awareness of these pools and make them accessible to more people.
Their rise in popularity has provided many opportunities with others who share the excitement.
I studied biomedical electronics but drifted into television production at the BBC, all the while being something of a closet pond obsessive and practical ecologist.

I started building organic pools out of inquisition more then anything - I was fascinated by how nature created such clean clear water without the need for added chemicals. My organic filtration experiments soon became something of a necessity as my young son developed eczema over his body from swimming at school. Since, I have become something of a campaigner for natural swimming pools.

The drive for OLIVE came about through conversations and support from some wonderful people. Over the years of building natural swimming pools I developed a natural filtration system that uses the least amount of power possible. I often found myself discussing this with people in coffee shops between shifts at the BBC and before I knew it I was sitting round a table with some great product designers, Paul and Nick of Product Resolutions, bringing OLIVE to life.

I have built several prototypes of OLIVE, some have been wonderful and others just weird, using anything I can get my hands on to create the desired function. To this point, OLIVE has been completely self funded, however if it is to become a reality, I need your help to get over the final hurdle of manufacture. People all around the world have expressed an interest in OLIVE for new natural swimming pools, existing pools as well as potentially helping to convert conventional swimming pools into natural pools.

OLIVE is a self contained multi-functional filter that floats on the water's surface. Installation is simple and maintenance is minimal : just rinsing the mesh filter in fresh water once every few days - it takes about a minute. And when it comes to looks, OLIVE is possibly the most beautiful filter in the world.
The amount of money I am campaigning for will allow OLIVE to become a reality. To this point I have invested around £60,000 and have 1 final prototype that is ready to go into production.
In order to manufacture 190 units I require a further £30,000 - This will allow me to experiment further with OLIVE in order to develop the product and begin offering them for sale on my website.
The units will be manufactured in China, this has proven to provide the best quality, most cost effective way to develop the product.

Why am I crowdfunding? I am unable to afford the final stage, passion and my savings have got me this far and I need a bit of help to take it further. OLIVE started out from others encouragement and it feels apt that it should finish this way.

The perks I am offering allow me to share with you everything I can about natural swimming pools, from my guides to making your own pool to full consultation on your pool build. I am also providing you the opportunity to own one of the first OLIVE's.
A Natural Swimming Pool can also be a wildlife pond and as such it is an highly effective way to increase local biodiveristy.

Natural pools are provide an ecosystem that supports a huge range of flora and fauna, Indeed, they are a vital component of the system keeping the water quality high and healthy to swim in. OLIVE compliments this natural system. It works alongside the natural processes occurring in the pool.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/tyJ76FmPh3E?autohide=1&amp
OLIVE is extremely low impact - it uses 20W of electricity which is on average, at least 20 times less then conventional swimming pool pumps.

Swimming in natural water is good for us in so many ways. It is kind to your skin, it doesn't sting your eyes and being free of chlorine - it doesn't dissolve your swimming costume. The health benefits of outdoor swimming are becoming more recognised by the day, from physical exercise and other physiological benefits to the elevation of our sence of well being.  And just being immersed in natural surroundings promotes relaxation and enjoyment.

My instinct for this project has got me this far and I hope with your help I can see it into fruition. Indeed, the encouragement of others has been an inspiration and I am certain that OLIVE can help more of us have access to a natural swimming.

I am really excited to know the full extent of OLIVE's capabilities, having more units will allow me to experiment (particularly with the conversion of conventional swimming pools) and further understand the breadth of opportunity for OLIVE.
I have been testing OLIVE for about 2 years - I know it works and is reliable. At this point there are no real obstacles.
Please support OLIVE in whatever way you can, even if you are unable to back the project please share this page so we can get the word out.

I genuinely feel OLIVE can have a big impact on swimming pools of the future. Indeed, swimming in natural water is becoming mainstream now, there are even public Natural Swimming Pools in UK and USA.  And OLIVE,  will just make it easier for more of us to have our own.
