0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
Nature Field Cards.
Near Field Communication Cards for field researchers and global phenology data collection.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
column4: >Let's Baseline the globe. NOW!

column1: <div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fplayer.vimeo.com%2Fvideo%2F138259900&amp
Rapid, automated, error-free natural cataloging and data collection.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

Almost all nature field cards are a custom product. We create them uniquely for you. They specifically relate to what you are interested in, your level of expertise and the geo-location in which they are used. This is the most custom product of anything ever launched on Indiegogo.

I'd like to thank two people, Carrie and Greg. Their questions gave me insight on the terrible performance of this campaign so far.

The first problem is simple: Although they were both tech-savy researchers, it was not clear to them that I was actually using radio-cards (Near Field Communication). NFC is the 2nd most important technology of 2015 (in my opinion). The first would be 3-D printing. NFC has been used for transit and hotel cards, employee ID cards and office entry,  merchandise theft prevention and applications too numerous to mention. I believe it is as revolutionary as LED lighting. So I thought I was being clever about my double acronym. Not so.

column7: >The magic of Nature Field Cards is Near field communication (NFC).

column1: The cards relay data as soon as they are within about 1/2 inch of the back of a NFC-enabled phone (most phones being produced are NFC- enabled since this is the standard to replace credit-cards in the near future). The phone emits a pulsed  wave, energizing a coil which supplies power to a radio chip embedded in the card. The card then transmits the contents of the chip to the phone.

The Nature Field Cards App grabs the information and separates it into many fields. Those fields have information including card options, the card type, the species, what types of cards may follow, etc.
Options may be option from this miniature database by using the numbered cube (which transmits data the same way).

If I observe a species of interest and it is flowering, the card tells the computer what the species is and offers options for the cube to select. By swiping the appropriate cube number, the phone  will record that the species is flowering. It also records the weather, geoposition, date/time, light level, observer info, group info and MUCH more (about 30 pieces of information). If you google 'encoded employee identification cards,' you'll see that $2-3 per card is less than a tenth what most people charge. I REALLY want this to be available to everyone. And to benefit everyone.

Nature Field Cards harness the incredible power people typically carry in their pockets and parlays it into a powerful tool for field research. The field research may be a  very specific inquiry with very specific data requirements (eg amphibian reproduction in the Oregon Cascades) or it may be a phenology-related project. Regardless of the inquiry, it is a custom inquiry relating to species found in a specific area of interest to a specific indifidual. We will CUSTOM make the program for this inquiry. Every Nature Field Card program is custom. For Indiegogo subscribers we make the program for you (you will fill out a small questionaire). Eventually it will be a simple automated online  form that will generate either the cards or the program that allows you to make your own cards at home. The data from the cards goes online with stipulations set for its public display determined by the user.  Most data will be public immediately. The more people participate,  learn and contribute, the more powerful the database. My ambition is that the data will enable good local and global decision making for preservation in our rapidly degrading environment.
EVERY deck (program) I'm selling is unique. The power of this program is that no two programs are (or need to be) the same. The cards are the program.

The cards will work at any water depth and even in saltwater. With your phone placed in an $11 clear case (I may even put these for sale in the premiums) you can use the cards and your phone to a depth of 10 feet. The cards will transmit their data to the mobile by swiping the same way as they do on land. GPS data will be recalibrated everytime you surface.
Cards cannot be reprogrammed in the field. In fact they cannot be reprogrammed at all. The reason is this:

We must ALWAYS be able to see the exact card that collected the data, know how it was encoded and know what both the front and backside of the card looked like. This will allow resolution of database problems resulting from possible card design flaws without throwing out the data. Each card designed has an internic-style number so all data can be traced to the actual card used in collection. If one was to change the data on the card in the field it would seriously compromise the robustness of data collected.
Data collected by all cards is tagged with the appropriate card ID. And the rules for each card are maintained forever in the database.

Nature Field Cards is meant for serious research -- not just 4th graders. However it is extremely easy to bring a youngster up to speed on typical phenological data collection. Thanks again Carrie and Greg! I encourage anybody with questions to contact me. In the meantime I'm going to get some better movies up to explain this and get everybody re-energized about this campaign.
I apologize for the confusion!
How Nature Field Cards work:
<ol>
• Observe
• Compare
• Swipe

Recording data has never been so easy. Nature Field Cards blend NFC technology with stunning graphics, compact data-structures, and coded program instructions. Each card contains its own data, program instructions, and distinct user graphics.
Millions of customized applications for millions of inquiries

Nature Field Cards provide field research and educational tools as diverse as nature itself. And, like nature, the Nature Field Card ecosystem is both simple and complex. Our unique card identification system ensures that each card will sync with similar cards across the database. In fact, the applications are so diverse that they have just one thing in common -- they use Nature Field Cards.
Super smart, super tough, and super accurate
Simple enough for a fourth grader yet powerful enough for the most accomplished researcher, Nature Field Cards operate with or without WiFi or Cellular connectivity.
Nature Field Cards cover nearly all research fields but use the same mobile applications -- the Prospectives mobile app and the Prospectives online analysis tool.

Each card tells the Prospectives mobile app what to expect, what to do, when there is an error and what cards may follow. Each species card may be followed by as many as 8 data-augmentation cards in any order. The depth of analysis is completely up to the Nature Field Card user.
Boxes of Different Phenophase Titles for use with species cards
Application cues include any combination of sound, voice, and minimal graphic display. Your Nature Field Card application allows you to easily collect valuable data without looking at the display.
I can't over-emphasize how custom this product is. Every order fulfilled will have different species and unique observer cards.
Sample observer card

Every observer will have different requirements for the the public release of data, be collecting different types of data from drastically different habitats. Some observers will be individual citizen scientist/ Others will be part of an organized group. Some will be simply using the cards to document supplements and treatments applied to their apiary or nursery. Others will be conducting important research. Others will be base-lining their hometown. Some will be 4th grade students, some will intellectual giants. The important thing is that they all will be collecting data that will help mitigate problems in species migrations, track invasives, correlate changes in land, water and air species to determine shared concerns.
Nature Field Cards provide many supplemental data augmentation cards. These can be as simple as nationally recognized phenophase protocols.
NFC cubes are the the perfect blend of handfinished wood and epoxy-encapsulated NFC electronics. They are beautiful and smart. Measuring 1.75"" on a side, they feel comfortable in the hand.

The are  uncluttered yet visually striking. Specially engineered for the rigors of the field they even work in salt water. Handcrafted, assembled and programmed in Corvallis Oregon from windfall Maple.  These Fob-selectors choose from database options contained on each card. Cards may contain as many as 12 database options. The cube's six options are doubled through play of a 'B' card.
Cubes are amazingly visible in the dark with a low-lumen UV lamp

Warning Before proceeding: There is one requirement for Nature Field Cards -- Your device must have NFC read capability. If it doesn't, there are add-on products such as Flojack   (http://flomio.com/flojack/) and other 3rd party work arounds.
What We Need

First of all, EVERY penny of your backing will be placed into making this product as useful, inexpensive and widely used as possible. I've intentionally set a minimum goal of $30K. Anything lower would result in a less-than-stellar product.

Times are interesting. We need a stellar product. We need global acceptance. We NEED this to succeed! If you have any questions about ANYTHING, please contact me through Indiegogo or directly (David.Anderson@NatureFieldCards.com).

We've created a remarkable prototype. But in order to complete the process we need money. The prototype is android. It needs to be ported to IOS. The prototype functions on an unsecured MySQL platform without analysis tools. We need a super-secure service tier with a superb user interface to allow citizen scientists without a background in data to create powerful analysis experiments. We need an automated neural network component that will create and curate cards from very simple user input. This build programs from which users may print and encode their own cards when desired.
You can see that the ultimate Prospectives ecosystem is very broad. Completing all aspects will be determined by the demand and support. Here is a list of what can be accomplished with this campaign

column5: >rudimentary online forms to aid card creation.

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)

Just as important as money, we need support -- global buy-in.  We need to know you are behind this as much as we are. While we are excited and optimistic about the amazing good this can do, it won't accomplish what it sets out to do unless there is a broad buy-in to the ideas. We need people excited about observing, discovering, recording nature. We need millions of individuals willing to partake in the largest data collection project ever. The data-sphere is cluttered with segmented phenology data in remarkably dissimilar formats.  What is needed is a super-design that encompasses the needs of everyone and is user-configurable to exactly collect the desired information. We need a Wikipedia-style data platform that is built, analyzed and curated by the world. A platform that belongs to nobody and everybody. A platform without ads and that doesn't sell your information. A platform that doesn't require a PhD to use. A platform with two huge goals -- the best preservation of our natural resources possible and the enjoyment of those same natural resources.

I've spent many years considering the scope of the project and updating the program for the myriad of nuances in environmental data collection. I have consulted with numerous individuals in fields as diverse as agronomy, timber cruising, natural parks, apiaries and fisheries, by-catch regulatory agencies, water quality and scuba divers.
I've created a metaphor that provides the best fit for everyone without compromising. It co-mingles diverse fields and intents while maintaining their separation.

Are you interested in comparing meta-population dynamics across land, sea and air species? Are you interested in pesticide use on filberts relevant to local pollenators? The sky is the limit for data collected from Nature Field Cards.
We're asking you to be generous and to be excited about the prospectives of this technology. Help us create this ecosystem to help preserve the Earth's ecosystems.

This is a huge col laboratory effort. The money will not go to line my pockets. It will ALL be going to making the project a success. Why? Because the faster we are successful, the faster we can stabilize the terrible tailspin we're in. Remember that this data will become the basis for analysis of our transitioning planet. We don't want to exclude anyone. Preserving nature has never been so critical.
Our prospectives are in your hands
With your help, we can make this the greatest worldwide collaboration in history.
Indiegogo's wonderful crowd- funding platform. It is important to make Prospectives affordable and available to everyone.

But in order to make Prospectives a reality we need more people and equipment. We need sophisticated card printers automated interfaces to provide semi-automatic order fulfillment, and cloud database security without encumbering the product's use. And, importantly we need this to happen all over the globe.

column1:
• Port to IOS so everyone with an NFC-enabled mobile device can join the revolution.
  • Secure and develop the online portion so the online analysis tools for Nature Field Cards data are just as awesome as the field technology. I want anybody who has ideas for experiments to freely analyse the data with an extremely powerful tool-set. For only when data is interpreted  and processed to determine its true  meaning can it be called information.  Plant phenology is the most reported biological indicator of anthropogenic climate change. But it can also stave off mass extinctions when properly acted upon.

• Develop the online Nature Field Card interface. Eventually I want people to be able to create their own cards -- unaided. An intuitive interface for transmogrifying citizen scientist desires into automatically generated and cataloged cards will be an important aspect.

• All materials for the project are sourced and stable. But LOTS of work will be involved in fulfilling orders since each card and each programmed dataset on each card are unique. Even with all this, I believe we'll be shipping in early December.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute doesn't mean you can't help. If you see any aspect of this project  you'd like to help with, please contact me and we'll talk!
In the meantime, please get the

column1: ","Nature Field Cards.
Near Field Communication Cards for field researchers and global phenology data collection.
Let's Baseline the globe. NOW!
Rapid, automated, error-free natural cataloging and data collection.
Customized for each observer

Almost all nature field cards are a custom product. We create them uniquely for you. They specifically relate to what you are interested in, your level of expertise and the geo-location in which they are used. This is the most custom product of anything ever launched on Indiegogo.

I'd like to thank two people, Carrie and Greg. Their questions gave me insight on the terrible performance of this campaign so far.The first problem is simple: Although they were both tech-savy researchers, it was not clear to them that I was actually using radio-cards (Near Field Communication). NFC is the 2nd most important technology of 2015 (in my opinion). The first would be 3-D printing. NFC has been used for transit and hotel cards, employee ID cards and office entry,  merchandise theft prevention and applications too numerous to mention. I believe it is as revolutionary as LED lighting. So I thought I was being clever about my double acronym. Not so.
The magic of Nature Field Cards is Near field communication (NFC).

The cards relay data as soon as they are within about 1/2 inch of the back of a NFC-enabled phone (most phones being produced are NFC- enabled since this is the standard to replace credit-cards in the near future). The phone emits a pulsed  wave, energizing a coil which supplies power to a radio chip embedded in the card. The card then transmits the contents of the chip to the phone.

The Nature Field Cards App grabs the information and separates it into many fields. Those fields have information including card options, the card type, the species, what types of cards may follow, etc.
Options may be option from this miniature database by using the numbered cube (which transmits data the same way).

If I observe a species of interest and it is flowering, the card tells the computer what the species is and offers options for the cube to select. By swiping the appropriate cube number, the phone  will record that the species is flowering. It also records the weather, geoposition, date/time, light level, observer info, group info and MUCH more (about 30 pieces of information). If you google 'encoded employee identification cards,' you'll see that $2-3 per card is less than a tenth what most people charge. I REALLY want this to be available to everyone. And to benefit everyone.

Nature Field Cards harness the incredible power people typically carry in their pockets and parlays it into a powerful tool for field research. The field research may be a  very specific inquiry with very specific data requirements (eg amphibian reproduction in the Oregon Cascades) or it may be a phenology-related project. Regardless of the inquiry, it is a custom inquiry relating to species found in a specific area of interest to a specific indifidual. We will CUSTOM make the program for this inquiry. Every Nature Field Card program is custom. For Indiegogo subscribers we make the program for you (you will fill out a small questionaire). Eventually it will be a simple automated online  form that will generate either the cards or the program that allows you to make your own cards at home. The data from the cards goes online with stipulations set for its public display determined by the user.  Most data will be public immediately. The more people participate,  learn and contribute, the more powerful the database. My ambition is that the data will enable good local and global decision making for preservation in our rapidly degrading environment.
EVERY deck (program) I'm selling is unique. The power of this program is that no two programs are (or need to be) the same. The cards are the program.

The cards will work at any water depth and even in saltwater. With your phone placed in an $11 clear case (I may even put these for sale in the premiums) you can use the cards and your phone to a depth of 10 feet. The cards will transmit their data to the mobile by swiping the same way as they do on land. GPS data will be recalibrated everytime you surface.
Cards cannot be reprogrammed in the field. In fact they cannot be reprogrammed at all. The reason is this:

We must ALWAYS be able to see the exact card that collected the data, know how it was encoded and know what both the front and backside of the card looked like. This will allow resolution of database problems resulting from possible card design flaws without throwing out the data. Each card designed has an internic-style number so all data can be traced to the actual card used in collection. If one was to change the data on the card in the field it would seriously compromise the robustness of data collected.
Data collected by all cards is tagged with the appropriate card ID. And the rules for each card are maintained forever in the database.

Nature Field Cards is meant for serious research -- not just 4th graders. However it is extremely easy to bring a youngster up to speed on typical phenological data collection. Thanks again Carrie and Greg! I encourage anybody with questions to contact me. In the meantime I'm going to get some better movies up to explain this and get everybody re-energized about this campaign.
I apologize for the confusion!
How Nature Field Cards work:
Observe
Compare
Swipe

Recording data has never been so easy. Nature Field Cards blend NFC technology with stunning graphics, compact data-structures, and coded program instructions. Each card contains its own data, program instructions, and distinct user graphics.
Millions of customized applications for millions of inquiries

Nature Field Cards provide field research and educational tools as diverse as nature itself. And, like nature, the Nature Field Card ecosystem is both simple and complex. Our unique card identification system ensures that each card will sync with similar cards across the database. In fact, the applications are so diverse that they have just one thing in common -- they use Nature Field Cards.
Super smart, super tough, and super accurate
Simple enough for a fourth grader yet powerful enough for the most accomplished researcher, Nature Field Cards operate with or without WiFi or Cellular connectivity.
Nature Field Cards cover nearly all research fields but use the same mobile applications -- the Prospectives mobile app and the Prospectives online analysis tool.

Each card tells the Prospectives mobile app what to expect, what to do, when there is an error and what cards may follow. Each species card may be followed by as many as 8 data-augmentation cards in any order. The depth of analysis is completely up to the Nature Field Card user.
Boxes of Different Phenophase Titles for use with species cards
Application cues include any combination of sound, voice, and minimal graphic display. Your Nature Field Card application allows you to easily collect valuable data without looking at the display.
I can't over-emphasize how custom this product is. Every order fulfilled will have different species and unique observer cards.
Sample observer card

Every observer will have different requirements for the the public release of data, be collecting different types of data from drastically different habitats. Some observers will be individual citizen scientist/ Others will be part of an organized group. Some will be simply using the cards to document supplements and treatments applied to their apiary or nursery. Others will be conducting important research. Others will be base-lining their hometown. Some will be 4th grade students, some will intellectual giants. The important thing is that they all will be collecting data that will help mitigate problems in species migrations, track invasives, correlate changes in land, water and air species to determine shared concerns.
Nature Field Cards provide many supplemental data augmentation cards. These can be as simple as nationally recognized phenophase protocols.
NFC cubes are the the perfect blend of handfinished wood and epoxy-encapsulated NFC electronics. They are beautiful and smart. Measuring 1.75"" on a side, they feel comfortable in the hand.

The are  uncluttered yet visually striking. Specially engineered for the rigors of the field they even work in salt water. Handcrafted, assembled and programmed in Corvallis Oregon from windfall Maple.  These Fob-selectors choose from database options contained on each card. Cards may contain as many as 12 database options. The cube's six options are doubled through play of a 'B' card.
Cubes are amazingly visible in the dark with a low-lumen UV lamp

Warning Before proceeding: There is one requirement for Nature Field Cards -- Your device must have NFC read capability. If it doesn't, there are add-on products such as Flojack   (http://flomio.com/flojack/) and other 3rd party work arounds.

In the country 2021, everyone was living happily, enjoying each other's presence and having the time of their lives.

This all changed when the fearsome beast attacked. The fearsome beast, emerged from the depths of hell. He was hungry, so hungry he'd eat a dick.

During his hunger fatigue, the beast searched for his slippers of agility. However, due to the greed of the beast, he ran as fast as he could to get his fucking slippers.

Then it tripped and broke a fucking window in the middle of the night at 4am. lol.

Anyway right to the truth. He broke the door, and zx's mom decided to cover the cost all by herself, even though how much hospitality we received from their family. The scary thing is that he really did just leave it there without compensation or even an apology. Which actually makes me feel fokkin bad and would really like to raise some money at least to cover half of it. So please do, maybe help what you could if you want. Any amount would be greatly appreciated, and I'd really would like to thank you from the bottom of my heart.

column7:
>Pipelinefacts.ca is a grassroots initiative founded to counter a propaganda campaign being waged in British Columbia right now by oil interests promoting the tar sands and the Northern Gateway pipeline. Oil interests have spent tens of millions of dollars on advertisements in British Columbia alone, blanketing the airwaves with messages intended to greenwash both tarsands oil and pipeline safety.

We have created TV Ads to counter pro-tarsands propaganda and need your help getting them to air.

column1: <ul>
• We are a group of media professionals volunteering our time and services.

• Polls in BC have been showing a slow but steady shift in public opinion as the oil company's incessant ads have started to have an effect. It's absolutely critical that the other side of the story is finally told.
• You can see why we are opposed to the Tarsands and the Northern Gateway pipeline in detail by visiting PIPELINEFACTS.CA
• You can help us put our ad on the air. You can make a difference.

Overview

How much food do we throw away every day? Is the trash can the final call of your waste? 

Give it a second chance! Use it to help your neighborhood, your school and the environment itself.

 

PlayCompost is a composter totem suitable for public and private spaces that turn food waste in healthy compost for your plants. 

Our goal is to avoid food waste by reusing what we throw away everyday.

 

How it works

PlayCompost makes the waste, chops it, mixes it together and finally, the composting phase begins.

It’s designed so it can be used as pre - composting by an infinite number of people.

 

Thanks to its placement in public spaces, PlayCompost encourages sharing of experience with others.

PlayCompost is different from other composers, because it explains what it does by showing it to you.

Thanks to PlayCompost you learn: you don’t have to know how to do anything. It doesn’t presume any knowledge. It guides you at all stages of the process.

 

PlayCompost is a SUSTAINABLE, SAFE and FUN alternative to recycle your food waste.

","OverviewHow much food do we throw away every day? Is the trash can the final call of your waste? Give it a second chance! Use it to help your neighborhood, your school and the environment itself. PlayCompost is a composter totem suitable for public and private spaces that turn food waste in healthy compost for your plants. Our goal is to avoid food waste by reusing what we throw away everyday. How it worksPlayCompost makes the waste, chops it, mixes it together and finally, the composting phase begins.It’s designed so it can be used as pre - composting by an infinite number of people. Thanks to its placement in public spaces, PlayCompost encourages sharing of experience with others.PlayCompost is different from other composers, because it explains what it does by showing it to you.Thanks to PlayCompost you learn: you don’t have to know how to do anything. It doesn’t presume any knowledge. It guides you at all stages of the process. PlayCompost is a SUSTAINABLE, SAFE and FUN alternative to recycle your food waste.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Game Plan

As any car lover knows, the  Nürburgring is one of the most famous and historic racing tracks in the world. The government is trying to sell it, and we need to save it from becoming the personal playground of a private owner, meaning the end of public track day use forever!

From 2007 - 2009 the German government built a huge Leisure Park at the Nürburgring. It is based on fake visitor numbers, oversized and badly executed. Most of the time it is an empty ghost town. Once promised as private investment, it is now based on a debt of 350+ million EUR public money.
<div>
Instead of pulling the plug they rented the park - including both race tracks - to exactly the same privateers (
column4: t=149#p321"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Jörg Lindner), who were driving forces behind the Leisure Park's initial private setup.

column1: Without Racing experience they are since experimenting with events completely unrelated to Motorsport (German Volksmusik for example, another one here) - all under the iconic ""Nürburgring"" brand name.

They now want Nordschleife to pay for the huge losses of ""NüroDisney"": record prices and bundled packages for tourist drives plus a 5 times increase for the automotive industry in rent for their prototype testing sessions.
(source: http://savethering.org/)
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

We need to make an offer to purchase the tracks as a coelition of car and racing fans. To do this we need to raise a significant amount of money to secure investors to purchase this world renound track. We will look primaraly to protect the public use of this track, and seperate the motorsports tracks from all of the other money losing ventures that the race tracks have been saddled with paying for.
<div>
What needs to be done?
<ul>
• Seperate Nordschleife from ring°park.
• Let the historic Nürburgring be about motorsports alone.
• Value the great heritage and tradition of the racing venue
If we succeed, your name will be imortalized at the track on a list of supporters, and receve exclusive discounts and promotions
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us spread the word and share this page! (please click share) We need all the help we can get to accomplish such a huge undertaking!
","Game Plan

As any car lover knows, the  Nürburgring is one of the most famous and historic racing tracks in the world. The government is trying to sell it, and we need to save it from becoming the personal playground of a private owner, meaning the end of public track day use forever!

From 2007 - 2009 the German government built a huge Leisure Park at the Nürburgring. It is based on fake visitor numbers, oversized and badly executed. Most of the time it is an empty ghost town. Once promised as private investment, it is now based on a debt of 350+ million EUR public money.

Instead of pulling the plug they rented the park - including both race tracks - to exactly the same privateers (Kai Richter, Jörg Lindner), who were driving forces behind the Leisure Park's initial private setup.

Without Racing experience they are since experimenting with events completely unrelated to Motorsport (German Volksmusik for example, another one here) - all under the iconic ""Nürburgring"" brand name.

They now want Nordschleife to pay for the huge losses of ""NüroDisney"": record prices and bundled packages for tourist drives plus a 5 times increase for the automotive industry in rent for their prototype testing sessions.
(source: http://savethering.org/)
What We Need & What You Get

We need to make an offer to purchase the tracks as a coelition of car and racing fans. To do this we need to raise a significant amount of money to secure investors to purchase this world renound track. We will look primaraly to protect the public use of this track, and seperate the motorsports tracks from all of the other money losing ventures that the race tracks have been saddled with paying for.
What needs to be done?
Seperate Nordschleife from ring°park.
Let the historic Nürburgring be about motorsports alone.
Value the great heritage and tradition of the racing venue
If we succeed, your name will be imortalized at the track on a list of supporters, and receve exclusive discounts and promotions
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us spread the word and share this page! (please click share) We need all the help we can get to accomplish such a huge undertaking!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Nürburg, Germany",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/save-the-nurburgring/pica

A Theory
• Everyone benefits from spending time in Nature.
• Extended time in nature creates profound positive transformation in us as humans.
• The more of us that experience this profound positive transformation, the better off we will be as a society.

Lucky for us, there are focused nature-based activities that you can do to accelerate #2 and avoid spending weeks or months in the wilderness, while still achieving profound positive transformation.  I want to bring this transformation to as many of us as possible.

I believe that the world will be a better place when more people feel a connection to nature and make decisions for their lives, businesses, and communities with a consideration of how those decisions impact this fragile ecology that ALL of our lives depend on.  My belief is so strong that I’m leaving my successful engineering and business career to facilitate change as a nature-connection outdoor guide.

Recently, my family and I were invited to participate in a Renaissance Weekend, a PERFECT venue to express this calling and actually get government and business leaders to understand this perspective.

""What is Renaissance Weekend?"" you ask.

The event’s webpage describes the weekend as “the granddaddy of ideas festivals”.  I admit, I was skeptical.  After extensive checking, it was determined that this was a reputable event where leaders discussed real issues and launched change onto the rest of us.  Invitations to the event are very selective.

""Participants are noted innovators in business and finance, education, religion, law and medicine, government, the media, science and technology, sports, non-profits and the arts. Their ground-breaking, off-the-record exchanges — through lectures, seminars and discussions — build bridges across traditional divides of professions and politics, geography and generations, religions and philosophies. Civility prevails
column3:
commercialism, banned.""

This sounds awesome, until you notice the cost to attend.  The folks that I found in my networks that were invited (some real change-makers), did not attend due to cost.  For a small family of three, the cost quickly reaches into the thousands of dollars, not including airfare or lodging.  At this cost, how many people will be there who think there's more to our communities than maximization of wealth?  Who's ideating for the environment, humankind's choosing of passion and joy over greed, and the consideration of earth’s whole system?  Imagine getting a current government leader or a business magnate to take their shoes off and barefoot hike in the Colorado wilderness...learning to meditate and appreciating the planet that gives us life.

We can do this!

Who are Dane and his family?

Dane:

  • Strategist, Environmentalist, Outdoor Guide, Innovator, Engineer, Businessman and Speaker with a passion to connect with people to challenge their beliefs of reality and thus create a whole new world of possibility.  He has a unique combination of big bureaucracy experience and grassroots drive.  He recently made the hard decision to leave a blossoming career in corporate america to pursue what he feels is more meaningful for all of us.

Dane’s wife:

  • Director of a Family Resource Center as part of a unique non-profit focused on developing young leaders to address inequities in their communities with a focus on educational attainment for Latinos.

My wife and I maintain a State-of-California Licensed Foster Home and are awaiting a foster child placement.  This foster child will most likely attend and participate in the September event.  How great would it be for a foster child to get the opportunity to participate in such an event?


What do people who've worked with me say about me?

column1: • ""...an excellent leader""
• ""always one of my favorite people to work with, as he illustrated exemplary teamwork, steadfastness, and passion...""
• ""He is capable of learning, sharing, facilitating, and perhaps most importantly, dutifully managing all the risks and rewards that accompany a wilderness expedition.""
• ""possesses a rare combination of engineering and social networking skills""
• ""...an amazing capacity for youth development, for learning as much as teaching, and for connecting with others through a balance of vulnerability, humor, respect and responsibility""
• “...understood how to listen, to listen with a still heart, with a waiting, open soul, without passion, without desire, without judgment, without opinions.”
• ""has a very strong vision of where an organization needs to be to succeed""
• ""has the analytical insight necessary to map the journey to success""
• ""his greatest strength is his ability to connect the people and the ideas necessary to make the plan happen""
• ""...creativity and easy-going personality...""
• ""thoughtful approach to problem solving, identification of solutions, and strategic thinking...""
• “...radiates love, serenity, understanding and knowledge. With his hospitable intellect he could embrace children, beggars, and the insane and entertain the thought of all.”

Why is Dane calling to you?

A day before the invitation arrived in my mailbox, I was working on an application for a wilderness-based workshop in Washington state.  As part of the application, I had to identify my greatest longing.  I identified it as “to get leaders, one-by-one, into the wilderness where I could connect with them and show them how to ‘feel’ nature and the importance of being more responsible to that which gives us life.”  Then the invitation of Renaissance Weekend arrived…can you imagine a better venue to address my greatest longing?  Now I just have to figure out how to fund it.  That’s where you come in!

If you’ve looked at my credentials, you might wonder “why does this guy need me to foot the bill?”  After leaving my corporate career, my income has been DRASTICALLY minimized while I begin to pursue this calling.  Living off a savings account has its drawbacks
column2:
$5000 is not in the budget to attend events like this, even though we could be a family with great contributions!!


Even if you can’t contribute right now, please share this opportunity with others you know (email, Facebook, Google+, Neighbors, etc.).  Also, please feel free to contact me with any questions.

What's the financial breakdown (the details)?

Here are the costs to attend the weekend (not including transportation):

Any additional money collected will first be used to cover travel to the event and second used to continue the mission of getting leaders out into nature for connection and discussion.  Let us know of any leaders we should invite!

My name is Steven, and I first met my business partner Wantree while travelling through Thailand and subsequently settling over the last 2 years. Tree is member of the Karen Tribe
column2: situated in the North close to the Burmese border they are known for their skills in working the land, and are excellent farmers. A particular bamboo which can be used for drinking straws grows in the area, and through Trees ability to grow and craft the bamboo and my ability to connect this resource with the western world to reduce plastic straw usage we formed Bamboo.Shop.Tree !

column1:
Following our launch video on social media, interest has been HUGE ! Far outweighing our current output levels between myself, Tree and his wife working by hand- so we want to involve the wider community earlier than anticipate. 

Contributions will go to the building of a workshop, the provision of tools and the initial employment of the local tribe. I

We believe this project will provide benefit to to the reduction of the worlds plastic problem, giving people an environmental, ethical and sustainable alternative. This will also make a huge impact in the local community by providing additional income to the tribe to increase their standards of living
Thank you for taking the time to understand Bamboo.Shop.Tree
You can find us and share us on facebook and instagram @Bamboo.Shop.Tree

Stop the rabbits before they make more and more rabbits!!!
We are developing an arcade style game for mobile devices.  The game will be initially released for iPhones
The Game:
Oh no! The farm rabbits have escaped their hutch and the wild rabbits are trying to mate with them!!!
Stop the madness by drawing fences to separate the male and female rabbits. If a male and female rabbit collide, they make a new rabbit
column2: you'll  have to fence off the baby bunnies too before they grow into full grown reproducing rabbits!

column1: The game gets increasingly harder within a level as more rabbits collide creating even more rabbits.  The levels get harder too as enemies like foxes and ""dogs on the loose"" appear in the field - each with the intent of eating your rabbits!
The more rabbits you have fenced, the higher your points, so you don't want to lose them! But you also don't want so many that you can't control the population growth either.
Game End:  You can lose a level if you lose all your rabbits, or you lose all of one sex of rabbit. You will also lose a level if you have a population explosion
column2: if things get so out of hand that there are more rabbits than field to put them in... the level ends (but you can replay lost levels).

column1: You need carrots to keep your rabbits well fed.  Run out of carrots and the game ends (and you'll have to start all over).
The game will also be peppered with mini-games to unlock.   For example, you may have to manouver your device to get the rabbits across a busy road.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

We are currently developing a demo of the movement mechanics, screen design and character designs. We need more funds to complete the demo. Then we will use the demo to entice a major game developer who we have already been in contact with. This developer is interested, but needs to see a more fully featured demo.
We have used our own funds and our own time to get the graphics and demo this far.  We need more cash to take the game demo further.  This is how the cash will be used:
<ul>
<li>$250 for more graphic designs of:
<ul>
• the characters and their enemies
• screen shots (load screens, etc.)
<li>$500 for more features in the movement mechanics demo. For example:
<ul>
• Currently you can lose the game, but you cannot win the game. We need to program the software to calculate the areas divided by the fences and track the sexes of the rabbits in each area.
• Scoring that will include the time bonus, and Field bonus (you get bonus points for lots of rabbits in a small field)
• Enemies (Dogs and Foxes) will appear and kill the rabbits unless you fence them off first!
• After successfully corraling the rabbits, the game will restart with one additional male and female rabbit.
• Rabbits get smaller when there are more rabbits on the screen.  This allows for better game play in the later stages, with an easy learning curve and more visible details in the early stages.
• Audio - primarily better sound effects.
• More compact code for playing on mobile devices (right now the game plays well on computers, but not on mobile devices with slower CPUs)
• Any major overages that exceed the money needed for the demo will go towards the development of the final game.
This is an all or nothing campaign.  If we don't reach our goal we don't get a cent.  Please help us reach our goal to develop this game demo - so we can then move on to develop the game!
<div>
What you get:
First and foremost you will get our gratitude - every one of you who contributes, or shares this campaign with their friends and followers.
In addition, we will give financial contributers the following perks:
<ul>
• For a $10 donation you will receive:  Our thanks, a copy of the game gifted to you upon completion

<li>For a $25 donation you will receive: Our thanks, the finished game, access to a private Brainstorming discussion group where we will share our ideas for the game and you can have input into the development
column2: make suggestions, vote on designs and concepts, and get your name into the ""Thank You"" credits on the finished game

column1: • For a $50 donation you will receive: Our thanks, the finished game, access to the private Brainstorming group where you can make suggestions, vote, etc.  AND, receive beta test versions to run on your computer, and your name in the credits  as a ""Beta Tester""

• For a $100 donation you will receive: Our thanks, the finished game, access to the private Brainstorming group so you can make suggestions, receive beta test versions of the game to run on your computer, your name in the credits  as a ""Beta Tester/Backer"" AND two 8.5x10"" limited-edition posters of design sketches from the games development digitally signed by the artist AND a T-shirt with the Rolling Rabbit sketch on the chest and ""Nuthanger Farm Beta Tester/Backer"" on the back.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
We know that not everybody is able to contribute cash, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
<ul>
• Spread the word and make some noise about Nuthanger Farm - especially to anyone who is a fan of rabbits or Arcade style games!

Summary

The Billings reservoir is the largest waterbody in the largest metropolitan region in Brazil. Divided between jungle and intense human activity, this biome remains under enormous stress. We will map, monitor and publish the data from this biome to find solutions.

The Ground Keepers is a non-governmental organization that manages projects in forests and waters close to urban centers to preserve and improve. We understand that biomes close to human activity need to be managed and the correct integration with the local population is essential. With this mentality, we are an environmental incubator willing to create connections between Universities, innovators, financiers and people who want to help, developing technologies and methodologies that can be replicated.
https://www.tgkorg.com/
Zoning the reservoir and electing a qualified person to manage field operations, will facilitate conditions for university activities, innovators and anyone who wants to help.
With data collection, the right team and tools, we will establish standards that can be replicated for the rest of the biome.
First step.

Zone 1 (Rio Pequeno) is an area of ​​12 square kilometers with several springs, some already polluted and a reasonable amount of preserved Atlantic forest. This part of the reservoir presents all the difficulties that the biome faces as a whole, but on a smaller scale, resulting in a perfect laboratory for our methodology.
Who?

Our first caretaker is called Alexandre Petrokas Meskele, a biologist majoring in Hydraulics and Environmental Sanitation with experience in fish farming and water springs preservation. Strategically well established in the reservoir, nature lover, curious and hardworking, Alexandre is the right guy for the job and he will be the Keeper number one.
You can access the rest of the team on this website https://www.tgkorg.com/

","Summary

The Billings reservoir is the largest waterbody in the largest metropolitan region in Brazil. Divided between jungle and intense human activity, this biome remains under enormous stress. We will map, monitor and publish the data from this biome to find solutions.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cMAuHwIGNE4&feature=youtu.be

The Ground Keepers is a non-governmental organization that manages projects in forests and waters close to urban centers to preserve and improve. We understand that biomes close to human activity need to be managed and the correct integration with the local population is essential. With this mentality, we are an environmental incubator willing to create connections between Universities, innovators, financiers and people who want to help, developing technologies and methodologies that can be replicated.
https://www.tgkorg.com/
How?
Zoning the reservoir and electing a qualified person to manage field operations, will facilitate conditions for university activities, innovators and anyone who wants to help.
With data collection, the right team and tools, we will establish standards that can be replicated for the rest of the biome.
First step.

Zone 1 (Rio Pequeno) is an area of ​​12 square kilometers with several springs, some already polluted and a reasonable amount of preserved Atlantic forest. This part of the reservoir presents all the difficulties that the biome faces as a whole, but on a smaller scale, resulting in a perfect laboratory for our methodology.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KE8VyY616-E&amp...
Who?

Our first caretaker is called Alexandre Petrokas Meskele, a biologist majoring in Hydraulics and Environmental Sanitation with experience in fish farming and water springs preservation. Strategically well established in the reservoir, nature lover, curious and hardworking, Alexandre is the right guy for the job and he will be the Keeper number one.
You can access the rest of the team on this website https://www.tgkorg.com/
What we need?
We need $ 26,620

Aluminum boat + Boat trailer - 1,900Boat engine + Gas Tank - 1,200Life preserver + Rowing - 200Computer, Tablet - 2,000Software - 1,500Probe for water Analysis - 1,900Budget for 12 months of scientific study - 14,600Taxes and Fees - 3,320
We ask for your help to improve this biome so close to this giant metropolis Sao Paulo.
Thank you!

Due to the heavy downpour of rain which began on the 03 August 2019 and lasted for few days, it was reported that flooding in central and southern Vietnam has caused so many deaths and made almost 2000 people been displaced.The worst province which were hit by this was Kien Giang and Lam Dong, where most have reached the record levels.

Other provinces that was hit by this heavy rains which lead to flooding are Gia Lia, Dak Nong, Kon Tum, Dak Lak, Binh Phuoc, Dong Nai and Binh Thuan.

As a member of National Steering Committee for Natural Disaster Prevention and Control (NCDPC), reported that more than 8 people have lost their lives, some people are injured and over 1,985 evacuated, making in total of 12,141 houses are affected by the floods. In addition so many lifestocks, farmsland and crops affected, households assets been destroyed and many more valuables.

 

 

 

We solicit for your financial support in other to provide shelter, food, essential items such as
column2:
blankets, heaters, water containers, medical care, safe drinking water, sanitation and waste disposal, also psycho-social support.

 

Any items that is been bought will be shared among various provinces affected as we have reliable people who will distribute all items and make sure it gets to the flood victims.

Subsiquently updates and photo will be uploaded in other for donors to see how their funds is been spent and used.

Lets join hands and help in putting smiles on the victims face.

Feel free to visit our FAQ Section if you have any questions or need any information regarding this campaign.

What is Finders Keepers?
Finders Keepers is a part of the global environmental effort to reduce waste and over-consumption by helping people share thrown away items quickly and easily using a free mobile application.

Think about how many times you've stumbled across a great item discarded on the sidewalk, but which you have no use for. Many unwanted, thrown away items could be freecycled – turning one person’s trash into another person’s treasure.

The Finders Keepers app will allow users to share photos of items they find along with their location via a GPS based map. Users will share their find with other app users and facebook friends. Users who are looking for items will be able to search by location and keywords.
Besides the social sharing benefit, and in
today’s disposable world, the impact on the
environment is no less important. Freecycling ultimately leads to less consumption, less
manufacturing and therefore, less pollution.
<ul>
• To save people money by reusing items instead of buying new ones.
• To help the environment by reducing unnecessary manufacturing and waste
Who are we?
We are Nataly, Ilan and Maor.

Nataly, a good friend of Ilan, thought up the idea of Finders Keepers upon coming across a great looking bed which she saw one day on the street and had no use for. Wishing she could have shared her find with others who might really need it - the idea for the app was born.
Over coffee one day, Nataly discussed the idea with Ilan who has lots of app making experience. Ilan brought it up in a conversation with Maor, his business partner.
column2: >They thought that the idea is great indeed.
>Being 3 environment loving individuals who have many times in the past enjoyed the world of freecycling - we decided we must make our idea come to life.

column1: What We Need

In order to make Finders Keepers we need additional funding of $16,000 for the production of the application (programming and design), for servers and for initial distribution through advertising. Please help us make this free application by donating.
What You Get
In addition to a cleaner environment and tons of freecycled stuff, of course your contribution will also have its perks (as outlined to the right).
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute financially…
<ul>
• Please help us get the word out about Finders Keepers – share our crowd funding campaign and talk about it with friends.

• Become a part of Finders Keepers distribution network: Send your e-mail address to FindersKeepersTheApp@gmail.com so when the app is up and ready, we can notify you to download it (for free) and help us populate it with all the items you spot and share it among your friends.
• Freecycle!
Thank you!

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

AQUAPRO will monitor the aquarium to maintain optimal environment and protect your precious sea-friends.
We know that you admire the underwater world. We also know that you value precious fishes and other marine life forms. In that sense, you probably already have your own marine world.
AQUAPRO monitors and maintains
With AQUAPRO you never have to tell your kids their friends went to ""sea-heaven"".
Sea water fish, they live under the sea so they needs sea compounds.
As a result, when you have sea water fish, costs much than have fresh water fish.

If you have sea friends, you shoud need hydrometer to check salinity, NO3 tester which affects  reef, sea friends and also many compound addition to keep your aquarium as a real marine world. Ah, there is wave maker too!
Sensitive sea friends, they need monitoring all days cause their environment is not a ""real sea"" where they come from.
If you have AQUAPRO, you can keep these sensitive, precious sea-freinds.
* Characteristics
* Application
You can check your aquarium environment : ""Salinity, PH, Temperature.""
Also, you can see how the environment optimized for the sea-friends, as showing percentage.
Because, sea-friends has their distinct optimized PH, Salinity, Temperature!
They are little different!
Here's 360º degree VR of AQUAPRO
1: https://magentapiglet.github.io/newone/aquapro.html
2: https://magentapiglet.github.io/newone/AQUAPRO2.html
GOMO design
<h3>Q&amp
Q1. When will I get my AQUAPRO?
A. We will be shipping out the first shipments of AQUAPRO in June 2017.
Q2. Does my AQUAPRO come with any warranty?

A. We stand firmly behind what we’re building. Every AQUAPRO comes with a 30 day money back guarantee (from when you receive it) and a one year limited warranty. To hear more about the limited warranty please contact us for more details. : aquaprohelp@gmail.com

Q3. Will my AQUAPRO application work on my device?

A. We will be releasing the iOS and Android applications very, very soon! Additionally, we're also building a limited web application that can be easily viewed with a phone.

Q4. How will the AQUAPRO affect my tank?

A. Although the size of your aquarium can vary the effects of your AQUAPRO, we made this product to work in most standard sized aquariums. Our wave maker will be affected by the location of how the rocks and other decors are installed in your aquarium. If you have more qustions, please contact us for more information. : aquaprohelp@gmail.com

Q5: I cannot find my species in the AQUAPRO application. What do I do?

A: We are sorry we left out your friends! If you can help us by registering them into our database, our team will get on it and add them to the application as soon as possible! 

 

Contact us

Frequently Asked Questions: aquaprohelp@gmail.com

-Contact team member-

Jiyoung Han, CEO: magentapiglet@gmail.com

Ilwhan Ahn, Senior Product Designer: ilwhana@gmail.com

Yoonjoong Kim, Senior Manager: yedikl@naver.com

WELCOME

#stopmonsanto is a scripted movie about five young activists who protest the actions of Monsanto by launching a #stopmonsanto campaign. The story begins with our main character attending an anti-Monsanto rally in an effort to impress his ex-girlfriend. While at the rally, he learns about Monsanto and soon becomes very involved in protesting against the company. Along the way, he teams up with several like-minded young people and they work together to raise awareness about Monsanto. When their initial methods of protest do not work, they perform a series of attention grabbing stunts. The protestors' actions put them in directly in the company’s sight, with devastating consequences.
THE STORY
<div>

We’re fed up with Monsanto and how they’re treating farmers and consumers, so we decided to make a movie about it. We want to know whether the foods we eat contain GMOs (they better not!) and we think that all foods should be properly labeled. We hope the movie is entertaining and helps educate viewers about what Monsanto is doing and what the company stands for. By donating and supporting the film, you have the chance to help #stopmonsanto!
<div>
WHO’S INVOLVED

Executive Producer – Mariel Hemingway

Mariel Hemingway is an Academy Award nominated actress, author, yoga video producer, activist and health expert who is focused on empowering people to live their best lives.
 
Producers – Blythe Metz and Priscilla Woolworth
 
Blythe Metz an actress who hosts and produces the popular online show Blythe Raw Live and the author of “The SuperNatural Green Diet.” Blythe is an environmentalist and the issues of GMOs and Monsanto's crimes are paramount to her beliefs.
Priscilla Woolworth is an eco warrior, eco entrepreneur, blogger, photographer, artist, and nature lover. She runs the eco-friendly almanac and store - http://www.priscillawoolworth.com.
Production Company – Monsanto Film Project
<div>
HOW YOUR MONEY WILL HELP

Even with our low budget film expertise, it is still a tremendous undertaking to make a movie. We need these funds in order to hire a proper crew and cast, obtain the necessary equipment, shoot the film on location in Los Angeles, and complete post-production work.  We’ll be working with a shoe-string budget and calling in favors from lots of friends, but there are still certain costs that need to be paid.

column15: >is an initiative to Install 200 Solar Geysers in 200 Woodstock Residents homes. Along the way we will explore the Highs and Lows of Cape Town and inter
column22: >act with Everyday South Africans.
column30:
>

Join us on a Journey in making a difference to the Lives of Woodstock Residents.

column1: • Reduce the strain on the South African grid
• Help a Woodstock household reduce their electrical bill
• Support local artisans
• Bring the global community closer
• Engage with Solar Woodstock through our various Perks

How we will use the funds:
When we receive the funds from Indiegogo we will launch a mass communication campaign to the residents of Woodstock, asking for their applications to either have a entire solar  power unit installed or portion  of the cost subsidised . 
One applications have been received a panel of loacal Woodstock residents will select the recipients on a structured Most Needy First  basis

Who will install the units:
Local suppliers will be given preference, thereby supporting the local economy and tradesmen and women. 
We have already identified suppliers and artisans willing to work on this project at wholesale prices, ensuring that we get the most out of our funds.

Hello, my name is Eduardo Vieira, Mechanical Engineering student from Venezuela. I am an ecologist and every day I see with concern the accumulation of plastic waste on our planet. Thinking about it I plan to design a machine to recycle 100% opensource that each of you may have in your home. Thus it could be recycled in a simple way, without all the difficult process that has not been carried out.
With your donation will design and build a prototype. At the end everyone will have access to the design (as will be opensource) but without your support may not be true.

Summary

I would like to purchase multiple bee hives, to be placed in the charge of several members of our community, to foster our local bee population. These human-protected colonies of bees would regularly create new wild colonies. One community at a time, we can save the bees.
What We Need
Our primary need is to purchase the hives, which are not cheap. Provided with adequate shelter, bees are very capable of providing for their own needs.
You will receive peace of mind knowing you are contributing to efforts to save the bees.

Hello Contributors!

We are two boys from Denmark, trying to get some money together for our project ''See the Rainforest''. If you don't know what is happening, they are taking it down, and we are against it! That is why we need your help! We need the world's help!

This is a great project

We are trying to make contact with GreenPeace or WWF, so that is where your funds will go to! We will contribute some money from our own pockets every time, any of you contributers support us! So we are in this game too!
We will try to stop this, but two boys from a little country like Denmark aren't enough! So please support our project!

The Impact

There is so much yet to be discovered in the rainforest, so why take it down?! so we can get a piece of paper? Most schools are starting to use a computer or just any kind of technology! so why should we keep on taking it down?
What we mean is, we want to stop this once and for all, by supporting us you will help making the change.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are not forcing you to pay us, in any kind of way! You can decide to make a debate about this yourself! But if you help us, we will help you and try to get your meaning through!

column4: >Wouldn’t it be great if there were an easy, effortless way for you to clean up rubbish in the ocean and on the beach? Well here it is!
column5: >Surf'n'Clean offers a range of eco-friendly products aimed at empowering surfers and beach-goers in the fight against ocean pollution.
column11:
> 

This campaign has two main goals.

First of all, we hope to raise the funds we need to begin producing, marketing and selling our products, in order to start making a real impact as soon as possible.

Our second goal is to spread the word and raise awareness about our brand. We have contacted various organisations and companies involved in waste management, and we hope that we can catch their attention and collaborate to keep our planet clean.

We truly believe that this can become not only the next must-have surf accessory, but also the next step in worldwide rubbish and waste management. 

 

 

 

​

 

Our main obstacle as of right now is manufacturing. We have very strong values when it comes to the environment and want our company to exemplify that. From using eco-friendly materials and fair-trade manufacturing techniques to shipping with minimal carbon emissions, we are aware that our costs will be a lot higher than if we simply did everything the ‘easy’ way. Nevertheless, we are committed to these values and will do everything we can to stick to them.
column12:
>How it works

It's as easy as 1, 2, 3!

column1: • Go out to surf with the SurfPocket in your back pocket or on your board already.
•  Before the end of the session, paddle around and pick up rubbish.
• Back on the beach, find a bin and empty out your SurfPocket!
<font color=""#0070c0"">Sp</font><font color=""#0070c0"">ecific features</font>
• Patches on surfboard are soft and don't affect performance.
• Netting is elastic which allows it to be flat and aerodynamic, but stretch and hold in place the plastic.
• Holes in the netting are large enough to let water flow through, but small enough to keep plastics in.
• Pocket is very slim which allows water and air to flow normally.
​
column2: >
column4:
> 

To stay true to our values, our shipping and transportation methods are as follow:

column1: • No plastic involved at all, all recycled carboard.
• Paying off a carbon tax for all transportation used.

column2:
> 

Hey there! 

Congratulations for making it all this way, here is a bit more info about our founder,

My name is Sebastian Fortineau, I’m a young surfer and traveller who is passionate about the environment. I recently took a trip to travel around the world, which took a turn and led me to create this project. I am currently studying Civil and Environmental Engineering at Imperial College London.

I came up with the idea for Surf’n’Clean in Bali, where I realised there were really no ways for surfers to easily pick up the rubbish floating in the ocean. It was really a shame that surfers who are so passionate about the ocean had no way of helping fight this problem. With some help, I worked on the design and details and arrived here, at an extremely promising company and products.

 

This is the stage where we need your help. As a contributor to this campaign, you will not only be contributing to a small project, but actively participating in saving our oceans.

 

","Wouldn’t it be great if there were an easy, effortless way for you to clean up rubbish in the ocean and on the beach? Well here it is!Surf'n'Clean offers a range of eco-friendly products aimed at empowering surfers and beach-goers in the fight against ocean pollution.    This campaign has two main goals.First of all, we hope to raise the funds we need to begin producing, marketing and selling our products, in order to start making a real impact as soon as possible.Our second goal is to spread the word and raise awareness about our brand. We have contacted various organisations and companies involved in waste management, and we hope that we can catch their attention and collaborate to keep our planet clean.We truly believe that this can become not only the next must-have surf accessory, but also the next step in worldwide rubbish and waste management.    ​ Our main obstacle as of right now is manufacturing. We have very strong values when it comes to the environment and want our company to exemplify that. From using eco-friendly materials and fair-trade manufacturing techniques to shipping with minimal carbon emissions, we are aware that our costs will be a lot higher than if we simply did everything the ‘easy’ way. Nevertheless, we are committed to these values and will do everything we can to stick to them.   How it worksIt's as easy as 1, 2, 3!

column1: Go out to surf with the SurfPocket in your back pocket or on your board already.
Before the end of the session, paddle around and pick up rubbish.
Back on the beach, find a bin and empty out your SurfPocket!
Specific features
Patches on surfboard are soft and don't affect performance.
Netting is elastic which allows it to be flat and aerodynamic, but stretch and hold in place the plastic.
Holes in the netting are large enough to let water flow through, but small enough to keep plastics in.
Pocket is very slim which allows water and air to flow normally.
​        To stay true to our values, our shipping and transportation methods are as follow:
No plastic involved at all, all recycled carboard.
Paying off a carbon tax for all transportation used.

Hey Everyone!

We are 8 participants selected to take part in a 3 week Sustainable Living Leadership Program thoughout August with the Rivershed Society of British Columbia. The program is a 25 day experiential learning river expedition to learn about topics such as sustainability, ecological footprints and food security along the mighty Fraser River.

We wish to support the small, but impactful non-profit charity behind this program by raising funds to purchase a new banner for their community booth  when they are at school and community events promoting the importance of BC riversheds.

The Rivershed Society of BC's mission is to protect, conserve and restore the health of BC riversheds in this generation and they do this by delivering educational and awareness raising programs and events to support communities in the Fraser River rivershed.
Please support us in raising funds for a new banner!
Please help us spread the news of our campaign widely using Indiegogo's media sharing tools.
Once again thank you in advance for your generous support in helping us help out this worthy charity!
Cheers!
Noelani, Candice, Christian, Megan, Colin, Marin and Marie and Logan
2013 Sustainable Living Leadership Program participants.

About me and my idea

My name is Andrew. I am a traveler and landscape photographer. I love nature and everything about it. Years of traveling has led me to believe that most people still don't realize or understand the impact of littering or what it does to our environment. What seems to be the general perception of littering is the thinking that someone else will clean-up after them.

Study shows that every year just national park visitors generate 100 million pounds of garbage. This amount of trash would normally require 20 million household trash bags, which if laid end-to-end, would stretch from New York to Los Angeles and back again…Twice!

A recent survey conducted by Subaru of America and the National Parks Conservation
Association found that 59% of Americans are unaware of the problem. A second study found that the bulk of that waste is coming from outside the parks and that the biggest part of that is food waste and plastic water bottles.

Some part of this garbage is washed into the rivers by the rain and then from the rivers out to the ocean. There are already 5 huge garbage patches and each of them is miles and miles wide.

Source: The Garbage Patch Estate project

“Plastic has become a vital part of our lives of convenience. Yet the coffee cup lids, water bottles and bags we use once and throw away do end up somewhere - in landfills, but also in the ocean.

Nearly every piece of plastic ever made still exists today. More than five trillion pieces of plastic are already in the oceans, and by 2050 there will be more plastic in the sea than fish, by weight, according to the Ellen MacArthur Foundation.

Some 8 million tons of plastic trash leak into the ocean annually, and it's getting worse every year. Americans are said to use 2.5 million plastic bottles every hour.

Nothing is an emergency until you feel the burn, or see the red lights. Here plastic's impact is staring you in the face.” - CNN

 

This is the reason why I started this big project “Garbage Doesn’t Fit.”

At the end of June 2017, I am going to take the biggest road trip in my life. During 6 months, I will drive my camper van around the most popular places in the United States, pick up trash in those places and take pictures of it on the same popular backgrounds as everyone used to see. The main goal of this project is to show people the truth and encourage them to act before it's too late.

My travel plan

My plan is to visit at least 500 popular outdoor places: trails, forests, lakes, national parks, national monuments, mountains, beaches and to take hundreds of pictures of polluted environment. Literally, I am going to sleep and eat in my camper van during my 6-month project. Sometimes I will hike to a better viewpoint, backpack, and even camp onsite if I have to leave my van too far. Pictures that I am going to take will be posted on my Instagram account with 50k followers which will help me spread the message.

Total distance I am going to cover is about 18000 - 19000 miles.

What I need

The biggest part of visible expenses is gas. The second one is food, then gear and some extra budget in case of unseen circumstances, and above all your support to make this project a real success.

Without your support and donations, it would be very difficult to achieve this goal. I have saved up some with which I am getting my van ready and I’m hoping to raise $10,000 more to assist me with my 6-month road trip for a greater cause. Any financial gift from you will be a big help in reaching my goal.

I’ve given herewith the breakdown of what the $10,000 I’m hoping to raise comprises of:

The breakdown of cost for 6 months:
Gas = 18000 - 19000 miles = $5000
Food = $3000 - $3500
Gear and Consumables = $1500 - $2000
Extra budget in case of breakdowns = $5000
Total: ~$15000 − my savings $5000 = $10000

What I want to achieve

By showing people their favorite places covered with garbage I hope to get through to them to make them see the effects of their indifference. Building awareness and providing education are the most effective ways in making progress towards real change and lifestyle adjustments.

Risks &
column2:
Challenges

I have a lot of experience traveling by myself and I am totally fine about that. The biggest challenges I am going to face are unforeseen possible breakdowns in the middle of nowhere such as a flat tire, oil leak or belt replacement. I am going to prepare for that but the reality is that such repairs can be just expensive.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this cause, here are some ways you can help:

1.  Stop using plastic bags and buying bottled water
column3: 2.  Start using reusable items: at least cups, bottles and bags
column4:
3.  Consider picking up at least 3 pieces of trash which are not your own next time you go camping, backpacking, hiking or fishing.
4.  ALWAYS throw garbage in a garbage bin and be an example to others.
5.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share my crowdfunding campaign!

More videos about the problem:

 

Together we are building a better and brighter future not just for us but for our future generation “our children” – but without you, it just wouldn’t be possible.

I don't want to protect the environment. I want to create a world where the environment doesn't need protection.

Thank you so much for your support!
