<h2 style=""text-align: center

We are a group of young entrepreneurs wanting to create a social and environmental impact in our zones. What is the impact? Our main impact is the creation of ecological backpacks out of recycled fabric. It all started as an idea of helping the environment and giving a durable product. What make us different from others? We want to give the people the freedom to decorate their backpacks as they wish by helping then environment, using plastic bottles and containers to make keychains and screw caps to make pins.

Our campaign is to get support and get people to know us, also to start to give knew life to products already used, it is important to us because as citizens we want to make an impact, we are seeking for the world to know us and help us.

We have a lot of plans for our enterprise, we want to reach the point in which we can make the backpacks out of plastic bottles instead of recycled fabric or both, so we want to reach that point. Be known by the world and the ability to create it from the beginning. We want to have the capacity to create big quantities of backpacks and the accessories and be the entrepreneurs we want to be.

The world needs people worried for the environment and it is not only about stop using straws, it is about more, thinking out of the box, wanting a change. We want a change, we want to reduce the contamination created by plastic and fabric and also give it another use to this materials. The change is in you.
What We Need &

We need around 5,000 dollars, firstly because our one time costs, we need ovens and sewers to make the keychains and the backpacks, tables, chairs, laptops and drawers, also if we include the services just as water, electricity, gas, internet, phone installations it cost us around 2,000 dollars. On the other hand, our fixed and variable costs are because the services we just mention before and adding the rent, promotion, trash collection service but also the material to make the backpacks and to make our enterprise work, we need pins, fabric straps, zippers, scissors, measuring tape, linen, needles, plastic containers and bottles, box for the package, bags for the package too and the shipment that costs us around 3,000 dollars.

Backpacks are an accessory that we as students use at least five days in the week, so what better that carrying your own style in your back, the style that make you feel comfortable while you are helping the environment. We want to give your internal artist a opportunity to express itself and give you the freedom to personalize this backpack mixing colours, textures, pins, keychains, patches.
If we do not reach our goal we will use the money to start the business with baby steps, trying to use what is at our reach to increase it and make our enterprise grow.
The Impact

Our project is not only about the environment but also about the culture and social, why? As we know Mexico is a country full of culture and colours but also has a high level of people and mostly women who do not have any sources or the facility to work or get a job, moreover, also our culture is not known, what are we going to do? we are going to pay them to make the backpacks, give them a job with a fair payment, also that they can make their designs with the fabric as a prove of the culture of our country in order to an equality in jobs and to increase their income and to let the world know about the culture of Mexico by using designs full of itself.

As we want this to become a reality, we have been looking for places with a high level of women without any jobs and low incomes nearby us. We have found places like ""DIF Madero"", ""DIF Tampico"" in which we can take this idea as a project and campaigns and not only get their help but also help them.
Risks &

The principal risk is not receiving the money in case we do not receive anything our project will be forgotten and left behind. On the other hand, we can solve this by looking for other options to get some money in order to keep this project alive
Other Ways You Can Help

We want a project to be known all around the world, so by sharing and telling others about what is our project about is really helpful!! Make some noise!! Share our social media with all your contacts! And if you have ideas for use feel free to contact us and tell us what you think.
Thank you for helping us to become a reality and to make an impact. Thank you for taking the time to know us. Thank you.

Summary
saving the world... together.

Introduction 

THE PROBLEM
- Every 10 seconds a child

dies as a result of under-nutrition. (Over 3 million/year)
- Every 20 seconds a child dies due to poor sanitation (Over 1.5 million/year)
- Almost 4 in 10 people lack access to improved sanitation (2.5 billion people)
- 1 in 7 people are forced to resort to open defecation for lack of other options.
  (1 billion people)
- 1 in 9 people lack access to safe water (750 million people)
- 1 in 9 people do not have enough food to lead a healthy active life (850 million
   people)
- 1 in 6 people live in extreme poverty, defined as less than $1.25 per day (1.2 billion
   people)
- 8 in 10 people who lack access to improved water live in rural areas (600 million
   people)
Poverty, lack of
sanitation, no access to clean water, and not enough food means
millions and millions of people are suffering and dying needlessly!

Our flagship program will create financially self-sufficient Humanitarian Sites that supply FREE sewage and water treatment, among other things, to poor areas.

   Together, we can change this, and
not merely temporarily with charity, but permanently with
infrastructure. GISS will change how we think about helping people.
GISS relies on low-tech
and green technology that allows it to be financially and environmentally
sustainable. It addresses all the humanitarian problems above, and
helps improve the environment.
The goal of this
campaign is to launch GISS and propel it and its solutions onto the
world stage. To accomplish this and to change the world we must be able
to present GISS in an understandable manner, reach governments, find
backers, garner attention for our project.
Why does this campaign
and this project matter? Simple... GISS matters because lives are at

stake! Millions of lives are at stake!

   To understand what we mean by sites, and how a GISS site functions you can read the following PDF. It will provide a more concrete understanding: https://www.dropbox.com/s/6gb2577q9lyeu5k/GISS%20Technologies%20Project%20Summary.pdf?dl=0
ABOUT
ME
My name is Rob
Corra. I am
the founder of GISS Technologies and designer of GISS. A humanitarian
philosopher and problem solver, I
started my career in agriculture, before entering the US Air Force. I
served 9 years doing high tech electronic maintenance and E&amp
(Engineering and Installation) projects working with people from many
countries.
After
the Air Force, I studied philosophy, anthropology, religions, and
science. I became a Philosophy Professor, a store owner, and owner of
a software company. I managed the successful creation of a virtual
world for a client that saw, at times 4 teams of programmers,
artists, audio personnel, and more scattered over 2 countries.
Six
years ago I moved to Brazil. It was here that I realized the main
reason poor areas are not helped is economics. It costs money to
build, and more importantly, maintain the necessary sites to help
people. It was at this time that I began working on GISS,
while running my own ESL school.
have also spent over 25 years studying and designing complete aquatic
systems, including complete nitrogen cycles, using aquarium systems,
which creates the basis of aquaponics (aquaculture and hydroponics)
systems.
WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS
WILL ACCOMPLISH
Your contributions will
help us to change the way the world thinks about humanitarian work!
With your help we will save lives! Each contribution will have a permanent impact.
We tend to think that
the world's problems are too big for us affect, let alone to solve,
but this is untrue. We can make a difference. <b>YOU CAN MAKE A
DIFFERENCE!
Essentially our sites
will create permanent solutions to the problems of poor sanitation,
unclean water, malnutrition, poverty, and even many environmental

problems in areas where we operate. 

   Instead of providing aid to an
area, we will install a site that generates an income for the area,

while providing them with their essential needs. 

   There is more information and links in the sections ""Additional Information."" 

   So to learn more, read on...
What
We Need &amp
FUNDRAISING GOALS AND
BUDGET
The amount necessary to get running
is $40,000. This will launch GISS, however, each successive stretch
goal will allow us to do more, faster, and longer. Goal 3 would be a full
launch of Phase I. This means we would then be ready to build live sites and
speak with governments about site locations.
A brief budget
breakdown follows.
Allows for the creation
of the company, minimal legal fees, accounting fees, and protection
of IP (Intellectual Property). It will allow us to create the office
and gives us 6 months of operations, which will include the creation
of the website and Promotional Magazine.
Goal 2 (Stretch Goal 1)
Allows for the creation
of the company, legal fees, accounting fees, and protection of IP
(Intellectual Property). It will allow us to create the office and
gives us 12 months of operations, which will include the creation of
the website and Promotional Magazine. Also we will have a limited
budget for traveling to meet officials in preparation of creating the
sites.
Goal 3 (Stretch Goal 2)
Allows for the
completion of Phase I. This includes the creation of the company,
legal fees, accounting fees, and protection of IP (Intellectual
Property). It will allow us to create the office and gives us 12
months of operations, which will include the creation of the website
and Promotional Magazine. Also we will have a budget for traveling to
meet officials in preparation of creating the sites, as well as,
being able to travel to meet VIPs, partners, and even give talks to
raise awareness and ultimately funds.
This level of funding
will also allow us to completely prepare for Phase II/III, compete
the Internal Design Manual and R&amp
videos/packages, and do some preliminary site surveys
Goals Beyond 3
Reaching Goal 4 is beyond
our wildest expectations and will allow us to actually create humanitarian
sites. The next Stretch Goal after Goal 3 is $1,000,000. Some campaigns have
crushed their original launch goal, and we definitely hope to do the
same thing. However for simplicity's sake these higher goals will be put in a separate PDF
along with a more detailed version of the budget.
The extra budgetary
information may be found at the following link:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/x4mu2lasyqh0byf/Goals%20and%20Stretch%20Goals%20with%20Simplified%20Budget.pdf?dl=0
PERKS
Hopefully you are
contributing to save lives. This in itself is a great reward.
However, we are extremely grateful to those who extend a
helping hand, thus we want to remember you in perpetuity.
GISS is a humanitarian
project that will not produce a specific product, but instead provide
a service and save lives. As such, we are offering recognition for
your help, not a product. Your contributions will be recorded in the website,
Promotional Magazine, and Promo Booklet as founding contributors.
These will remain as long as GISS Technologies is functioning.
Or you may chose to HONOR
someone (or 2 people), such as a child, parent, or even parents with
a contribution in their name, instead of your own.
You may also chose to
contribute in MEMORY of someone (or 2 people) whose deceased in the
same manner as honoring the living.
The
Impact of GISS
The GISS Project will
completely transform people's lives and how we view humanitarian
work. Reaching the poor, especially in rural areas is a costly endeavor
and one that governments tend to ignore, despite the fact that a
significant portion of the world's population live in rural areas.
We will address this
need in a unique way, and make the change to an area permanent. We

will transform the world. 

   When we help a community, we will create the
infrastructure for them to meet their basic needs and create an
income to run the infrastructure. This means that once established, GISS Technologies will not have to raise more money to support this
region again, barring any disasters, but even these we will likely be
able to handle once the company is robust enough.
While initially
focusing on free services in rural settings, GISS Technologies will be able to help in
urban settings, and even sell green solutions/services to
industries, and developed areas. The company's income will help with
research and development costs, operational costs, handling disasters
and unexpected costs, and expanding into new regions.
Risks
&amp
Our biggest risk is
that we do not receive the funding we need to proceed. We must pass
our first goal of $40,000 to, among other things, hire an illustrator to create the
promotional material so we can show governments and organizations
what our system can accomplish.
Our immediate stretch
goals (Stretch Goal 1 and 2) are also important in accelerating our
time scale and helping people faster, as it will allow us to travel,
do presentations, and access more resources. If we fail to hit our
stretch goals then we will have to move forward more slowly and will
need to search for funding to proceed beyond our initial goals.
We also face design
hurdles for making the sites smaller and more flexible in regards to
their operating environment. Currently, the technology and designs that have been proven to work require large areas and Sub-Tropic to
Tropic climes. GISS Technologies has designed some innovative
solutions to by-pass these limitations, however we will need to build
our Research &amp
column2: Development facility to test these designs. Until

column1: we can do this, we will be limited to rural areas in warmer climates
for our sites. Fortunately for us, this is where the majority of the
need exists.
Other
Ways You Can Help
Besides contributing, you can help with this
life saving, world altering project by sharing it. Share the campaign
with everyone you know. Spread our story far and wide.
Help us reach those who
want to help stop such needless death and suffering..

column1: Summary
GISS
saving the world... together.
Introduction THE PROBLEM
- Every 10 seconds a child

dies as a result of under-nutrition. (Over 3 million/year)- Every 20 seconds a child dies due to poor sanitation (Over 1.5 million/year)- Almost 4 in 10 people lack access to improved sanitation (2.5 billion people)- 1 in 7 people are forced to resort to open defecation for lack of other options.  (1 billion people)- 1 in 9 people lack access to safe water (750 million people)- 1 in 9 people do not have enough food to lead a healthy active life (850 million    people)- 1 in 6 people live in extreme poverty, defined as less than $1.25 per day (1.2 billion    people)- 8 in 10 people who lack access to improved water live in rural areas (600 million    people)
Poverty, lack of
sanitation, no access to clean water, and not enough food means
millions and millions of people are suffering and dying needlessly!
Our flagship program will create financially self-sufficient Humanitarian Sites that supply FREE sewage and water treatment, among other things, to poor areas.   Together, we can change this, and
not merely temporarily with charity, but permanently with
infrastructure. GISS will change how we think about helping people.
GISS relies on low-tech
and green technology that allows it to be financially and environmentally
sustainable. It addresses all the humanitarian problems above, and
helps improve the environment.
The goal of this
campaign is to launch GISS and propel it and its solutions onto the
world stage. To accomplish this and to change the world we must be able
to present GISS in an understandable manner, reach governments, find
backers, garner attention for our project.
Why does this campaign
and this project matter? Simple... GISS matters because lives are at

stake! Millions of lives are at stake!   To understand what we mean by sites, and how a GISS site functions you can read the following PDF. It will provide a more concrete understanding: https://www.dropbox.com/s/6gb2577q9lyeu5k/GISS%20Technologies%20Project%20Summary.pdf?dl=0
ABOUT
ME
My name is Rob
Corra. I am
the founder of GISS Technologies and designer of GISS. A humanitarian
philosopher and problem solver, I
started my career in agriculture, before entering the US Air Force. I
served 9 years doing high tech electronic maintenance and E&I
(Engineering and Installation) projects working with people from many
countries.
After
the Air Force, I studied philosophy, anthropology, religions, and
science. I became a Philosophy Professor, a store owner, and owner of
a software company. I managed the successful creation of a virtual
world for a client that saw, at times 4 teams of programmers,
artists, audio personnel, and more scattered over 2 countries.
Six
years ago I moved to Brazil. It was here that I realized the main
reason poor areas are not helped is economics. It costs money to
build, and more importantly, maintain the necessary sites to help
people. It was at this time that I began working on GISS,
while running my own ESL school.
I
have also spent over 25 years studying and designing complete aquatic
systems, including complete nitrogen cycles, using aquarium systems,
which creates the basis of aquaponics (aquaculture and hydroponics)
systems.
WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS
WILL ACCOMPLISH
Your contributions will
help us to change the way the world thinks about humanitarian work!
With your help we will save lives! Each contribution will have a permanent impact.
We tend to think that
the world's problems are too big for us affect, let alone to solve,
but this is untrue. We can make a difference. YOU CAN MAKE A
DIFFERENCE!
Essentially our sites
will create permanent solutions to the problems of poor sanitation,
unclean water, malnutrition, poverty, and even many environmental
problems in areas where we operate.    Instead of providing aid to an
area, we will install a site that generates an income for the area,
while providing them with their essential needs.    There is more information and links in the sections ""Additional Information.""    So to learn more, read on...
What
We Need & What You Get
FUNDRAISING GOALS AND
BUDGET
The amount necessary to get running
is $40,000. This will launch GISS, however, each successive stretch
goal will allow us to do more, faster, and longer. Goal 3 would be a full
launch of Phase I. This means we would then be ready to build live sites and
speak with governments about site locations.
A brief budget
breakdown follows.
Allows for the creation
of the company, minimal legal fees, accounting fees, and protection
of IP (Intellectual Property). It will allow us to create the office
and gives us 6 months of operations, which will include the creation
of the website and Promotional Magazine.

This level of funding
will also allow us to completely prepare for Phase II/III, compete

column4:
>for Maya farmers and families. 

 

This invitation is for all of my like-minded friends, who share the dream of uplifting the poor with hope and healing. Everyone with the same vision of creating sustainable eco-homes for orphans, with organic farms, art and yoga inspire and encourage my own vivid vision. Together, we can collaborate skills, ideas, passion &
column5: compassion to use creatively utilize resources for social justice and to impact &amp
column6:
uplift those in cycles of poverty. 

 

I'm Arli, a gardener, poet, photographer &
column7:
dreamer of dreams. At age 17, a dream burned in my heart to create sustainable eco-homes for orphans. I spent 12 years, joining projects in Africa, South East Asia, Australia, South America and the South Pacific Islands learning, contributing and gaining a greater vision of my goals. Now, 20 years later, I have this unique, remarkable opportunity to uplift the Mayan villages of Guatemala with sustainability and hope. Please help me fulfill this dream!

 

I'm amazed to discover this incredible opportunity in Guatemala, where I can contribute writing, photography, permaculture, gorilla gardening, village outreach projects, and yoga all in one space! Awakened Spirit Yoga and Atitlan Organics unite to impact communities with organic food, and nourish spirits with yoga. This is a pivotal chance to cultivate writing skills, yoga teaching and permaculture design. I admire &
column8:
respect the Mayan people group. I’m so honored to have this chance to collaborate to bring eco-system restoration, soil and water conservation and native plant preservation for Maya farmers and families. 

I believe together we can accomplish anything we can dream. I love the South African motto, Ubuntu ~ “I am, because we are. ~ 

 

 

Thank you for being part of my journey. 

 

With Love, 

 

Arli. 

 

   https://www.awakenedspirityoga.com/

History of the David Wright House

Frank Lloyd Wright designed this 2,500-square-foot concrete home for David and his wife, Gladys, on a desert site facing north toward Camelback Mountain in Phoenix, Arizona in the early 1950's. The David Wright house is the Guggenheim’s prodigal son, except that unlike the museum, whose interior creates a vertical streetscape while turning its back on the city, David’s house was configured by Wright to look both inward and out. It twists around a central courtyard, a Pompeian oasis to which he gave a plunge pool and shade garden, but also faces onto the surrounding desert, with sweeping views of the mountain.
<div>

Current Status of the David Wright House
Its new owners are planning on tearing down this iconic home and subdividing the property into smaller lots to build new homes. The uproar has just begun but it can't be left up to the courts to decide the fate of this national treasure. Unless a new owner can be found to purchase the property it may be demolished.
<div>

The David Wright House Preservation Trust Campaign
Our campaign is designed to raise the necessary funds to save the house from demolition by purchasing it from the current owners. We would then work to create a museum similar to many of the other existing Wright homes in the country. To help support its maintenance we would open the property up to tours, weddings, and other events appropriate to its status.
<div>
Giving Levels and Membership
We understand that what you truly want from your donation is not a souvenir mug or t-shirt, but rather the success of the Trust’s ambitious work. In that, we Thank you.

My name is Nina and I am a student at the internationally leadership school The Kaospilots in Denmark.
www.kaospilot.dk
I am 24 years old, female, danish, lives in bogota at the moment and am very passionated about urban gardening and how to grow and buy local.
The reason why this is important for me is that I believe that many cities need more threes, plants and flowers. In my opinion this makes a beautiful city and makes people in the city more happy.

I also think that it is very important to create a debat around buying local food. We spend millions on transporting food instead of buying the same product next door. Think of the possibilities of decreaseing polution if more people bought locally produced vegetables...

When supporting me, you support the possiblity of a company on the rise. An organization that will create and support urban gardening and locally produced vegetabels. It is a small step towards a more green World.

Right now my next step is to go to New York City to find an internship and learn much more about urban gardening and how to start an organisation concerning the topic. After my internship I will return to Copenhagen and start to work on opening up my own organisation.
If you are not able to support me by funding I will very much appriciate contacts around the World who works with urban gardening.

Thank you for reading about my project!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
WHO WE ARE

We are a group of students from the University of Tennessee working to raise money for Ijams Nature Center as part of its new Weed Warriors campaign. As the city of Knoxville grows, it is vital to understand and promote the importance of nature preservation. The Weed Warriors campaign does just that by gathering a team of volunteers to eradicate invasive species that are harmful to native flora and fauna.
WHO IS IJAMS

Founded in 1910, Ijams Nature Center is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that operates an extensive green space located a short drive from downtown Knoxville. Their goal is to educate and promote the conservation of nature through events and experiences within the park. The 315 acres that embody Ijams consist of multiple nature trails, boardwalks, and education facilities.
WHAT WE NEED

Through our fundraising, we hope to eliminate the invasive plant species that are encroaching on Ijams. We plan to purchase a single brushcutter made by Stihl. The brushcutter will be a vital piece of equipment. It will allow volunteers of Weed Warriors to eliminate invasive plants quicker, smoother, and less intensively than previous methods. We have set a goal of $1,500 to help Ijams develop a better environment.
PERKS FOR DONATIONS

In addition to helping the Knoxville community, we are providing our donors with the opportunity to accept perks. Every donor will be given the options to have a free shout out on our Facebook page, but specific donor perks are as follows:
$10- Ijams sticker
$35- 1 of 10 green hand-knitted hats
$75- custom t-shirts with the Ijams Nature Center logo incorporated and printed on them
$250- have our team complete five volunteer hours at your charity of choice
$500- a personalized thank you video from our team
All donors who accept perks will have the option of collecting their perks from Ijams Nature Center or shipped to their address.
IMPACT ON KNOXVILLE COMMUNITY

The Ijams Nature Center is an important and valuable part of the greater Knoxville community. Ijams offers a fun, family-friendly green space that can be accessed by anyone free of charge. Ijams uses the donations it receives to keep the park clean and to support its larger nature preservation goals throughout the local area. The Weed Warriors campaign is one of its many ambitious projects meant to sustain the natural environment and conserve the beauty of Knoxville.
HOW ELSE TO HELP

For donors who are not able to give monetary contributions at this time, Ijams offers a multitude of volunteer opportunities for those who are interested in donating their personal help. Those who wish to donate an item instead of money are highly encouraged to donate pieces of equipment needed by Ijams. The best way to get involved is to share information about Ijams to friends, family, and social media. We encourage you to come out and enjoy Ijams’ resources.
","WHO WE ARE

We are a group of students from the University of Tennessee working to raise money for Ijams Nature Center as part of its new Weed Warriors campaign. As the city of Knoxville grows, it is vital to understand and promote the importance of nature preservation. The Weed Warriors campaign does just that by gathering a team of volunteers to eradicate invasive species that are harmful to native flora and fauna.
WHO IS IJAMS

Founded in 1910, Ijams Nature Center is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that operates an extensive green space located a short drive from downtown Knoxville. Their goal is to educate and promote the conservation of nature through events and experiences within the park. The 315 acres that embody Ijams consist of multiple nature trails, boardwalks, and education facilities.

Upcoming Film (In Production) : Aqua Seafoam Shame
<h3><em><span style=""color: #33cccc
column2: >Documenting the Pacific Garbage Patch and finding Eco-friendly Alternatives to Plastics ~ A Call to End Plastic Ocean Pollution.

column1: Plastics are destroying our oceans and it's way more serious of a problem than any war, political or economic issues. You may have already heard the rumors of this plastic island of floating trash called the Pacific Garbage Patch that is caught up in the strong vortex's of the Northern Gyres.
Well... unfortunately it's not a rumor. It's very real.

This plastic island of floating trash was once rumored to be twice the size of texas, but upon careful re-examination it is now estimated to be the size of the continental United States. It is so devastating that even if we all stopped using plastics tommorrow, it has already left an environmental impact that will take thousands of years to recover from.

So what can we do about it? ""Well, we can all stop using disposable plastics"" says author, filmmaker, and environmental surfer Veronica Grey. We use these plastic bags for approximately 5 to 10 minutes after we leave the grocery store and then just throw it away. Well there is no ""away"". Plastics do not biodegrade, they do not simply disappear.

That's when award-winning iPhone filmmaker Veronica Grey aka The Surf Lady got the idea to start documenting her exploration into the world of plastics and how our obsession with single-use disposable plastics eventually ends up polluting our oceans forever. What she discovers is startling. Firstly, she learns that there is already a bio-plastic alternative available, but getting companies to switch their packaging is the hard part, because customers don't seem to want it. Then she learns there's not just 1 but 5 ocean garbage patches!!!

Well...that was enough for The Surf Lady because she knew something was terribly wrong with that picture. The decision was made to start documenting these ""Garbage Patches"" and to really look into finding eco-friendly alternatives to chemical plastics. The Surf Lady has been contacting the companies of all the favorite products you love and encouraging them to switch to compostable plastic packaging in hopes of saving ourselves from a cataclysmic event.
We are the problem, and we are the solution!

With your help we will be able to bring this important ocean-saving documentary to the world and onto movie screens everywhere. It is our hope that once presented with the information in this film,  we will inspire people to make the necessary changes away from disposable plastics and to focus on more earth-friendly bio-plastics and compostable packaging. You may not be aware that approximately 25% of the earth's surface is now considered to be ""garbage landfill."" That is a startling fact.

We may not be able to solve all the problems of Ocean Pollution but we certainly don't need to be contributing to it anymore. Join us in our campaign to get rid of harmful toxic chemical plastics that do not break-down or biodegrade! Help us get this important environmental message out there into the public awareness. We've made it our mission to stop this plastic madness and so should you! Each one of us has contributed to these plastic  problems, now each one of us has to contribute to the inevitable solutions!
<div>
INVESTMENT IN THE FUTURE
<div>

If you care about the planet, the environment, the people and the 177 different species of marine life that are being directly affected by this plastic pollution, then you will find it in your heart to make an investment in the future. Your decision to fund this project will help with all the necessary operating expenses of bringing this kind of documentary film into the 2013 film festivals and ultimately onto screens everywhere. The Aqua Seafoam Shame project is made up of volunteers who donate their time and skills knowing we won't have a future unless we act now! More info here about us.
This is a not-for-profit film. ALL funds raised will go toward the production of this environmental film.

iPhone Filmmaker Veronica Grey has won the 2011 New Media Award from the Pare Lorentz Film Festival for her short film about the Burning Man Festival called ""!5 Minutes of Flame."" You can also view her IMDB page for more references of her past work in film and acting. Most recently Veronica travelled all the way to Hawaii for the eye-opening Surfrider presentation called HORROR: Shocking facts about the Pacific Garbage Patch which will be included and featured  in the film. See our Gallery for a sneak peek!
THE FUNDRAISING PERKS

It's our wish, if anything, that we have atleast opened your eyes to the effects of disposable plastics and ocean pollution. We hope that you will accept these perks as an extension of the message behind the film.  In other words we need you to help inspire others to
column2: >go green! So we made these items to help you express that message. Reducing, reusing, and recycling all play a major role in our responsibilities towards a solution to ocean pollution!

column1: CLICK THE LINKS BELOW TO VIEW SAMPLES OF THE PERKS

""Smells Like Green Spirit"" Reusable Shopping Bag

The screenings will most likely be in various locations around California and Vancouver. (Locations to be announced)

Thank you for taking the time to view our project.

Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &
column3:
Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

About waste2energy campaign

Waste2energy campaign is designed to support the launch of the ""3E briquettes"" - award winning,  cutting edge technology innovation which found a way to use coal dust (which is hazardous by-product in coal production) and by mixing it with only organic substances create energy-rich, yet ecology friendly briquettes.

Team behind ""3E briquettes"" has invested more than 10 years in research in the field of creating the product, which is now finalized.
Also, we have invested more than USD 1.5 million in developing the first factory which will be able to process the coal dust and create environment friendly briquettes with high energetic potential. The factory is located in Ub, central Serbia (Central Europe) and has a capacity to transform 150.000 tons a coal dust a year into environment-friendly, energy-rich briquettes.
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

So far we have invested USD 1.5 million in research, factory and machinery, and now it is time to start production. With USD 200.000 we will be able to acquire and transport the first batch of 8.000 tons of coal dust from nearby Kolubara open mine and thus start our production cycle.

column1: By supporting us, with every 25 dollars, you will have our planet cleaner for one ton of hazardous coal dust, and we will plant one oak tree as a token of appreciation for your support. Each tree will have a personalized card with donors name on it and will send you the photo on GPS location of your tree.
For bigger contributions, we have more packages, which are threefold:
<ul>
• they help reduce coal dust on our planet
• they plant a tree
• they support kindergartens and schools in Serbia with free energy
In case we do not reach our campaign goal, the process will be slower and it will take us more time to break even, but regardless of that, we will deliver all the perks we promised to backers.
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
If you are not in a position to help, please spread a good word of our project to your friends, acquaintances and colleagues who might be able to help us.

Summary

An emerging environmental concern is the presence of pharmaceuticals in Long Island's Lloyd aquifer and the Magothy aquifer - Long Island's only source of drinking water.  Unwanted medications are being flushed down toilets and poured into drains.  Eventually, these unwanted medications reach our drinking water supply.  Yes, I like my neighbor...I really do...but I don't want my neighbor's unwanted medications in my drinking water. Neither do you. By installing free and convenient pharmaceutical collection receptacles in retail pharmacies you and I (and our neighbors) can take back unwanted medications to any retail pharmacy and responsibly dispose of unwanted medications.  Collection receptacles in retail pharmacies will provide a dual benefit: [1] ENVIRONMENTAL - keep unwanted medications out of our drinking water supply, and [2] SOCIETAL - keep prescription drugs out of the hands of teens and adults who seek to secretly (and sometimes fatally) abuse prescription medications.  The abuse of LEGAL prescription medications kills more people than ILLEGAL drugs such as heroine and cocaine. Each year, more than 1.2 million emergency room visits are caused by illicit abuse of prescription drugs.  Prescription drugs are stolen by family and friends (particulalrly teens) from household medicine cabinets.  The single best thing that can be done, for the ENVIRONMENT and for SOCIETY, is to empty medicine cabinets of unwanted medications and properly dispose of them by depositing the unwanted medications into specially designed and secure collection receptacles at retail pharmacies.
What We Need

The funding goal enables the Lloyd Magothy Water Trust to hire the necessary professionals (attorney and CPA) to incorporate, and apply to the IRS for 501(c)(3) status.  Additionally, the funds will pay a Long Island metal fabrication company to build a specially designed, steel collection receptacle prototype that meets DEA's proposed specifications. The prototype will be demonstrated to charitable foundations and civic organizations (e.g. Elks, Lions, Rotary) for the purpose of procuring additional funding to build and install 100s more additional collection receptacles in retail pharmacies and police stations.  Essentially, the funding sought via Indiegogo is seed money.  Legal $2,000.  501c3 formation $1,500.  Prototype $3,000.  Purchase and installation of the first 3 collection receptacles $3,000. Incineration of collected drugs $500. Thank you. Thank you sincerely.
<div>
","Summary

An emerging environmental concern is the presence of pharmaceuticals in Long Island's Lloyd aquifer and the Magothy aquifer - Long Island's only source of drinking water.  Unwanted medications are being flushed down toilets and poured into drains.  Eventually, these unwanted medications reach our drinking water supply.  Yes, I like my neighbor...I really do...but I don't want my neighbor's unwanted medications in my drinking water. Neither do you. By installing free and convenient pharmaceutical collection receptacles in retail pharmacies you and I (and our neighbors) can take back unwanted medications to any retail pharmacy and responsibly dispose of unwanted medications.  Collection receptacles in retail pharmacies will provide a dual benefit: [1] ENVIRONMENTAL - keep unwanted medications out of our drinking water supply, and [2] SOCIETAL - keep prescription drugs out of the hands of teens and adults who seek to secretly (and sometimes fatally) abuse prescription medications.  The abuse of LEGAL prescription medications kills more people than ILLEGAL drugs such as heroine and cocaine. Each year, more than 1.2 million emergency room visits are caused by illicit abuse of prescription drugs.  Prescription drugs are stolen by family and friends (particulalrly teens) from household medicine cabinets.  The single best thing that can be done, for the ENVIRONMENT and for SOCIETY, is to empty medicine cabinets of unwanted medications and properly dispose of them by depositing the unwanted medications into specially designed and secure collection receptacles at retail pharmacies.
What We Need

The funding goal enables the Lloyd Magothy Water Trust to hire the necessary professionals (attorney and CPA) to incorporate, and apply to the IRS for 501(c)(3) status.  Additionally, the funds will pay a Long Island metal fabrication company to build a specially designed, steel collection receptacle prototype that meets DEA's proposed specifications. The prototype will be demonstrated to charitable foundations and civic organizations (e.g. Elks, Lions, Rotary) for the purpose of procuring additional funding to build and install 100s more additional collection receptacles in retail pharmacies and police stations.  Essentially, the funding sought via Indiegogo is seed money.  Legal $2,000.  501c3 formation $1,500.  Prototype $3,000.  Purchase and installation of the first 3 collection receptacles $3,000. Incineration of collected drugs $500. Thank you. Thank you sincerely.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Southampton, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lloyd-magothy-water-trust/pica

Un-Natural Nature
If you enjoy the great outdoors, or watching wildlife documentaries , or eating food. Then your life will be affected by plastic. Plastic litters our beaches, kills wild animals and poisons our food.
And the problem is getting worse.  Plastic is entering our oceans faster than ever, with no sign of slowing down.
£5 per KG
£5 pays to remove 1KG of plastic from remote UK beaches. We will start in Scotland.
We need to remove 1 ton at a time, to make the project as economical as possible. Costs will include looking after a team of people, boat hire, cutting equipment and waste disposal charges.
Project Impact
Microplastics are the irreversible pollutant that are causing havoc in our oceans. Microplastic comes in two varieties:
<ul>
• Primary Microplastics - From laundry fibres and tire particles
• Secondary Microplastics - Enter the ocean as big pieces (crates, bottles) but then break down in to microplastics over time.

Beach plastic has been described as ""the engine of secondary microplastics"" exposed to UV rays, salt, and wave action, beach plastic quickly erode down to tiny micro plastic particles which are very hard to remove from the ocean.

The problem of ocean microplastic pollution is huge, but if you contribute to this project you will have helped raise awareness, stopped millions of microplastic particle being released, and leave nature looking natural again.
Our Track Record

Southwest Environmental Limited have been delivering field based environmental projects since 2009. We always deliver. We have delivered over 500 sustainability projects, for 100's of clients since that time.
We are very keen not only to complete this project, but record everything we do, so that the process is 100% transparent. At the end of the project we will update with:
<ol>

• Photographs of the plastic they have removed (pile of bottles, section of fishing net, coil of rope). If the plastic item is very large (plastic tank for example) you may share it with others (order numbers of others will be listed).
• Grid reference of locations.
• Link to project page with photos of removal operation with before and after pictures.
• Details of transport.
• Details of waste disposal companies used. Disposal is via energy from waste plant.
<h3>Risks &amp

It is no small task to travel out to remote coves and beaches, and retrieve tangled masses of marine debris. The physical task is hard, but whilst we carefully cut ropes, and try to categorise plastic containers full of unknown liquids, we must also keep careful records (weights, plastic types, locations of finds) all the while watching the wind &

The beaches which are piled high with plastic are the ones far from towns and villages, where good people pick up plastics on their daily walks. We will have to hike in, or travel by boat. Lifting out collected waste by helicopter if necessary for hard to reach places.
Unlike England, the right to roam system in Scotland means that in many areas there is not a defined coast path. So although access is possible, it is hard work. Throw in millions of
column2: t=5695"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">biting insects and you have a combination of environmental variables that can be quite challenging.

column1: The legal care of the waste we collect is also important. Improper disposal is why the plastic is on the beach in the first place! So we are careful and transparent when choosing a disposal route.

A real risk is that waste once collected is exported to 3rd world countries instead of being destroyed or recycled in the UK. The UK waste sector even has a slavery problem, which we need to try to avoid.

We are not happy just throwing plastic in a general recycling skip. We have a specific contract that ensure that our waste is recycled where possible, and destroyed (energy from waste) where it can't be recycled.
Beach plastics often have inclusion of sand, crustaceans, weed, silt, and can be contaminated with oils and chemicals. They are not very attractive as a recycling medium.
Get Involved

If you would like to volunteer to help with this project, we would be glad to hear from you. You will need to be fit, and not mind roughing it. Some of the areas earmarked for our first projects are a days' tough hike from nearest village, and we will be camping rough for 2 or 3 days whilst working long hours. All personal gear will need to be carried in, and all personal waste carried out.
If you are a journalist, blogger, vlogger or photographer that would like to tag along for the journey, then please contact us and we will keep you in the loop.

column2:
>HELP US SAVE THE BEES!

Our story

Aware of the great problematic due to the disappearance of the native sting less bees,
  me, my wife and daughters decided our life and money to establish the natural reserve ""La reserva natural Tocorí"" and make a site with ideal conditions to repopulate and teach locals and visitors about these essential insects. The bees are in much need of a habitat protected from pesticides, natural deceases and destruction of their natural essential for living.

5 years ago we started our project with the whole family in action, investing our whole property, time and money to achieve the best condition for the local bees to flourish. Everything that has been possible, we have built with our own hands, from wooden hives to trails in the reserve. My whole family has been a part of building up our farm.  Unfortunately every journey has their challenges. And ours were a very unexpected one.

It came as a great shock and hardship when our daughter, who had been one of our driving force in the project, got stricken by cancer and died.  After this tragedy the whole family, and what had become a very important family project, suffered a great lack of willpower for a long time.

But in the name of our angel we are continuing putting all our force to work for the bees and expend our project much greater than ourselves, in the honor of her and what she also believed in .We have the spirit and possibilities to make great things for the future of the bees and our planet. The only thing we lack is the economically support to reach our goals. That is why we share our story and want you to be apart of it!

 

Our site

Our project is located in the pacific tropical forest of Costa Rica, in the municipality of Quepos. Our reserve is a 20 minutes drive from the city, near the village Villa Nueva. The natural reserve is partly primary and partly secondary forest, with a vast amount of flaura and fauna. This is where we guard several undomesticated and domesticated hives for demonstration. This is also where my family lives and where the laboratory where we produce our products are located as well. 

Our Mission

Every single day we are loosing bee species globally. We believe that if we do not take action now, soon we will loose those fruits, vegetables, flowers and trees, that we and the rest of the ecosystem so undoubtedly need. Therefore we are, with our natural reserve, contributing with the improvement of the environment of the habitat by introducing native trees and plants whose bloom facilitate and increase the bee population of the zone. 

Our Vision

The natural reserve Tocorí has a vision to become the main center of promotion and education for the protection of the bees in Costa Rica, and that we can awaken an awareness and an engagement that will lead to a better conservation of the native sting less bees. 

 

How you will help us!

With the help from you we are able to keep the natural reserve protected for this project and continue protect the habitat of the bees, plant more plants and trees that are necessary for the bee species. We have a plan to make a botanical garden to demonstrate the plant species that are depending on the bee pollination to reproduce, and from which plants the different bee species collect pollen, nectar and propolis from.
 As our bee hives is located in the tropical forest, we also need to built a better protection for the hives, as we have heavy rain 7 months of the year. Further more, we want to make a workshop for repairing and maintaining the hives. 

We are already organizing tour on the site for the local community, school children and tourist, but as our location is rural, we are in much need for a vehicle for transporting groups to and from the reserve.  A van would therefore give us a bigger opportunity to extend our project!

As I have dedicated my life and all my money in this project, it would mean the world to get an extra support from the outside. Help me and your will be apart of saving the bees!

What We Need
Two million dollars?! Oh, we know we’re asking for something BIG.
But
it’s in exchange for something huge. A piece of history. A precious resource.  And we only have three weeks to pull this off.
We need your help in raising $2M to save Avalon Springs.
Avalon Springs
is a rediscovered hot springs resort with 11 sources of pure, natural, mineral-rich water,
bubbling from 318 acres of jaw-droppingly gorgeous and historic countryside adjacent
to California’s wine country. In 1876, this land was known as Howard Springs. For
more than 100 years, guests traveled by horse and carriage (!!) from all over
the Bay Area to experience the “medicinal wonders” of the waters. “Nature’s
Mysterious Laboratory,” they dubbed it. Sadly, in 1971 the owners of Howard
Springs ran into financial trouble and its doors were closed until….
…a group led by Michael Woods, chairman of the Napa Valley Tourism
Board, fortuitously discovered the abandoned property—and bought it in 2005.
The big idea was to secure the right partners to redevelop it with modern yet
eco-friendly sensibilities (Yes, we have a permaculture plan!) and rechristen it Avalon Springs, so that people
could once again benefit from its rich history and healing waters.

The ugly reality was that in 2008, the economic (and specifically the real estate market!) collapse hit, making investors impossible to find. And now, despite a growing business in private events, Avalon Springs stands on the brink of facing foreclosure with its $2M loan due on September 10th.
If we can’t raise the money, Avalon
Springs will go on the auction block. It will likely be picked off by a
large commercial chain who would treat the waters with chemicals or by a
moneyed exclusive cult like the one that has kept nearby Siegler Hot Springs
blocked off from the public for over 20 years in honor of their guru. Hot springs are not a dime a dozen
column2: they are found only in finite pockets of this big, blue planet. These are worth saving.

column1: If we DO raise the money, our
plan is to <b>permanently protect and honor this property, creating a place
where we can all enjoy these waters in a natural state for years to come.
Raising this cash will effectively put the property into the right hands so it
can be developed into something fitting for the history and natural resources
it embodies—so that YOU can enjoy these legendary waters and experience the
miracle yourself—the miracle YOU will have made possible. A miracle, quite
frankly, this planet needs now more than ever.
Avalon Springs has all the permits it
needs to realize its vision, including a partnered 501(c)(3) non-profit
organization to hold the educational aspects. We have spent the past 7 years
creating all the plans, permits, and details so now Avalon is READY to go.  Since the economic collapse of
2008,  we have rehabilitated so much of the land and built up its existing infrastructure but now we need YOU to help us save this land from getting into the wrong hands.
If we meet our goal, all the funds will go directly to saving Avalon
Springs.
Dear world wide web, this is where
you gracefully enter the scene: Help us save Avalon Springs!  It’s an amazing opportunity to say yes
to SUSTAINABILITY, to people and to the planet. Please do Soak It Up.
Thank you so very very much.
A Few Qs &
What is
Avalon Springs?
It’s a rediscovered hot springs resort on 318 acres
of stunning Northern California property, abundant with springs... all just a
hop, skip, and one lovely country road away from a legendary wine country. The
land features eleven sources of water in total—seven cold for drinking
hot for soaking.
Hang
on… Naturally hot and cold springs on
a slice of California paradise?! You must appreciate that this is an uncommon
and extraordinary combination. Most extraordinary it is. So you can understand,
then, why it’s painful on so many levels that we (read: ALL of us!!) may lose
it.
What is
the Avalon Springs vision?
We
created a beautiful Permaculture-inspired Master Plan that truly honors each of
the 318 acres of this historic land. We visioned, designed, and achieved full
permits and approvals for a development that includes a learning center, an
eco-village, and a healing waters resort and spa. The integration of community
and business is the wave of the future, and Avalon's plans and permits provide
a phased development schedule for just that.

Who is behind this project?

People you can trust. Proven real estate and hospitality professionals, healers, lawyers, even branding professionals--ready to rock this resort so people and the planet both win. Here's a short bio for our founder:

Michael Woods is the original founder of the Avalon Springs project, guiding development since inception. Woods is the founder and president of Baywood Capital Corporation (www.baywoodcorp.com) and since 1977 has managed over 40 real estate investments, including hotels, office buildings, retail buildings and apartments. The hotel properties include the historic Mount View Hotel and Spa in Calistoga, CA, the Inn at Eagle Mountain near Scottsdale, AZ, White Sulphur Spring Resort &
column2:
Spa in St. Helena, CA, Carmel Valley Inn and Tennis Resort in Carmel Valley, CA, Emerson Hotel in Palo Alto, CA and El Pizoti Lodge in Costa Rica.

You can learn more about the team here.

column1: Is
Avalon Springs open now?
Yes,
Avalon Springs currently hosts private events, but unless we raise the money,
nothing more will happen after September 10th.
What can I do for Avalon
Springs?

1) Fund our campaign, right here, right now. To be clear, your pledge will only be ""cashed in"" IF we reach our $2M goal. This is a crazy, unreasonable, All-or-Nothing campaign. We know we're asking for a miracle but we believe there are plenty of people out there who share our values and reverence for Northern Calif land and understand the invaluable nature of clean, mineral-rich waters. (And 11 sources at that!) Our lenders expect $2M by September 10, 2013 or we risk foreclosure. That's that. This is an opportunity for YOU to help protect and save Avalon Springs – not just as a land, but as a symbol for what you value in this world.

2) Spread the word. Share this campaign using the Share Tools. If people like water or nature, they should see value in what we are doing. Do you know someone of means who would step up to be a hero for Avalon Springs? Where are thou our King Arthur ... or QUEEN Arthur? Send 'em our way.

3) Call your friends looking for a meaningful investment…. Email billionaires you know like Mark Cuban.  Share this opportunity with someone who would want to buy Avalon Springs for a good purpose. We welcome a buyer, or partners, or angel funders before Sept 10. This is not a charity donation. Avalon Springs is currently an operational business that already supports itself  with private events. Our plans for re-development will make it a grander and profitable eco-resort that could do great things in the world. And its related educational non-profit makes it very unique.

Our hope is that by remaining transparent, we might inspire you to take a stand for the deeper purpose of Avalon Springs, to make sure that this place remains protected through a use - business or nonprofit - that honors its beauty and shares it appropriately with the world. People AND planet can both win!
If you don’t raise $2M,
what happens after September 10th?
If
we don’t have the money by September 10<sup>th</sup>, Avalon Springs is set to
go to auction. At auction, it could be picked off by a commercial resort
chain that will create a ""business as usual"" luxury resort, or by a
private group that would close the springs off everyone but themselves.  A
tragedy all-around.
Please participate now, anchoring your well-wishes with a pledge of financial support at any level.

THANK YOU! Seriously.
You're awesome.

Share this campaign using the Share Tools. If people like water or nature, they should see value in what we are doing. Do you know someone of means who would step up to be a hero for Avalon Springs? Where are thou our King Arthur ... or QUEEN Arthur? Send 'em our way. 3) Call your friends looking for a meaningful investment…. Email billionaires you know like Mark Cuban.  Share this opportunity with someone who would want to buy Avalon Springs for a good purpose. We welcome a buyer, or partners, or angel funders before Sept 10. This is not a charity donation. Avalon Springs is currently an operational business that already supports itself  with private events. Our plans for re-development will make it a grander and profitable eco-resort that could do great things in the world. And its related educational non-profit makes it very unique. Our hope is that by remaining transparent, we might inspire you to take a stand for the deeper purpose of Avalon Springs, to make sure that this place remains protected through a use - business or nonprofit - that honors its beauty and shares it appropriately with the world. People AND planet can both win!
If you don’t raise $2M,
what happens after September 10th?
If
we don’t have the money by September 10th, Avalon Springs is set to
go to auction. At auction, it could be picked off by a commercial resort
chain that will create a ""business as usual"" luxury resort, or by a
private group that would close the springs off everyone but themselves.  A
tragedy all-around.
Please participate now, anchoring your well-wishes with a pledge of financial support at any level.
THANK YOU! Seriously. You're awesome.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Middletown, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/save-avalon--2/pica

Summary

I am a freelance journalist in Florida and would like to travel to Ecuador to produce a multimedia video package about the impact of oil drilling on a pristine rain forest and Indians who live there. If this project is fully funded, I would market the completed video package to regional and national media organizations that would distribute the story to a larger audience.
column2:
>I have raised about $1,800 so far to help pay the hard costs of reporting, which include airfare, transportation in Ecuador, lodging and meals. I would like to raise $950 to fully fund the project, which I estimate will cost $2,750.

Your contribution will help give voice to Huaorani Indians, who have been keepers of the rain forest in Ecuador for more than 1,000 years.

Perks for contributors range from high-quality portraits to DVDs.

Please watch and share my video and spread the word about Tribe in Trouble.

Project background

Additional background about the project is below.

Oil drilling in Ecuador could devastate the Yasuni National Park and the Indians who live in the region.

The 3,793-square-mile park contains more plant and animal species than all of North America and sits atop nearly 900 million barrels of oil. The park is also the ancestral home to the Huaorani Indians.

The Ecuadorean government in 2007 had offered to ban drilling in the ecologically fragile Yasuni park in exchange for $3.5 billion in contributions from the international community. Donations fell short and the government dropped the plan. Even before that failure was announced in 2013, documents show that the Ecuadorean government had been secretly negotiating with the Chinese to allow drilling in the Yasuni park.

Ecuador has borrowed more than $9 billion from China since 2007. The South American country plans to export oil to China to help pay off its huge debt. Environmentalists and Indian rights activists are alarmed.

""We're on the cusp of a new oil boom in the Ecuadorian Amazon the like of which we have never seen before,"" Amazon Watch told the Guardian newspaper in February.

The Ecuadorean government says the oil drilling platforms will cause little damage. I would like to travel to Ecuador to find out the truth.

Who I am

I am a former correspondent for the Dallas Morning News. I have written for USA Today, the Florida Center for Investigative Reporting and other news outlets. I speak fluent Spanish and have been on reporting assignments throughout Latin America.

I have been long fascinated by Ecuador, a country the size of Colorado. I first traveled to Ecuador in 1981. I spent nearly a year visiting remote villages, logging nearly 500 miles on foot and 400 miles by canoe.

I am particularly interested in the impact that drilling will have on the Huaorani Indians. They drew international attention in 1956 when they killed five American missionaries. Some Huaorani - members of a breakaway tribe known as the Taromenane - still resist contact with outsiders.

As oil workers, colonists and others move closer to their territory, tensions are rising - and so is intertribal warfare. At least two dozen Indians have been killed over the past two years.

Goals

I would like to travel to Ecuador during the summer of 2014. Among the many questions I’ll pursue:

column1: <li>Whether Huaorani Indians are abandoning their traditional ways as oil workers, loggers and colonists grow near
<li>Whether oil drilling is harming the Yasuni National Park and surrounding area
<li>Whether the oil boom and other outside pressures led to intertribal attacks that have killed more than 20 people, most of them women and children
• How the courts are treating Indians arrested in the attacks.

Impact

Your support will help raise awareness of the potential dangers of oil drilling in the rain forest in Ecuador. 

I’d be grateful for your support.

Lugar de Ejecución del Propuesta: Finca Vaguara ubicada en la vereda San Jose del Pepino Kilometro 7 Vía Villagarzon del Municipio de Mocoa Departamento del Putumayo.

column1:
ELEMENTOS DE LA PROPUESTA

INFORMACION GENERAL DE LA PROPUESTA
<tr><td style=""width:582px
Tema/título provisional:

COMPRA DE TERRITORIO PARA LA POSIBLE CONSTITUCION DE LA RESERVA NATURAL DE LA SOCIEDAD CIVIL EN LA FINCA VAGUARA UBICADA EN LA VEREDA SAN JOSE DEL PEPINO KILOMETRO 7 VIA VILLAGARZON DEL MUNICIPIO DE MOCOA DEPARTAMENTO DEL PUTUMAYO.
<tr><td style=""width:582px
Descripción del problema.

Con el transcurso de los años el hombre ha influenciado de manera directa la inestabilidad y desequilibrio de la naturaleza conllevando a que esta se deteriore de manera significativa hechos manifestados por medio de los desastre naturales, generando miles de muertes humanas y pérdida de ecosistemas naturales.

column2: >Además la falta de conciencia ambiental, destruyendo gran parte de la biodiversidad y afectando de manera directa en ámbitos como: económico, social, educativo, cultural, científico y ambiental.

column1: Esta situación no pasa desapercibida en Colombia y en cada uno de sus departamentos, un claro ejemplo es el Putumayo donde la deforestación en el año 2015 equivale a 9.214 ha siendo el 7,4% de la deforestación nacional (MINAMBIENTE 2012), es así como este departamento ha desviado su esencia, ya que es reconocido por tener áreas que presentan alto nivel de biodiversidad que buscan ser aprovechadas de forma sostenible por muchos propietarios de fincas que han optado por darle una percepción distinta a sus tierras con el fin de contrarrestar algunas problemáticas que afectan su desarrollo.

Evidenciado lo anterior se tiene el caso de la finca Vaguara en municipio de Mocoa departamento del Putumayo donde se observa que su mayor problemática es la posible utilización del territorio para explotación de suelos,  Cría de Ganado y explotación maderera indiscriminada en propiedad, lo que perjudica de manera directa y constante la regeneración y recuperación del ecosistema, fuentes hídricas presentes y en si el entorno, siendo requisito esencial adquirir el predio y ser categorizados como reserva natural de la sociedad civil incursionando en el aprovechamiento turístico.
<tr><td style=""width:582px
Objetivo General:

Adquirir un territorio ancestral de 12 hectáreas y proteger los recursos forestales, hídricos y de especies en la finca Vaguara ubicada en la vereda San José del Pepino kilómetro 7 vía villa garzón del municipio de Mocoa departamento del Putumayo para contribuir a su constitución como reserva natural de la sociedad civil y instauración de proyecto Iwoka Natural.
<tr><td style=""width:582px
Objetivos Específicos:
<ul>
• Zonificar el área de la finca Vaguara ubicada en la vereda San José del Pepino.
• Adquirir el Valor necesario para la adquisición del territorio y la implementación de Iwoka Natural.
• Solicitar Presencia de organizaciones ecológicas para la instauración de la Reserva.
• Evaluar y Clasificar la riqueza y la distribución de las especies forestales en la finca Vaguara.
• Creación de Comitivas de incentivo ecológico, recolección y manejo de basuras de la zona publica aledaña a la reserva.
• Implementación de Etnoturismo y prácticas de Turismo Ecológico
• Trabajo con las Autoridades Locales y con los Turistas para dar a conocer nuestra iniciativa al Mundo.
• Establecer en la Finca la Permacultura
• Generar empleo y emprendimiento
• Educación y formación cultural artística y ecológica en niños
• Implementar escuela de teatro, cine, circo, música y manualidades, involucrando las madres tejedoras para los talleres y gente de Mocoa o Villa Garzón .
• Implementación de eventos con entidades y colectivos ambientales, artísticos, gubernamentales y comunidades indígenas, dentro del territorio ancestral.
<tr><td style=""width:582px
Justificación/ Impacto del proyecto

La explotación  Territorial es una problemática que requiere de una alternativa viable y precisa para ser solucionada, por ello es indispensable proteger  el estado de los recursos hídricos, en el caso de la finca Vaguara ubicada en la vereda san José del pepino kilómetro 7 vía villa garzón del municipio de Mocoa departamento del putumayo es valiosa porque aporta a nuestra Colombia y en especial al Putumayo, un lugar en donde se puede aprender, sentir, vivir a fondo nuestra cultura medicinal y ancestral, importa porque estamos protegiendo un enorme territorio de 12 hectáreas de selva nativa amazónica, igualmente, vivenciar una experiencia consigo mismo y con la naturaleza tanto para esta generación como para las venideras, ya que este territorio no será comercializado ni expuesto a fines diferentes al ecoturismo y la sanación.

El proyecto ambiental es orientado desde el etnoturismo  con un enfoque hacia  la permacultura , con el fin de mostrar las capacidades de auto sostenibilidad, sembrando conciencia por  la protección del territorio , implementando una travesía que impacte positivamente al visitante, encaminado en el autoconocimiento con la experiencia única de sanación tradicional indígena, meditación , conciencia personal y ambiental.
Impacto ambiental, social y ético

El enfoque de este proyecto genera un impacto ambiental positivo, pues lo que se pretende es realizar un proyecto de turismo y medicina que no busca fines de explotación, sino una línea directa a la conservación y aprovechamiento consiente de los recursos forestales en conjunto con la protección de las fuentes hídricas y de la fauna silvestre sumándose en la labor de la mitigación del cambio climático
column2: logrando que esta zona sea vinculada a Reservas naturales de la sociedad civil.

column1: Según Parques Nacionales Naturales de Colombia (PNN S/F) una Reserva Natural de la Sociedad Civil (RNSC) “Es un predio que por voluntad y decisión de los propietarios de las tierras, pretenden que sea convertido en una reserva natural
column2: su objetivo es crear un ecosistema o hábitat natural bajo parámetros de conservación y restauración y producción sostenible, que resalte la iniciativa que tienen sus propietarios la cual puede influir para que otros se  vinculan con este tipo de modalidades como personas que conservan los recursos naturales buscando el bienestar de local y regional
column3: para lo  anterior juega un papel muy importante la instauración de Iwoka natural, un proyecto que busca que todas las actividades estén enfocados en la práctica de valores como la responsabilidad, puntualidad, estudio, constancia, carácter, concentración, formación, activismo, enfocado a la conservación del medio ambiente y los recursos que este brinda.

column1: Vaguara en totalidad de extensión posee 12 hectáreas, nacederos de agua, plantaciones de árboles originarios de la zona, cultivos de chontaduro, plátano maduro, yuca, uva caimarona entre otras
<tr><td style=""width:582px
PLAN DE ACCION

Para dar paso a la elaboración del proyecto, primeramente se adquirirá el predio Vaguara Y Prestaremos servicio de camping ecológico, piscina natural con agua potable natural de la  montaña de la finca, guíanza a los lugares etno turísticos de nuestra tierra y nuestra región. Se utiliza también una parte del  reciclaje como alternativa para solventar la comida de animales, talleres de reciclaje y manufactura transformando los  materiales que desechamos, cursos de construcción ecológica auto sostenibilidad con la comunidad y aprendizaje zootécnico.

Se presta servicio de sanación por medio de terapias modernas y tradicionales, servicio de audio terapia, masajes holísticos, tratamiento con plantas aromáticas, tratamiento psicológico y acompañamiento profesional, medicina tradicional con plantas sagradas Nativas del Putumayo, sanación tradicional indígena y terapia de spa. También la piscicultura, la cría de gallinas ponedoras. Con los productos antes mencionados se colocan a la venta al público con el fin de obtener ganancias económicas y por ende subsanar los servicios de mantenimiento básico que demanda la finca.

El sitio ha permitido tener auto sostenibilidad amigable con el ambiente a través de los siguientes métodos de ingreso económico: cultivos de plátanos, chontaduros  y árboles frutales como el banano uvas caimaronas originarias de la selva amazónica, guayabas, guamas, madroños, piña, aguacate, café orgánico y tostado.

También se creó un espacio para venta de pizza artesanal en leña, colección de instrumentos para música en vivo, cuentos, fogata y presentaciones artísticas de las personas viajeras que visitan nuestro lugar, permitiendo de esta manera recrear, compartir, generar ganancia económica, dejar huellas para los que vienen y contar experiencias de sanación vividas tanto personales y grupales.
<tr><td style=""width:582px

La ayuda de los colaboradores es de un gran beneficio para que este proyecto se lleve a cabo y se ejecute con la finalidad y meta propuesta. Con el dinero recaudado los colaboradores tendrán la oportunidad de participar en la protección activa de un enorme territorio el cual fue destinado varios siglos atrás como territorio de sanación ancestral y hoy con el valor aportado de cada uno daremos un impacto social con la comunidad positivo en la protección de la zona para esta generación y las generaciones venideras en busca de sanación e integración con la Naturaleza del bajo Putumayo.

La propuesta concreta es o adquirimos este territorio para instaurar IWOKA NATURAL  y continuar preservándolo como sitio Etnoturistico y de sanación o se convierte en  explotación territorial y perdemos con ello la oportunidad de sanar a muchas personas que de verdad lo necesitan.

Inversionista del proyecto: tendrá acceso al  lugar de manera prioritaria cada vez que quiera disfrutar del espacio, tendrá alojamiento, tratamiento medicinal y terapéutico, guías  a los lugares turísticos ancestrales,  clases de tejido, se realizará un evento periódicamente donde  será invitado a conocer y compartir de nuestros resultados económicos y de impacto social,
Podrán solicitar él envió de informe periódico, informándose de nuestros avances y además compartirán la adopción de hectáreas de árboles de manera remota o directa

El valor será de carácter histórico y de protección medio ambiental, no prometemos ganancia económica ya que el objetivo de nuestro proyecto es lograr que el territorio sea ingresado a Reserva Natural de la Sociedad Civil (RNSC) (predio que por voluntad y decisión de los propietarios de las tierras, pretenden que sea convertido en una reserva natural)

El carácter de retribución económica es de valor histórico y su beneficio es de carácter pro activo para la preservación de nuestra biosfera y nuestro territorio de Sanación siendo Putumayo importante cuna de medicina ancestral y flora única en el planeta tierra.
Proyecto Iwoka Natural establecerá una  comunicación directa con nuestro inversionista y actuaremos con resultados, la implementación de la reserva Natural es la prioridad.
LIDERES

Juan Carlos Velandia Lider del Proyecto ha participado activamente en proyectos como Varsaná cerca de la ciudad de Bogotá y en una Eco aldea en Quillaileo Chile.  Ha practicado y recibido enseñanzas de Medicina Ancestral y Curativa con taita Miguel Mavisoy Chindoy, Taita Gregorio castro, Taita Maria Consuelo Chindoy.
<tr><td style=""width:582px

“Mi vida ha estado enfocada a proteger el lugar que me dio la vida y la de mi entorno porque considero que nosotros como seres humanos tenemos misiones y una de ellas es proteger sus tesoros y sus saberes. En mi  vida he buscado el bienestar de los animales, plantas y entorno. Mi fin en este proyecto no es ambicionar un lugar para mí, por el contrario es buscar un espacio donde sembrar cultura y amor por nuestra madre tierra y nosotros como especie humana.”
Mi formación académica es desde la Música, en la Universidad del Valle del Cauca. Realice estudios de clases virtuales en impactos ambientales, nutrición, capacitación en productos ecológicos.

A los 23 años de edad, conforme un colectivo ambiental, con el fin de proteger los árboles en las principales ciudades, igualmente, se  enseñaban métodos de reciclaje, reutilización y reducción de materiales inorgánicos, campañas ecológicas, artísticas, trabajo en comunidad con Pacto Mundial Consiente.
EQUIPO DE TRABAJO
Músico Productor
Trabajo de campo.
Investigación de Ruido.
Consolidación de información Audiovisual
Terapia Auditiva.
Psicólogo Terapeuta
Acompañamiento terapéutico.
Revisión y supervisión del avance.
Correcciones de técnicas y diagnósticos Médicos
Zootecnista
Reconocimiento de las especies vegetales.
Baquiano(técnico forestal)
Reconocimiento de especies vegetales
Medico Sanador  Indígena
Acompañamiento terapéutico
Enseñanza Etnobotánica
Contacto con comunidades Indígenas
RESUMEN

El proyecto Iwoka Natural se esta implementando en la finca Vaguara  , introduciendo la permacutura como base principal que encierra todo este proyecto que vamos innovando, enfocados en etnoturismo y bienestar tanto del ser humano como de nuestra selva , queremos que cada visitante y persona aledaña a mocoa tenga una experiencia viva de conexión con los lugares turísticos y ancestrales que hay , y cada experiencia que tenga realice un impacto positivo ambientalmente y en su bienestar, además la permacultura encierra la parte artística y cultural , donde entramos con los niños como base principal y enfoque educativo , también nuestra reserva natural el cual recuperaremos fauna y flora que podrán apreciar nuestros visitantes e inversionistas, construcción de ecodomos , observatorio de estrellas, talleres y mas actividades que tenemos planeadas y otras que se están ya implementado.
Agradecemos el tiempo dedicado a leer nuestro proyecto y apoyarnos.
","INFORMACIÓN GENERAL DE LA PROPUESTA
Título provisional que identifica la propuesta: PROYECTO IWOKA NATURAL

Grupo (s) de Trabajo:Juan Carlos Velandia Estrella (Lider Proyecto) Andrea Guerrero Maya (Finanzas y Especialista Psicoterapeuta) Guillermo Forsten (Relaciones Sociales y Medios Electronicos,) Taita Miguel mavisoy  (Medico Ancestral Tradicional Comunidad Kametsa Villa), Juan Guillermo (Zootecnista)

Adquirir el Valor necesario para la adquisición del territorio y la implementación de Iwoka Natural.
Solicitar Presencia de organizaciones ecológicas para la instauración de la Reserva.
