Educación y formación cultural artística y ecológica en niños
Implementar escuela de teatro, cine, circo, música y manualidades, involucrando las madres tejedoras para los talleres y gente de Mocoa o Villa Garzón .
Implementación de eventos con entidades y colectivos ambientales, artísticos, gubernamentales y comunidades indígenas, dentro del territorio ancestral.
Justificación/ Impacto del proyecto

La explotación  Territorial es una problemática que requiere de una alternativa viable y precisa para ser solucionada, por ello es indispensable proteger  el estado de los recursos hídricos, en el caso de la finca Vaguara ubicada en la vereda san José del pepino kilómetro 7 vía villa garzón del municipio de Mocoa departamento del putumayo es valiosa porque aporta a nuestra Colombia y en especial al Putumayo, un lugar en donde se puede aprender, sentir, vivir a fondo nuestra cultura medicinal y ancestral, importa porque estamos protegiendo un enorme territorio de 12 hectáreas de selva nativa amazónica, igualmente, vivenciar una experiencia consigo mismo y con la naturaleza tanto para esta generación como para las venideras, ya que este territorio no será comercializado ni expuesto a fines diferentes al ecoturismo y la sanación.

El proyecto ambiental es orientado desde el etnoturismo  con un enfoque hacia  la permacultura , con el fin de mostrar las capacidades de auto sostenibilidad, sembrando conciencia por  la protección del territorio , implementando una travesía que impacte positivamente al visitante, encaminado en el autoconocimiento con la experiencia única de sanación tradicional indígena, meditación , conciencia personal y ambiental.
Impacto ambiental, social y ético

El enfoque de este proyecto genera un impacto ambiental positivo, pues lo que se pretende es realizar un proyecto de turismo y medicina que no busca fines de explotación, sino una línea directa a la conservación y aprovechamiento consiente de los recursos forestales en conjunto con la protección de las fuentes hídricas y de la fauna silvestre sumándose en la labor de la mitigación del cambio climático
column2: logrando que esta zona sea vinculada a Reservas naturales de la sociedad civil.

column1: Según Parques Nacionales Naturales de Colombia (PNN S/F) una Reserva Natural de la Sociedad Civil (RNSC) “Es un predio que por voluntad y decisión de los propietarios de las tierras, pretenden que sea convertido en una reserva natural
column2: su objetivo es crear un ecosistema o hábitat natural bajo parámetros de conservación y restauración y producción sostenible, que resalte la iniciativa que tienen sus propietarios la cual puede influir para que otros se  vinculan con este tipo de modalidades como personas que conservan los recursos naturales buscando el bienestar de local y regional
column3: para lo  anterior juega un papel muy importante la instauración de Iwoka natural, un proyecto que busca que todas las actividades estén enfocados en la práctica de valores como la responsabilidad, puntualidad, estudio, constancia, carácter, concentración, formación, activismo, enfocado a la conservación del medio ambiente y los recursos que este brinda.

column1: Vaguara en totalidad de extensión posee 12 hectáreas, nacederos de agua, plantaciones de árboles originarios de la zona, cultivos de chontaduro, plátano maduro, yuca, uva caimarona entre otras
PLAN DE ACCION

Para dar paso a la elaboración del proyecto, primeramente se adquirirá el predio Vaguara Y Prestaremos servicio de camping ecológico, piscina natural con agua potable natural de la  montaña de la finca, guíanza a los lugares etno turísticos de nuestra tierra y nuestra región. Se utiliza también una parte del  reciclaje como alternativa para solventar la comida de animales, talleres de reciclaje y manufactura transformando los  materiales que desechamos, cursos de construcción ecológica auto sostenibilidad con la comunidad y aprendizaje zootécnico.

Se presta servicio de sanación por medio de terapias modernas y tradicionales, servicio de audio terapia, masajes holísticos, tratamiento con plantas aromáticas, tratamiento psicológico y acompañamiento profesional, medicina tradicional con plantas sagradas Nativas del Putumayo, sanación tradicional indígena y terapia de spa. También la piscicultura, la cría de gallinas ponedoras. Con los productos antes mencionados se colocan a la venta al público con el fin de obtener ganancias económicas y por ende subsanar los servicios de mantenimiento básico que demanda la finca.

El sitio ha permitido tener auto sostenibilidad amigable con el ambiente a través de los siguientes métodos de ingreso económico: cultivos de plátanos, chontaduros  y árboles frutales como el banano uvas caimaronas originarias de la selva amazónica, guayabas, guamas, madroños, piña, aguacate, café orgánico y tostado.

También se creó un espacio para venta de pizza artesanal en leña, colección de instrumentos para música en vivo, cuentos, fogata y presentaciones artísticas de las personas viajeras que visitan nuestro lugar, permitiendo de esta manera recrear, compartir, generar ganancia económica, dejar huellas para los que vienen y contar experiencias de sanación vividas tanto personales y grupales.

La ayuda de los colaboradores es de un gran beneficio para que este proyecto se lleve a cabo y se ejecute con la finalidad y meta propuesta. Con el dinero recaudado los colaboradores tendrán la oportunidad de participar en la protección activa de un enorme territorio el cual fue destinado varios siglos atrás como territorio de sanación ancestral y hoy con el valor aportado de cada uno daremos un impacto social con la comunidad positivo en la protección de la zona para esta generación y las generaciones venideras en busca de sanación e integración con la Naturaleza del bajo Putumayo.

La propuesta concreta es o adquirimos este territorio para instaurar IWOKA NATURAL  y continuar preservándolo como sitio Etnoturistico y de sanación o se convierte en  explotación territorial y perdemos con ello la oportunidad de sanar a muchas personas que de verdad lo necesitan.

Inversionista del proyecto: tendrá acceso al  lugar de manera prioritaria cada vez que quiera disfrutar del espacio, tendrá alojamiento, tratamiento medicinal y terapéutico, guías  a los lugares turísticos ancestrales,  clases de tejido, se realizará un evento periódicamente donde  será invitado a conocer y compartir de nuestros resultados económicos y de impacto social,
Podrán solicitar él envió de informe periódico, informándose de nuestros avances y además compartirán la adopción de hectáreas de árboles de manera remota o directa

El valor será de carácter histórico y de protección medio ambiental, no prometemos ganancia económica ya que el objetivo de nuestro proyecto es lograr que el territorio sea ingresado a Reserva Natural de la Sociedad Civil (RNSC) (predio que por voluntad y decisión de los propietarios de las tierras, pretenden que sea convertido en una reserva natural)

El carácter de retribución económica es de valor histórico y su beneficio es de carácter pro activo para la preservación de nuestra biosfera y nuestro territorio de Sanación siendo Putumayo importante cuna de medicina ancestral y flora única en el planeta tierra.
Proyecto Iwoka Natural establecerá una  comunicación directa con nuestro inversionista y actuaremos con resultados, la implementación de la reserva Natural es la prioridad.
LIDERES

Juan Carlos Velandia Lider del Proyecto ha participado activamente en proyectos como Varsaná cerca de la ciudad de Bogotá y en una Eco aldea en Quillaileo Chile.  Ha practicado y recibido enseñanzas de Medicina Ancestral y Curativa con taita Miguel Mavisoy Chindoy, Taita Gregorio castro, Taita Maria Consuelo Chindoy.

“Mi vida ha estado enfocada a proteger el lugar que me dio la vida y la de mi entorno porque considero que nosotros como seres humanos tenemos misiones y una de ellas es proteger sus tesoros y sus saberes. En mi  vida he buscado el bienestar de los animales, plantas y entorno. Mi fin en este proyecto no es ambicionar un lugar para mí, por el contrario es buscar un espacio donde sembrar cultura y amor por nuestra madre tierra y nosotros como especie humana.”
Mi formación académica es desde la Música, en la Universidad del Valle del Cauca. Realice estudios de clases virtuales en impactos ambientales, nutrición, capacitación en productos ecológicos.

A los 23 años de edad, conforme un colectivo ambiental, con el fin de proteger los árboles en las principales ciudades, igualmente, se  enseñaban métodos de reciclaje, reutilización y reducción de materiales inorgánicos, campañas ecológicas, artísticas, trabajo en comunidad con Pacto Mundial Consiente.
EQUIPO DE TRABAJO
Músico Productor
Trabajo de campo.
Investigación de Ruido.
Consolidación de información Audiovisual
Terapia Auditiva.
Psicólogo Terapeuta
Acompañamiento terapéutico.
Revisión y supervisión del avance.
Correcciones de técnicas y diagnósticos Médicos
Zootecnista
Reconocimiento de las especies vegetales.
Baquiano(técnico forestal)
Reconocimiento de especies vegetales
Medico Sanador  Indígena
Acompañamiento terapéutico
Enseñanza Etnobotánica
Contacto con comunidades Indígenas
RESUMEN

El proyecto Iwoka Natural se esta implementando en la finca Vaguara  , introduciendo la permacutura como base principal que encierra todo este proyecto que vamos innovando, enfocados en etnoturismo y bienestar tanto del ser humano como de nuestra selva , queremos que cada visitante y persona aledaña a mocoa tenga una experiencia viva de conexión con los lugares turísticos y ancestrales que hay , y cada experiencia que tenga realice un impacto positivo ambientalmente y en su bienestar, además la permacultura encierra la parte artística y cultural , donde entramos con los niños como base principal y enfoque educativo , también nuestra reserva natural el cual recuperaremos fauna y flora que podrán apreciar nuestros visitantes e inversionistas, construcción de ecodomos , observatorio de estrellas, talleres y mas actividades que tenemos planeadas y otras que se están ya implementado.
Agradecemos el tiempo dedicado a leer nuestro proyecto y apoyarnos.",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

What is ARETHA?

ARETHA (AiR Exchange THermal Assembly) is a sustainable device to produce hot water from the sun, made with low cost materials and without any particular expertise. Everybody, everywhere, can build an ARETHA solar thermal collector for his needs. Traditional photovoltaic or thermal solar panels are too expensive for most people in developing countries, especially in small and isolated villages, because of import and production high costs. On the contrary, ARETHA panel can be made from local material: wood, wool, car radiators, transparent plastic panels or glass.
column7: >Paolo Bonelli and Franco Mantega, two retired Italian researchers, started an experimental activity on this kind of collector since one year ago. Along this period they obtained encouraging scientific results.

column1: Now they ask your help to make a new ARETHA prototype (The ARETHA Project) with more recycling materials, as: used wood pallets and sheep wool. Their goal is to write down a tutorial, rich of  pictures, data and building steps, in order to allow everybody  to make his own ARETHA. Paolo and Franco also wish to grow up a community of ARETHA makers, that will share projects and experience.
Cos'è ARETHA?

ARETHA (AiR Exchange THermal Assembly)  è un dispositivo sostenibile per produrre acqua calda dal sole, fatto con materiali a basso costo e senza particolare esperienza.  Ognuno, ovunque nel mondo, può costruire un collettore solare termico ARETHA per le sue necessità. I pannelli solari tradizionali, termici o fotovoltaici, sono troppo costosi per la maggior parte delle persone nei paesi in via di sviluppo, specialmente nei villaggi piccoli e isolati, a causa degli alti costi d’importazione e produzione. Al contrario, un pannello ARETHA può essere fatto con materiali locali: legno, lana, radiatori di auto, pannelli di plastica trasparente o di vetro.

Paolo Bonelli e Franco Mantega, due ricercatori italiani in pensione, da circa un anno hanno iniziato un’attività sperimentale su questo genere di collettori. Durante questo periodo essi hanno ottenuto risultati scientifici incoraggianti.

Ora chiedono il tuo aiuto per costruire un nuovo prototipo di ARETHA con una quota maggiore di materiali di recupero, quali: bancali di legno usati e lana di pecora. Il loro obiettivo è quello di scrivere un tutorial, ricco di immagini, dati e singoli passi di costruzione, con lo scopo di permettere a chiunque di fare il proprio ARETHA. A questo scopo nasce ARETHA Project.

Paolo e Franco intendono dare l'avvio ad una comunità on line di costruttori di ARETHA, dove poter scambiare progetti ed esperienze.


Technical details about ARETHA
column7: >The ARETHA concept consists in producing hot air in a box that exchange its heat with the water flowing in a high efficiency component: the car radiator. Every car has to dissipate the heat produce by the engine. This function is performed by the radiator which promotes the thermal exchange between the water circulating into the engine and the external air. In the ARETHA system the radiator works in the opposite way: it transfers heat from the hot air, produced by the Sun, to the cold water of a primary closed circuit. Hot water is then stored into a good thermal insulated tank, near to the panel. A secondary open circuit, made by a pipe  submerged into the tank, heats the clean water that can be used for our purposes.
column10:
>

The ARETHA box can be made by wood or other material covered with a thermally insulating material as: glass wool or natural sheep ones. The front side of the box must be transparent to the Sun rays. Here we could use glass or plastic, but it is important that this side is thermally insulated too. Hollow poly-carbonate is a good solution. Glass may be, but it is heavier and more expensive.

column1:
Car radiator power must be set proportionally to the ARETHA exposed surface. The radiator must have its original fan or a similar one. A simple circulation pump provide the water flowing into the primary circuit. Yes, ARETHA needs electricity, but fan and pump power consumption is very low compared to the thermal energy gained in heating water.


ARETHA is controlled by Arduino, the worldwide famous open hardware micro-controller board. The main purpose of the ARETHA control system is to switch on the pump and the fan only when the temperature difference between air and water rises over a defined threshold. Arduino measures temperatures in different parts of ARETHA by means of digital sensor chips as Dallas DS18B20. A DataLogger Shield provides for archiving information on a SD card and, eventually, an Ethernet Shield sends data on Internet.  Electrical scheme and software are open source.

A  first experimental prototype of about 10 sq m  has been built in Milan (Italy) and it still works. It provided a lot of data that has allowed a better understanding of its operating principles and how to optimize the collector energy efficiency. This prototype has been funded and encouraged by a no-profit association: CISE2007.
Dettagli tecnici su ARETHA

La logica di ARETHA consiste nel produrre aria calda in una scatola che scambi il suo calore con l’acqua fluente, in un componente ad alta efficienza: un radiatore di automobile. Ogni auto deve dissipare il calore prodotto dal suo motore. Questa funzione è soddisfatta dal radiatore che promuove lo scambio termico tra l’acqua circolante nel motore e l’aria esterna. Nel sistema ARETHA il radiatore lavora all’incontrario: trasferisce calore dall’aria calda, prodotta dal sole, all’acqua fredda del circuito primario chiuso. L’acqua calda è quindi immagazzinata in un serbatoio ben isolato termicamente, vicino al pannello. Un secondo circuito, aperto, fatto da un tubo immerso nel serbatoio, scalda l’acqua pulita che può essere usata per i nostri scopi (acqua sanitaria, serre,etc.)
column4: >La scatola di ARETHA può essere fatta da legno o altri materiali, ricoperti con isolanti termici, quali lana di pecora o di vetro. La parete frontale della scatola deve essere trasparente ai raggi solari. Per questa si può usare vetro o una lastra di plastica, ma è importante che anche questa parete sia abbastanza isolata termicamente. Una lastra di policarbonato alveolare è una buona soluzione. Anche il vetro può essere usato, ma costa di più ed è più pesante.

column1: La potenza del radiatore di auto deve essere proporzionata alla superficie esposta di ARETHA. Il radiatore deve avere il suo ventilatore originale o uno simile. Una semplice pompa “circolatore” provvede a far circolare l’acqua nel circuito primario. Sì, ARETHA necessita di elettricità, ma il consumo della pompa e del ventilatore sono minimi confrontati al guadagno di energia nell’acqua calda.

ARETHA è controllato da Arduino, la scheda a microcontrollore open-hardware famosa in tutto il mondo. Lo scopo principale di questo sistema di controllo è quello di accendere pompa e ventilatore solo quando la differenza di temperatura tra aria e acqua oltrepassa una determinata soglia. Arduino misura le temperature in diversi punti di ARETHA per mezzo di sensori integrati digitali, come i Dallas DS18B20. Una scheda Data Logger provvede ad archiviare i dati su una SD card e, opzionalmente, una scheda Ethernet invia i dati su Internet. Schemi elettrici e software sono open-source.

Un primo prototipo sperimentale di circa 10 m2, è stato costruito a Milano ed è tuttora funzionante. Ha prodotto una grande quantità di dati che hanno permesso una migliore comprensione dei principi di funzionamento e di come ottimizzare l’efficienza energetica.Questo prototipo è stato finanziato e incoraggiato dall’associazione no-profit CISE2007.


What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

The ARETHA Project intends to demonstrate the feasibility of a 6 sq m collector, made by pallets, sheep wool and other easy to find materials. 

The collector will be built by no-specialized people, during the workshop  Trasformatorio, an international laboratory focusing on all that is related to site-specific and sustainable performance. The location will be the village of Montalbano Elicona (Sicily-Italy). 

The prototype will work there for a reasonable period in order to collect data. During the building phase, all the steps will be reported. 

At the end of the Project, a tutorial document will be edited and shared on Internet.

column1: The fund campaign goal is $ 12000 (USD), that we need to fund the cost of the materials for this prototype, all the costs related to the documentation, perks and travel for one of the authors and the management of a dedicated  web site.
We don’t want to rise money for anything else. The results of this campaign should be:
· A detailed tutorial on how to make a 6 sq m ARETHA collector by recycled materials
· A web site and a forum  to provide information about every ARETHA collector built by people, allowing them to exchange ideas and experience.
This effort cannot be done without money! ARETHA cannot become a commercial product because we want the people learn to make it yourself, especially in developing countries.
You can help us even only participating to the ARETHA community with your suggestion and telling us your experience in making solar thermal collector.
Follow the ARETHA Project on Facebook
Di cosa abbiamo bisogno e cosa riceverai

Il progetto ARETHA intende dimostrare la realizzabilità di un collettore di 6 m2, fatto di bancali di legno, lana di pecora e altri materiali facili da trovare. Il collettore sarà costruito da persone non specializzate, durante il workshop “Trasformatorio”, un laboratorio internazionale artistico focalizzato su tutto ciò che è sostenibile e “site-specific”. Il luogo di costruzione si trova presso il Comune di Montalbano Elicona in Sicilia (ME). Il prototipo funzionerà per un periodo ragionevole con lo scopo di raccogliere dati. Durante la fase di costruzione, tutti i passi di assemblaggio verranno documentati. Alla fine del Progetto, un documento “tutorial” verrà editato e messo a disposizione on-line.
L’obiettivo della campagna di finanziamento è $ 12000 (USD) di cui abbiamo bisogno per tutti i costi relativi alla creazione, la documentazione, i perks, e la gestione di un sito web dedicato.
Non vogliamo ottenere fondi per nient’altro. I risultati di questa campagna saranno:
- un dettagliato tutorial su come costruire un collettore ARETHA da 6 m2, con materiali riciclati
column6: >n sito web e un forum per fornire informazioni circa ogni collettore ARETHA costruito dalle persone partecipanti, permettendo loro di scambiarsi idee e esperienze.

column1: Questo sforzo non può essere sostenuto senza il tuo contributo! ARETHA non può diventare un prodotto commerciale, il nostro intento è di consentire alle persone di imparare a costruirne uno da sole, specialmente nei paesi in via di sviluppo.
Puoi aiutarci anche solamente  partecipando alla comunità di ARETHA con i tuoi suggerimenti e parlando della tua esperienza nel costruire pannelli solari termici.
Segui ARETHA Project su Facebook

column4:

Maggiori informazioni su quello che abbiamo già fatto:

ARETHA in Costa Del Grillo

schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

ARETHA Nosedo (Milan)

Still working, this prototype has a surface area of 5 m2 and a tank of 950 liters. On May Day, ARETHA has warmed from 30 to 40°C in a not very sunny day.

La potenza del radiatore di auto deve essere proporzionata alla superficie esposta di ARETHA. Il radiatore deve avere il suo ventilatore originale o uno simile. Una semplice pompa “circolatore” provvede a far circolare l’acqua nel circuito primario. Sì, ARETHA necessita di elettricità, ma il consumo della pompa e del ventilatore sono minimi confrontati al guadagno di energia nell’acqua calda.

ARETHA è controllato da Arduino, la scheda a microcontrollore open-hardware famosa in tutto il mondo. Lo scopo principale di questo sistema di controllo è quello di accendere pompa e ventilatore solo quando la differenza di temperatura tra aria e acqua oltrepassa una determinata soglia. Arduino misura le temperature in diversi punti di ARETHA per mezzo di sensori integrati digitali, come i Dallas DS18B20. Una scheda Data Logger provvede ad archiviare i dati su una SD card e, opzionalmente, una scheda Ethernet invia i dati su Internet. Schemi elettrici e software sono open-source.

Un primo prototipo sperimentale di circa 10 m2, è stato costruito a Milano ed è tuttora funzionante. Ha prodotto una grande quantità di dati che hanno permesso una migliore comprensione dei principi di funzionamento e di come ottimizzare l’efficienza energetica.Questo prototipo è stato finanziato e incoraggiato dall’associazione no-profit CISE2007.What We Need & What You GetThe ARETHA Project intends to demonstrate the feasibility of a 6 sq m collector, made by pallets, sheep wool and other easy to find materials. The collector will be built by no-specialized people, during the workshop  Trasformatorio, an international laboratory focusing on all that is related to site-specific and sustainable performance. The location will be the village of Montalbano Elicona (Sicily-Italy). The prototype will work there for a reasonable period in order to collect data. During the building phase, all the steps will be reported. At the end of the Project, a tutorial document will be edited and shared on Internet.

The fund campaign goal is $ 12000 (USD), that we need to fund the cost of the materials for this prototype, all the costs related to the documentation, perks and travel for one of the authors and the management of a dedicated  web site.
We don’t want to rise money for anything else. The results of this campaign should be:
· A detailed tutorial on how to make a 6 sq m ARETHA collector by recycled materials
· A web site and a forum  to provide information about every ARETHA collector built by people, allowing them to exchange ideas and experience.
This effort cannot be done without money! ARETHA cannot become a commercial product because we want the people learn to make it yourself, especially in developing countries.
You can help us even only participating to the ARETHA community with your suggestion and telling us your experience in making solar thermal collector.
Follow the ARETHA Project on Facebook
Di cosa abbiamo bisogno e cosa riceverai

Il progetto ARETHA intende dimostrare la realizzabilità di un collettore di 6 m2, fatto di bancali di legno, lana di pecora e altri materiali facili da trovare. Il collettore sarà costruito da persone non specializzate, durante il workshop “Trasformatorio”, un laboratorio internazionale artistico focalizzato su tutto ciò che è sostenibile e “site-specific”. Il luogo di costruzione si trova presso il Comune di Montalbano Elicona in Sicilia (ME). Il prototipo funzionerà per un periodo ragionevole con lo scopo di raccogliere dati. Durante la fase di costruzione, tutti i passi di assemblaggio verranno documentati. Alla fine del Progetto, un documento “tutorial” verrà editato e messo a disposizione on-line.
L’obiettivo della campagna di finanziamento è $ 12000 (USD) di cui abbiamo bisogno per tutti i costi relativi alla creazione, la documentazione, i perks, e la gestione di un sito web dedicato.
Non vogliamo ottenere fondi per nient’altro. I risultati di questa campagna saranno:
- un dettagliato tutorial su come costruire un collettore ARETHA da 6 m2, con materiali riciclati
column2: - un sito web e un forum per fornire informazioni circa ogni collettore ARETHA costruito dalle persone partecipanti, permettendo loro di scambiarsi idee e esperienze.

column1: Questo sforzo non può essere sostenuto senza il tuo contributo! ARETHA non può diventare un prodotto commerciale, il nostro intento è di consentire alle persone di imparare a costruirne uno da sole, specialmente nei paesi in via di sviluppo.
Puoi aiutarci anche solamente  partecipando alla comunità di ARETHA con i tuoi suggerimenti e parlando della tua esperienza nel costruire pannelli solari termici.
Segui ARETHA Project su Facebook

More info about what we have already done: Maggiori informazioni su quello che abbiamo già fatto:ARETHA in Costa Del GrilloARETHA in MilanARETHA Nosedo (Milan)Still working, this prototype has a surface area of 5 m2 and a tank of 950 liters. On May Day, ARETHA has warmed from 30 to 40°C in a not very sunny day.",17.0,3,"1 Campaign

HELLO EVERYONE,

WELCOME TO THE PAGE.

Reduce AC
Electricity Cost by 5-20%. Yes that’s our title for our campaign. We are a
small but a very very passionate group of Independent Scientific Researcher’s
with a combined experience of more than 20 years. We are very passionate in
what we do because we believe it has the potential to change the world we live
in. We have Successfully done research in many areas and achieved our success
in our way by helping people.
We now want
to push ourselves to achieve something bigger that will help the world in a
major way. Our Research project is to Reduce Air Conditioning or AC cost by
atleast 5-20%.We will focus our research In Home Air Conditioning in Window AC
and Split AC. Today Global warming and Global climate change has put lot of
load on Air Conditioning. Developed countries as well as developing countries
are now hugely dependent on AC cooling. This is also creating a huge pollution
problem very high carbon emissions increasing more carbon foot print day by day.
to a 2012 report a rough estimate of all Air Conditioning system Including
Residential and Commercial use Worldwide use of electricity consumption is
around one trillion kilowatt-Hour annually and is continuously growing at huge
rate and most of the electricity is generated by coal thus increasing carbon emissions
and creating more pollution and destroying the ecology of the world.
Our goal
here is to improve the designs and mechanisms of the AC systems that will surely
save atleast 5-20% electricity which also help in reducing carbon emissions and
reduce Pollution and save our ecology for the best for all.
We are very
very excited in this research and your Contributions will help in changing the
world which will definitely help everyone. Join us in OUR Journey. We are sure
you will appreciate yourselves.
This is a
research project to lower the electricity cost of AC by 5-20%. We have done
some experiments of our own and seen some promising results but to achieve more
and greater results we need to meet our funding goal. This will be our minimum
requirement. The money will mostly go in research to purchase expensive testing
equipments for Analyzing designs of Air
Conditioners and the whole Mechanism of Air
Conditioners. We want to take a completely new approach to Residential Air
Conditioning. All this is going to cost. We have to Import some equipments
which may be necessary as the Research goes ahead. We already have some Designs
and concepts on which we have worked but to execute it we need atleast meet our
funding goal.We are very optimistic with our experiments that we have already
done and shown some promising results So we are here on this crowdfunding
platform to urge you to support us by your contributions.
We will
atleast spend whole one year on the Research Our whole time and energy will be
to achieve 5-20% saving on electricity cost.The time period of research depends
on when it is achieved it may take one year or less depending on as research
progresses. In this time we will make our prototype and take valuable
measurements needed for Research.
As of now
we cannot disclose our concepts and designs on which we got promising results
because we don’t have any copyrights or patents on that.
What is in it for me?
If you
support our Campaign you are helping us to create something good for the
world.This is a time of crisis on pollution level our whole ecology is disturbed
if we could make it a little bit better our future generations will benefit from
it and also we all will be able to save money on Air Conditioning Electricity. We
personally think if we could do something better for the whole world that is
the most rewarding feeling one can get.
If you
Support us we have made some PERKS, just our way to say Thanks to you.
have Personally Composed Nature Relaxing Music.All the tracks are in mp3 format
and all the tracks are different. It will help you in stress and there are lot
other benefits of listening to Nature Music.We have put lot of effort in making
these audio tracks.We are confident you will like it.

Impact of our Research


Today our
world uses more than one Trillion kilowatt-hour annually. U.S.A. Alone uses a
lot of electricity just for Air Conditioning compared to the whole world and
other developing economies in Southeast Asia<span>
are buying more and more AC’s according to the climate change. India and
China are becoming the largest consumer of home Air Conditioning Systems
whether Window AC or Split AC. Middle East is already dependent on AC’s. Lot of
the electricity generated is from coal increasing Carbon emissions. According
to some reports majority of electricity is used for AC’s for cooling. Mumbai a
financial capital of India uses 40% of the electricity only on AC’s for cooling.
Despite having electricity connection in many parts of the world there is still
major cut offs and blackout only to meet AC electricity needs. Unfortunately
other renewable energy systems like Solar energy etc. are also not able to
fulfill the electricity needs because the demands are rising constantly.
If we succeed
in our Research we can save 5-20% on AC Electricity bill which will help the whole
world by reducing Carbon emissions which will provide more cleaner air.We save
money on AC Electricity bill which saves our money.In conclusion it helps
Individuals as well as the whole world.
Risk and Challenges
Whatever Success
we have found in our experiments we are very optimistic but in Research We want to
stress that any Research is the most demanding of all whether its money,time or
energy.Very big companies shy away from research as there is always
uncertainity. We will try new methods which will help to reach our goal. Our
reaching the funding goal is very important to us as only then we will be able to do extensive Research. So support us in reaching our funding goal.We
will be investing lot of time and energy.
Other Ways you can Support us
Please help
us by spreading the word and letting everyone know this World changing Research
we are working now.<span>  We are looking
forward for your Support, With Your Support We will Definitely succeed.
let
everyone know what we are working by linking to us on Facebook and other social media.

THANKS FOR YOUR VISIT.

Who We Are
Hey everyone! We're Sonnets for Sandy! We're a group of eighth graders living in New York City. We all go to Hunter College High School.

Our group originally started out raising money for Hurricane Sandy relief. We started out as part of the HONY Tumblr campaign, but continued to raise money after their campaign ended. We run a blog, and also have a Facebook Page.
Now, we are raising money for disaster relief. All of our proceeds will go to Doctor's Without Borders.
<div>
How it Works
<ol>
• Donate online
• Email us at sonnets4sandy@gmail.com, and tell us the name the donation was made under, and how much you donated
<li>If you requested a portrait -<ol>
• Attach an image in the email that you would like us to base the portrait off of
• If you requested any type of portrait besides the acrylic painting, we will email you an image of your portrait
• If you requested an acrylic painting, we will ship the canvas containing your portrait to your home
• If you requested a poem, send us a very brief description of what you would like the poem to be about. We will email the poem back to you
<div>

In addition to fundraising online, we also travel around the city. We will anounce on our Facebook Page or our Tumblr Page where we will be next. If you are unable to donate online, you can also donate in person!

Hi. I am Vitaly Chuprina.
I live in Ukraine. Recently you often hear about our country.
However except war, Chernobyl, revolution on a Maidan, our country to eat than surprise the world.
It is the big country in Europe, rich in fertile lands and kind people.
What brought me here?
I have a dream. To put a big garden.

What purpose at me?
My purpose - a garden on cultivation of a walnut прощадью 10 hectares.
I want to plant more than 1250 trees in this territory. In ten years I would like to increase the area of a garden to 50 hectares (these are more than 6000 trees).
Why I didn't address to bank behind money?
The reason is simple. In our country the bank issues the credit under 22-27 percent a year. These are huge money, it is independent to me them not to collect.
Besides, the bank asks to start repaying percent in a month after delivery of money.
Feature of my project is that the first small profit will appear 5 years later after landing of the first trees.
What results will be brought by this project?
1. I will be able to realize my dream.
2. For ten the garden will grow by proshchad of 50 hectares (these are more than 6000 trees).
3. Improvement of ecology of the region.
4. Thousands of birds will find a place of continuous nesting.
5. Workplaces that for my region very important will be created.
What difficulties can arise?
I think the biggest problem there can be only a weather (hard and long frosts for trees are pernicious).
About what sum there is a speech?
For realization of a proyeekt I need to collect 35000 USD.
On what this money will go?


17% - income tax.
Other money will be spent for purchase of saplings of trees (one sapling costs about 15 dollars, it is necessary to buy 1250 saplings), preparation and the statement in government bodies of the plan of landing of a garden. Other money will be spent for a rent for the earth, the analysis of soil, preparation of the earth for landing of saplings, planting of trees, watering and care of the earth and trees within 5 years.
Only in 5 years from the moment of landing of the first tree I can count small to arrive to the first.
Why you can help me:
- this project is based on organic ways of agriculture. Only organic (natural) fertilizers and any chemistry
column4: - you awake more than 6000 trees are involved in landing
column5:
- to that that for you it will cost only some dollars, and for me it will give the chance to realize my dream.

How Can You Help Me?
Please, divide our project, and needs with your family, friends and colleagues of work everywhere. You remember, each tree this our future, our clean air. Alternatively you can want to carry out mini-action for a whip-round with the family, a workplace or the area, and to offer funds lifted to our project.

Each donator will receive the personified electronic certificate sent by e-mail, recognizing your valuable contribution.
Other Ways You Can Help

I personally understand how hard it is for some of you out there.  If you can't personally contribute, please:

  Forward this campaign using Indiegogo's sharing tools to people you know who love the environment as much as I do and may have an interest in contributing.
  Donate your services!  If you do marketing, branding, web design, or have any knowledge that you think would be useful in building my business, I would appreciate it!

For any inquiries please contact us on chuprina.w@gmail.com
I hope you will find my project interesting.
I ask to send the link to this project to the friends and acquaintances.
It is sure, together at us everything will turn out.

The Impact
<ul>
<ul>
• According to the American Bird Conservancy (ABC) free-roaming cats are directly responsible for the extinction of 33 species worldwide.
<li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >We now know that free-roaming cats
column3: >kill up to 4 billion birds
column4: > each year in the United States alone.

column1: <li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column4: > due to automotive accidents, increased risk of altercations with dogs or other cats, cruelty by humans, exposure to illness and parasites, and predation by wildlife.

column1:
How We Will Accomplish This

We seek to address these issues through education and hands-on activism. What does this entail? Five main ways will be used to achieve these goals.
<ol>
• We will trap, neuter, and return feral cats and maintain their colonies. This includes providing regular, good quality food, medical care and regular check-ups, and shelter.
• Outdoor cats which are sociable or young will be transitioned to indoor living by volunteers and fostered by these same people until they've adjusted and are ready to be adopted out.

• We will have strict adoption standards. The foster will do a home visit and sit down with each resident of the house to discuss their feelings on bringing the cat home. The cat will not be allowed to free-roam, any time outside will be on a harness or in a secure, outdoor enclosure. The cat will not be declawed unless medically necessary. The cat will be fed good-quality food. These are just a few of the requirements we will implement for the adoption of our cats.
• We will build outdoor enclosures for those who desire them but are unable to afford them, our volunteers will also offer positive reinforcement based harness training for interested parties.

• We will provide motion activated sprinklers, scat mats, or ultrasonic deterrents to those who do not want cats in their yard. This will reduce violent retaliation against free-roaming cats by preventing them from being a nuisance.
Finances

We're asking for a whole lot of money, why? We will be donation run and thus need to obtain enough money prior to start off so as to keep us going until we are established and can depend on regular donations.
The money we raise here will be used to hire an accountant, start up a website, and hire legal aid. The remainder of the money will be put towards the services discussed in the previous section.
","The Impact
According to the American Bird Conservancy (ABC) free-roaming cats are directly responsible for the extinction of 33 species worldwide.
We now know that free-roaming cats kill up to 4 billion birds each year in the United States alone.

Outdoor cats have drastically reduced lifespans due to automotive accidents, increased risk of altercations with dogs or other cats, cruelty by humans, exposure to illness and parasites, and predation by wildlife.
How We Will Accomplish ThisWe seek to address these issues through education and hands-on activism. What does this entail? Five main ways will be used to achieve these goals.
We will trap, neuter, and return feral cats and maintain their colonies. This includes providing regular, good quality food, medical care and regular check-ups, and shelter.
Outdoor cats which are sociable or young will be transitioned to indoor living by volunteers and fostered by these same people until they've adjusted and are ready to be adopted out.

We will have strict adoption standards. The foster will do a home visit and sit down with each resident of the house to discuss their feelings on bringing the cat home. The cat will not be allowed to free-roam, any time outside will be on a harness or in a secure, outdoor enclosure. The cat will not be declawed unless medically necessary. The cat will be fed good-quality food. These are just a few of the requirements we will implement for the adoption of our cats.
We will build outdoor enclosures for those who desire them but are unable to afford them, our volunteers will also offer positive reinforcement based harness training for interested parties.

We will provide motion activated sprinklers, scat mats, or ultrasonic deterrents to those who do not want cats in their yard. This will reduce violent retaliation against free-roaming cats by preventing them from being a nuisance.
Finances

We're asking for a whole lot of money, why? We will be donation run and thus need to obtain enough money prior to start off so as to keep us going until we are established and can depend on regular donations.The money we raise here will be used to hire an accountant, start up a website, and hire legal aid. The remainder of the money will be put towards the services discussed in the previous section.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Nationwide, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cats-indoors/pica

Please help Fukushima children to participate in our radiation relief program at Okinawa KuminoSato

 

My name is Yukiko Mukai.  I'm the board chairman of a Japanese non-profit organization called Okinawa Kuminosato.  We operate radiation relief programs for Fukushima children.  These children are facing an invisible threat of radioactivity in their everyday lives.  They are forced to stay away from the natural outdoor environment because it holds more radiation than indoor, concrete environments.

We invite 50 children per excursion to travel to Okinawa to experience a normal, natural environment free of radioactivity. The children spend 10 to 14 days in our facility enjoying various programs such as exploring the beautiful tropical beaches, observing small creature in the creeks, and simply running and playing in nature. None of these activities are allowed in their hometowns in the Fukushima region due to the contamination. We also provide healthy, handmade meals with safe local food.

There is a study that states if someone spends 3 weeks removed from radioactive exposure, most of the radioactivity will dissipate from the body. We encourage all children to visit Kumi-no-Sato twice a year to improve their health and wellbeing.

All our operating funds come from donations around the world with some government and corporate funding. This allows children to travel and participate in our program with little expense.  We also rely heavily on volunteers to operate this program.  We organize 14 to 16 programs a year, depending on our budget.  We run 2 separate programs, one for children from the age of 6 to 15, and one for pre-school children and infants with their mothers.  Each program costs about USD26,500 to USD44,200.

We are asking for donations to reach our goal of USD20,000 to pay these expenses.

Thank you very much for your interest.  I would really appreciate if you would spend a little time reading the article below to better understand the problems we are facing in Fukushima.

 

7 Years from the Fukushima Nuclear Disaster

It’s been 7 years since the Fukushima nuclear power plant disaster that was caused by a tsunami from a 9.0 magnitude earthquake in northern Japan in March 2011. Tragically, there are still children living daily with radioactive contamination in Fukushima. 

Radiation doesn't remain on blacktop and concrete surfaces. However, it stays active for a long time, and somehow recycles itself, in the natural environment within the soil, water, plants and other organic materials and living things.  Parks, rivers, fields, forests and beaches are highly susceptible.  These are the places that absorb and hold more radiation.  There are hot spots like these throughout Fukushima and some neighboring regions.  Sadly, such wonderful opportunities to play in the natural environments have been taken away from these children.  There are 7-year-old children in the Fukushima region that have spent their entire lives indoors, and have never played in nature due to the severity of the contamination.

Here is an English movie by NPO Mother's Radiation Lab Fukushima.  We work closely with this organization. This footage accurately describes the kind of situation Fukushima mothers are faced with, and the high-level of anxiety and stress they have to deal with.

https://tarachineiwaki.org/english
column3:
showinfo=0"">

 

Living in Radioactive Contamination

Radiation exists normally in small amounts in nature.  We are exposed to approximately 0.04μSv from the soil.  The Japanese government sets the safe standard for living with air radiation exposure at 0.23μSv per hour. 

In 2015, holding the radiation counter in our hands, we checked out a couple of parks in Koriyama, a city with a population of 330,000, about 60km away from the nuclear power plant.  The following movie shows the readings.  The numbers are ""μSv per hour"".  According to the government guideline, the maximum radiation one can live in is 0.23. You can see these parks, right in the middle of the residential area with schools, showing far more radiation than normal radiation levels, and in many spots, higher radiation than the government guideline.
column5:
showinfo=0"">

 

You might say this is not severe enough radiation to cause immediate death or illness.  It is said that 2000mSv of radiation in a short time would lead to a 5% mortality rate.  If you stay a whole year in a hot spot of 0.4μSv per hour at that corner of the park, you would be exposed to 3.5mSv per year.  That may seem to be a small amount compared to the dangerous 2000mSv level.  It’s true that it’s not of immediate danger, but accumulated radiation exposure over time can damage DNA and greatly risk one’s health.  Also you can't see, smell or feel radiation so it may go unnoticed until it’s too late.  If you live in this region radiation is an everyday threat.  You should avoid the exposure as much as possible, including internal radiation dosages through inhalation and ingestion of contaminated foods.

You may wonder why people are still living in such an environment.  Some families have moved out of Fukushima.  The population has reduced by 8% since 2011.  Yet, the majority has stayed in Fukushima for various family and financial reasons.  Moreover, many have moved into Fukushima because the government recovery projects are creating new jobs.  There's an unspoken code for the majority of the residents, ""We have to live here anyway, so let's not talk about radiation.""

In the meantime, conscientious mothers have to be safe by buying expensive foods from far away and avoiding cheaper local foods in fear of contamination.  Mothers need to keep telling their children, ""Don't touch that."" ""Don't play in that park."" ""You can't eat this."" in heartbreaking determination to avoid radiation exposure.  This means taking away opportunities for children to play, learn and nourish themselves in nature.

Either due to this ongoing stress or from actual radioactive exposure, or maybe because these children haven't spent much time outside in nature, we are seeing Fukushima children become extremely vulnerable to illness. They become sick more easily and have developed allergic reactions to foods and insect bites.

 

Many Children Have Developed Thyroid Cancer

Thyroid Cancer is one of the first symptoms seen after high radiation exposure.  The Fukushima government conducts screening test every 2 years on all children who were 0 to 18 years of age at the time of the disaster.  Now, as of July 2018, 198 children have been discovered to have thyroid cancer. 

Before 2011, thyroid cancer was a rare disease for children in Japan, only 3 children out of 1,000,000.  The rate of thyroid cancer in the effected Fukushima area is now more than 500 children out of 1,000,000.  Also, in 2018, more and more children have contracted thyroid cancer in the neighboring prefectures.  The Japanese government denies this correlation with the nuclear disaster, while many doctors have sounded the alarm about the dire situation. 

In Chernobyl, serious health issues started turning up 5 years after their nuclear disaster.  We believe that this number in Fukushima will continue to grow. The Fukushima situation desperately requires closer attention for many years to come, and the children need more opportunities to cleanse the contamination and stress from their bodies.

 

3 weeks away from radioactivity releases contamination

There are several studies to support that three weeks away from radioactivity exposure will detox the contamination from the body.  This is based on the results of the Whole Body Counter test, conducted in Chernobyl and in Fukushima. Also, shown below is the measurement of urinary cesium before and after a 17-day program. The reduction of the cesium level is substantial.  Blue is the individual readings before the program and Red is after.

 

Please help Kuminosato

Kuminosato is a non-profit organization founded in July 2012 by Ryuichi Hirokawa. Mr Hirokawa is a renowned photo journalist for the publication, Days Japan. He knew the Fukushima people needed this kind of program from his dedicated research on Chernobyl.  Thanks to generous donations and contributions from all over the world, we now own 2900㎡(0.7 acre) of land atop a hill on Kumejima Island in Okinawa overlooking the beautiful ocean. Our facility has a comfortable lodge that accommodates 50 children and includes lots of indoor spaces and outdoor playgrounds..

 

As of August 2018, we have successfully conducted a total of 95 programs helping 3,291 children over 6 years.  They stay in Okinawa's beautiful natural environment for a couple of weeks, completely away from radioactivity, eating all handmade, healthy local foods.  Many of the children have never seen the ocean.  They enjoy exploring nature out of pure curiosity without being restricted as they usually are back home.  We also provide thyroid inspections and massage treatments by volunteer doctors and therapists.

 

The natural environment is such a precious playground that all children deserve.  This is where children develop curiosity, learning skills, social skills, physical strength, and immune system.  It is our responsibility as grownups to provide such opportunities to all children.

 

Thank you very much for your concern for the wellbeing of Fukushima’s children and your help to support this very important program.  We would greatly appreciate it if you would share this information through your online network and through word of mouth.

**** UPDATE ****
Things are going a little slower than expected
column2: to meet the funding goal we need to be tracking about $220 in pre-orders per day.

column1: To help rectify this, I am offering $500 to the person that generates the highest number of referrals if we meet our funding goal. Be sure to be using the share this campaign link above (starts with http://igg.me/) so that your referrals are tracked!
Thanks for your help and GOOD LUCK!

Hi!  I'm Nick.  I'm a recent Colorado State University grad in mechanical engineering and now live and work in the Boston area.  This indiegogo campaign is to help fund the tooling and production of an idea I've had kicking around for way too long... the Working Dog: The Dog Collar Bottle Opener.
Obviously this idea has a story behind it.  My girlfriend and I have a dog named Lucy.  She's a black lab, border collie mix that we picked up at a shelter while we were in college.

The three of us do everything together!  We lived in one of the most amazing beer friendly towns in the US so the first thing we did was put a gigantic bottle opener on her collar and found severe problems with it:
<ul>
• Its loud.  If you are trying to sleep and the dog decides to move, that bottle opener is clanking against the tag just as loud as your alarm clock.
• Opening a beer underneath the dog's head is a challenge.  She always wants to see what you are trying to do so it becomes less useful.
So after years of thought, we came up with the perfect design.  Put the opener on the side of the collar!  No more clanking with the tags and its way easier to open a beer!

The Working Dog is precision investment cast in the USA in 316 Stainless Steel and fits 1"" wide dog collars.

Let's make the world a better and cleaner place!!
It's good to see you are interested in this campaign. Take this oppertunity to be part of something special.

The Plastic Factory is founded by Wendy Hartog – a young a creator with a green mind based in Amsterdam. Her love for nature and wildlife was one of the main reasons that motivated her to start her plastic recycling project. With the help of designer Dave Hakkens’ open source recycling machines venture- Precious Plastics, Wendy has started a small plastic recycling factory. The plan is to reduce plastic pollution at a local level by boosting plastic recycling. The Plastic Factory believes that preventing improper disposal of plastic waste is the first step in decreasing plastic pollution.
How it works?

Why is this venture so different you ask? Well for starters it makes plastic recycling more accessible to local communities. The other great thing about it is how it makes plastic recycling more rewarding and fun to ensure wider and enthusiastic participation from people! The community can donate their own plastic waste from home or waste that they find on the streets, in the park, on the beach etc. to the factory. In return they will get rewarded for their donation. The venture believes that by giving value to plastic waste, improper disposal will decrease and nature clean ups will be stimulated.
Funding
We need funding for:
Building and improving
- Shredder
The shredder turns plastic waste into little flakes of plastic. This is the first step of the recycling proces.
- Compression
The plastic flakes are heated inside the oven and slowly pressed into a mold with a carjack. This machine is perfect for making more solid objects.
- Extrusion

The plastic flakes are inserted into the hopper and extruded into a line of plastic. These lines can be used to make new raw material such as 3d printing filament, spinned around a mold or used in and creative ways.
- Injection
The plastic flakes are insterted into the hopper and then melted. The melted plastic is the injected into a mold.
Workshop

A suitable workshop is needed to house the machines and for creating beautifull home decor. We already have a place in mind that we would like to move to. It's called Kunststad (art city) on the NDSM terrein in Amsterdam. This places houses painters, designers, sculpters, architects and other creative minds.
Webshop
To sell are product we need to have a simple webshop. So we can deliver these beautifull products to your home.
Future
Plastic pollution is a worldwide problem. Wendy's dream is to set up small workshops all over the world. Cleaning up nature, educating and creating job opportunities!!
Article
Urbanmeisters
http://www.urbanmeisters.com/plastic-recycling-...
Thank you!!
Join us for a cleaner and more beautifull future! GoGo and claim your perk now! Limited stock only.
The Plastic Factory Family

Have you ever felt that some problems are so big, so broad, that there's nothing you can do?

When it comes to problems like air pollution, climate change, and even high prices, these feelings are often justified, but now we have the oppurtunity to do something about it! In ways that go far beyond the simple acts of an individual. A relatively small group of people can change it all and fix it for good. Will you be one of them?
Energy is at the core of everything we know.
The way we create energy is broken.
Fixing it...
We're Trinity Powerworks, and we have a plan to fix it. Not just soften it. Fix it.

Most of the core technologies already exist. We just need to put them together in the right way and deploy them. Trinity Powerworks is working to harvest the power from the sun, in space where the sun shines constantly, and deliver it directly to the electric grid where it can be delivered to your home.
By doing this, we can lower the cost of energy, which, in turn, will lower the cost of most everything. And we can make fossil fuel power plants obsolete!
But we need your help to jump-start the process. We need to get the word out. We need that relatively small group of base customers to make it happen. We need YOU to help us make this happen!
Your contributions will be used to develop marketing materials and to make media purchases to get help spread the word and inform everyone about our Magical Gift Program.
Frankly though, the best advertising may just come from folks like you recommending this campaign to friends and family. The Indiegogo share tools make it simple!

If you haven't done so already, please be sure to watch our video and take a look at the great perks we're offering! Any contribution higher than the Magical Gift Program will also receive the Magical Gift Program automatically! Once you've made a contribution and recommended us to your friends, take the time to watch the detailed videos in the gallery.

Your contribution and information is protected by Indiegogo's secure servers. You can use your PayPal account or pay directly through PayPal without an account. And, we've chosen fixed funding so your contribution will be refunded if we don't meet our goal by the end of the campaign.

Note: The Magical Gift Program is only available in Maryland in the BGE, PEPCO, and DPL service areas, but we hope you'll support us even if you are outside of these areas. Some of the perks offered will require successful completion of not only this campaign but additional milestones as well.

The Jackrabbit Project
Our family has purchased a 20 acre parcel of land in Olancha, CA to create a Permaculture Oasis:
<ul>
• We will teach Cob construction, and create beautiful and artistic Cob dwellings for guests.
• We will green the desert, using our mountain spring to create a small oasis for Permaculture workshops, classes, festivals and events,
• We will use our creativity to manifest a Permaculture wonderland and inspire a generation(s) of folks to help save our world.

column2: >All my life, I, Ray Cirino, have wanted to create a Permaculture Wondercamp.  It's finally coming into existence and,

column5: >We Need your Love and Support Ojai!

column1: Please help me manifest this project at the highest level by supporting this project
<ul>
• We need funding to expand our Wind and Solar and power this project with clean renewable energy.
• We need funding to create a machine I am inventing, a Raygo Block press, to create unique and wonderful cob structures.
• We need funding for our general operating fund to help sustain and develop the site and protect it, as we create a place for our students to come and learn, sharing knowledge and inspiration.

Please help us reach our Ojai Fundraising Goal of $10,000.00 to help Launch this project and get off on the right footing.  

","The Jackrabbit Project
Our family has purchased a 20 acre parcel of land in Olancha, CA to create a Permaculture Oasis:
We will teach Cob construction, and create beautiful and artistic Cob dwellings for guests.
We will green the desert, using our mountain spring to create a small oasis for Permaculture workshops, classes, festivals and events,
We will use our creativity to manifest a Permaculture wonderland and inspire a generation(s) of folks to help save our world.
All my life, I, Ray Cirino, have wanted to create a Permaculture Wondercamp.  It's finally coming into existence and,
We Need your Love and Support Ojai!
Please help me manifest this project at the highest level by supporting this project
We need funding to expand our Wind and Solar and power this project with clean renewable energy.
We need funding to create a machine I am inventing, a Raygo Block press, to create unique and wonderful cob structures.
We need funding for our general operating fund to help sustain and develop the site and protect it, as we create a place for our students to come and learn, sharing knowledge and inspiration.
Please help us reach our Ojai Fundraising Goal of $10,000.00 to help Launch this project and get off on the right footing.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Leef's Story
Believing in the idea that Wearing is Sharing, even the smallest contribution can make the biggest difference in the life of someone less fortunate.

Our goal is to be able to donate to those less fortunate who indirectly effect our lives. By starting with neighboring cities, we can directly and positively effect those around us. Eventually, as our horizons broaden and as the word gets out, we will expand our donation and support to other states and countries as well. With the help of you, your friends, your family, and loved ones we can all change the world one person at a time.

On December 22, our first Leef event brought in over 400 articles of winter wear in approximately 40-50 large bags. We had the help of over 20 volunteers and even more people who donated clothing. Leef has hopes and beliefs that we can do even better on our next event.
We are going back to visit Los Angeles on March 23, 2013. With your help and support, we can change the lives of those less fortunate and really make an impact on someone's day.
<div>
<h2>Your Help &amp

Leef is aiming to fund at least $15,000 in order to help ensure that those in need get a fresh pair of socks, beanie, and a blanket during their cold nights. We want to break down where the funds are going and how you're helping make a difference:
<ul>
<li><strong><span style=""text-decoration: underline
column2: >The majority of the funds will go to fulfilling the initial purchase order for all Leef goods and to ensure there will be hundreds of socks, blankets, and beanies to donate on March 23rd.

column1: <ul>
<li><strong><span style=""text-decoration: underline
column2: >The remaining funds will be set aside to make sure Leef is completely incorporated within the United States and prepare for the next event in the summer.

column1: <ul>
<li><strong><span style=""text-decoration: underline
column2: >With each and any of your Leef Donation purchases below, a like item will be guarenteed be donated to someone in need on the March 23rd event.

column1: <ul>
<li><strong><span style=""text-decoration: underline
column2: >As well as a direct donation to a person in need, Leef will also plant a new tree with the American Forests™ Foundation.

column1: Leef Apparel includes:
Your Impact
<div>

With your help, Leef can make sure that there will be plenty of warm clothing necessities for the homeless in Los Angeles to wear. As we grow, we want to visit more neighboring cities and make sure the youth of today are well clothed and taken care of in order to change the futures of tomorrow.
Make a stance for those people who are not as priviledged as those around us and lets try and create positive changes for their lives.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot help Leef with any donations, there are plenty of other ways to help those in need:
- Donate any of your unwanted clothing to a Leef rep, visit www.leeflife.com for more info.
- Tell your family and friends about Leef, how they can help donate their clothing and time, and what we are all about.
- Share the Leef video and message with your Facebook friends and let others know where and how they can donate on www.leeflife.com :)
Thanks for taking the time to see what Leef is all about and we hope that with your help today, we can make a huge difference in someones life tomorrow.

The majority of the funds will go to fulfilling the initial purchase order for all Leef goods and to ensure there will be hundreds of socks, blankets, and beanies to donate on March 23rd.
The remaining funds will be set aside to make sure Leef is completely incorporated within the United States and prepare for the next event in the summer.

As well as a direct donation to a person in need, Leef will also plant a new tree with the American Forests™ Foundation.

7 Things You Didn't Know About...Moringa
The tall, thin moringa tree has been used
for centuries as a cure-all in its native Indian and North Africa. With the
renewed interest in holistic health and Ayurvedic medicine here in the west,
moringa is finally crossing the shores, and recently landed on my health-foodie
radar.
It’s a food that makes a strong first
impression, given the significant effects it can have on the human body. While
I was initially impressed by its nutrient profile (loaded with 90 nutrients
including all nine essential amino acids, making it one of the few plant-based
complete proteins), I was a little taken aback to discover its irreversible
effects on female fertility!
The potency of moringa serves as a great
reminder of how powerful our foods really are, and how important it is to do
your research before jumping on any new health food bandwagon. No doubt this
“miracle tree” can do great things for your body, but it’s essential to know
all of the other impacts it can have.
Luckily, I’ve given you a head start on
this one, with 7 facts I bet you didn’t know about moringa:
1. Moringa is a world
traveler:While
moringa is native to southern Asia and northern Africa, you can now find it
growing all across the world. Commercial production of moringa has not only
spread through the rest of Africa and Asia, new farms have also sprung up in
Central America, South America, and even Hawaii. Because it doesn’t do well in
colder weather, there isn’t currently any large-scale American production of
moringa, though you may find farms growing it in southern states like Florida.
You could luck out and find it at a farmers market, or you could actually try
growing it yourself if you live in a warm climate, though the easiest route to
get it is to simply purchase it in powdered form from a health store.
2. Moringa is a traditional
cure-all:Moringa
got its nickname, “miracle-tree,” from its varied characteristics and purposes
including its ability to treat a wide variety of ailments.Sciencehas proven than it does indeed posses a
number of medicinal qualities, including being an antibacterial, antiviral,
antifungal, and antiinflammatory, which would explain why it grew to prominence
as a cure-all.
Different parts of the tree,
including the leaves, flowers, and seeds, have each been used to treat
different ailments. Traditionally, its leaves were steeped in water to make tea
as a treatment for diarrhea, fevers, or various infections. The flowers can
also be used to make tea, and have been used to improve the quality and amount
of a mother’s breast milk. The leaves or crushed seeds were made into poultices
to treat wounds, as they have antibacterial and antifungal properties. Due to
its high nutritional content, moringa is also an important food source in some
parts of the world, particularly in India and Africa, where it is used in
feeding programs to fight malnutrition. The pods, which are called drumsticks,
are prepared similar to green beans, and the seeds are cooked like peas or
roasted like nuts. The leaves are sometimes cooked like spinach, or the
powdered leaves used as a condiment.
3. Moringa is a natural
birth control:Moringa,
like many other Indian herbs, has been found to be an effective antifertility
treatment in bothin vitroand animal studies. Therefore, women
in their childbearing years should avoid it completely. The plant chemicals in
moringa root, (which are more potent than the leaves) have been found to cause
a fertilized egg not to be able to attach to the lining of the uterine wall,
preventing pregnancy, as detailed in thisstudy. It
is unclear whether moringa leaves will have the same affect (simply because
there are no studies that disprove this), so it’s best to be precautionary.
Once pregnant, there is indeedevidencethat
ingesting the less potent moringa leaves will cause a miscarriage 100% of the
time. Traditional literature indicates that moringa was used as a<a href=""http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1924986/"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">permanent
form of birth control, and even today, in certain parts of India, like West Bengal,
it is taken by prostitutes to avoid unwanted pregnancies. So ladies, step away
from the moringa until you’re sure you don’t want kids. Women who are not
looking to get pregnant and men shouldn’t be adversely affected from moringa
leaves.Moringa root should be avoided by all, as it not only prevents
pregnancy, but also contains toxins that can be lethal.
4. Moringa empowers female
farmers:Despite
not being a particularly female-friendly herb (see point 3 above), moringa is
grown largely by women. The moringa tree is now widely cultivated across Africa
through women’s agricultural cooperatives. The ease of cultivation, hardiness,
and diverse uses of moringa have made it an excellent business opportunity for
the women in these cooperatives. Through their farm work, women are able to
generate income, fight back against poverty and malnutrition, and gain
bargaining power within their communities.
5. Moringa can purify water:Thanks to its antimicrobial
and coagulant properties, moringa seeds are used to purify water cheaply and
effectively. They work to kill bacteria while also forcing any large particles
(like clay or silt) to be pushed to the bottom of the container so they can be
filtered out.  Because the seeds are abundant in many countries, and clean
water scarce, this helps solve a real dilemma, and contributes to its “miracle
tree” nickname.
6. Moringa can survive in the
craziest places:Although
deep frosts can knock out a moringa tree, it can survive in many other harsh
conditions that would destroy most plants. Moringa can endure and thrive in dry
and drought prone areas, bad soil, and the banks of the salty sea.
7. Moringa may help fight
cancer:The
entire moringa tree, including its seeds, leaves, bark, and roots contain
compounds, like niaziminin, which have been shown to <a href=""http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1924986/"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">inhibit
cancer cell growth. Animal studies utilizing an aqueous extract specifically from
the root of the moringa plant have demonstrated its ability to inhibit the
growth of ovarian cancer.  While more research needs to be done, the sheer
number of nutrients and antioxidants in moringa make it a promising anti-cancer

candidate.
